v-nYraRGBM_lMq2hHkvAKQ.text: This will be the last time we visit.   The service was slow and not welcoming.  It took too long for us to order and even refill our coffee.  Waitresses had attitudes that you can see with each other just sitting at the bench area. Totally dis functional.   Once the food finally came, we had burnt but yet undercooked potatoes and burnt with undercooked bacon.   How is that possible ? Not evenly cooked at all!!!  While watching the waitresses, they would take orders touch everything then go and put bread on the toaster!! No hand washing!!!!  Needless to say we didn't eat our toast once arrived.  Once we are done it took 5 mins standings at the register for someone to check us out since they seem to not help each other.   Sorry delucas but we will not be back. For 30 dollar breakfast I expected a lot more.

5tf7E6gDGGxUEqG-jHHx2A.text: After reading some of the negative  remarks I had to chime in.  First and foremost please realize this is a local, greasy spoon, neighborhood, breakfast like dinner with history, reputation and the Burg flare.  Is that a run-on sentence? Anyway, I doubt anyone from California will "get it".  Although I would expect those from the east coast or even the great lake cities to be able to identify with it.  This isn't a bad thing.  I appreciate trendy light food as much as the next Yelper, but don't go here looking for a fusion dinner with wi-fi and a coffee bar.  Yes, bring cash, be willing to wait in line, and it is a little dirty.   I am a coffee snob, so they could improve their coffee.  But, the staff is fun, the kitchen is quick and the portions are big.  The food is good hardy breakfast food.  My son particularly likes to get the waffles with ice cream.  Being an athlete who can't consumes enough calories in a day, I say go for it!  The other  kids like the pancakes while my wife and I like the omelets...   Enjoy before heading out to the strip to buy some fresh food!   Or, if its been a long night,  enjoy before heading home to bed...You decide.

qwkPuAya522yaApjjx1_mQ.text: Deluca's is the other famous breakfast diner in Pittsburgh.  Like Pamela's, its independently owned, but offers amazing breakfast/brunch/lunch foods.  On weekends they have Lobser Bisque!  Every time I went to Strip District I've always seen kajillion people outside waiting in line, so I decided that I want to try it.  Like Pamela's, they offer a variety of breakfast foods, although more.  The options range from omelets to pancakes to hot cakes and crepes and waffles, and then sandwiches and soups.  I ordered Nutella Chocolate Banana Crepe, and the Sheep ordered their special for today, Cheeseburger Omelets which came with homefries.  I really loved my crepe.  It was wrapped around creamy ricotta cheese, a banana, chocolate chips, and Nutella spread.  However, the crepe itself was thicker than I expected - I would say it was more like a hotcake.  However, they also have hotcakes and pancakes, so I'm assuming hotcakes are even thicker (or greasier, since the Pamela's ones are).  The thing that I loved about the meal was that it was not greasy.  Pamela's is too greasy for me; it makes me feel like I just chugged a bottle of oil by the time I finish the meal.  Also, the ricotta cheese inside the crepe was amazing.  It was creamy, and went really well to balance out the sweetness of Nutella and chocolate chips.  Overall, this is possibly the best crepe I have ever had.  The Sheep really liked the cheeseburger omelet too.  He said that it just tasted like hamburger meat and eggs at first, but as he ate closer to the center it became really cheesey, and he loved it.  The home fries were crispy and was good.  He really loved his meal too.  The only problem with this diner is that the wait was very long.  It took us probably 20 minutes to get in, which was around 9:30am.  By the time we left, probably 10:30 ish the line was still as long.  I would say it is very much worth the wait, even under the hot sun.  =)

dCo609sgRI80Q9X9rTsd1Q.text: Filling, fried breakfasts don't get any better than Deluca's. I was tempted to go here by the Pittsburgh episode of Man v. Food. My wife, her friend, and I got there early, around 8:00 on a Saturday morning, which was a bit painful on the weekend, but I am very glad we came when we did. Although we were seated immediately upon our arrival, by the time we left, an hour later, the line to get in was half way around the block!  Our waitress was extremely friendly, which was reassuring, because I think that waitstaff in popular, crowded establishments can be off-putting at times. However, ours was prompt and helpful. The coffee and water refills kept on coming.  I ordered the grilled vegetable platter with chorizo, which was absolutely humongous! The chorizo was in patty form, nicely browned, and just a bit spicy. I got some hot sauce and poured it on. The vegetables were amazingly not greasy, but steamed on the griddle. It was mostly onions and peppers, as far as I can recall. I thought, "My God. This is ridiculous." However, a few minutes later, I had thoroughly disgusted myself by eating  the entire thing! I may have loosened by belt by the time I was done.  My recommendation: Go early. Go big. There is a "healthy options" portion in the very extensive menu, but why do this to yourself? It would be like ordering a hot dog in a seafood restaurant. This is Deluca's. It's busy, legendary, and unique. Live it up!

0xkOVFVs6yuLJ-9GL84Ovg.text: Love this place. Went in the morning and it was packed. Expect to wait 5 minutes or so when busy. The surprising part if your wait seemed forever, you get your food real fast!  I loved the Greek Benedict !

7F5oWgyIoFt9fbzqYB055Q.text: Friend and I came here for 12:45 brunch on a Monday...and the line went out the door. It is SO popular, and you can't make reservations in the morning. But the food was worth the wait. I had the lobster and shrimp eggs benedict and my friend and I split a short stack of the Apples and Cream pancakes. The eggs benedict was amazing - the texture and flavors worked so well together. Also, dipping the amazing bread into the sauce and egg yolks is DEFINITELY the move. Pancakes were out of this world too. Only thing is that the place is really hectic - not very organized, which probably contributes to the long lines. Also, it's cash only (no fear, there's an ATM right next door). Finally, it's like super greasy in there. Like they need better air ventilation or something. The fact that they have an open kitchen means that I left feeling like there was oil on my hair, face, and clothing, which is kind of gross.

cx0nFIYW43NQ9WrA2dk8jg.text: Having been raised in Pittsburgh, I went to this establishment for breakfast with my father. There were flies everywhere (I actually swatted one with my menu).  Two flies were mating on our table... After a very long wait, I picked up my fork, which was covered in crusted food remnants, which lead me to a request for another.  Then, I cut into my scrambled eggs to find a plastic liner from a new ketchup bottle inside of my eggs!!!  I pushed the food to the side and watched as my father ate his food.  I will never be back.

ynYIXdGxYcrOJGALZU71sg.text: Deluca's is your typical hole-in-the-wall.  It can get a tad smoky, not the cleanest, the line is always long- out the door and down the sidewalk, and I've never personally had the greatest service BUT they do deliver when it comes to the food.  We always leave satisfied and have yet to be disappointed!  Love the mixed grill along with a side of pancakes......

_jQN1ds5ApuAW98633Ci7w.text: great local spot to get a greasy dinner breakfast!

FaTMSylnJqJTBrHWHagX_Q.text: I was extremely excited to come to Deluca's for a morning breakfast.  After seeing it on Man vs Food and hearing that it is one of Pittsburgh's best places for breakfast, how can I not be excited.  However, leaving the bustling breakfast place, I found myself very disappointed.  I did my research before I came here.  My mother and I only had one more day together before I went back to school, and I wanted the meal to be great.  I knew what I wanted to order before I even opened the front door to the place: the Seafood Omelette.  I made this decision based mostly off of my love for seafood and avocado.  However, when I got the dish, I was saddened  To start off with, there were only 3 little slivers of avocado spaced on top of the massive omelette.  You would think for the $13 I would get a little more, but I let it go.  I then started eating the omelette.  My first bite was shrimp; then, my next bite was shrimp; then, my next bite was once again, you guessed it, shrimp.  After I was done eating, I recalled only tasted one bite of crab.  Never did my taste buds or my eyes even see any lobster.  Very Very disappointing for the most expensive omelette on the menu.  Also, the restaurant messed up my order and gave me hash browns when I wanted the tomatoes.  The hash browns were not good at all either.  My mother and I didn't even eat either side order (which is really rare that we don't eat something).  Finally, when the waitress set down my plate she said, "Oh, I will be right back with your toast."  Well, she never came back.  When she did, she was apologetic, but my mother and I had already finished our meals.    In the place's defense, the omelette was good, but it just was not what anyone should expect from one of the most expensive items on the menu; especially when there is suppose to be lobster and crab inside.  My mothers Eggs Benedict was also very good, so no complaints with her meal, except the bad hash browns.  Like I told my mom, the 3 star rating means that I would go back and eat, but I would defiantly try somewhere else in the area before I go back.

jdttiAC-ooEQWV8tWSBH_w.text: I waited a long time before wading into the whole Deluca's vs. Pamela's dispute, choosing to bring some friends to Deluca's because it was closest to our other errands.  I must also admit that the descriptions of Pamela's pancakes as "crepes-like" had some effect on my choosing to try Deluca's first.  Of course, since we come into the city from the boondocks, we arrived at the peak of Saturday morning rush, and waited about 45 minutes to get in the door, but it was a nice, crisp, sunny autumn morning and there were lots of interesting folks to look at and speak with--everyone in line was convivial, anticipating our pending feast.  Inside, the atmosphere was perfect--lots of worn formica, narrow aisles, cramped seats.  This was no showplace but a restaurant that works for a living, a diner.  The gorgeous hostess was efficient verging on brusque, and the waitstaff seemed predominantly hipster in appearnace, but once we were inside the service was swift and attentive, despite the crowds.  Not overly friendly, mind you, but I'm not here to make friends--the priority is eternally full cups of coffee and orders accurate and on time.  They rocked it.    I did traditional: pancakes, bacon, and home fries.  The pancakes taste exactly how diner pancakes are supposed to taste, the bacon was crisp but not too crisp, and the home fries were decadent and delicious.  Others in our party had the blueberry pancakes, chocolate chip pancakes, the Moab, and the famous breakfast burrito.  I snuck my fork into just about all of it and found the Moab to be especially good.  Would I go back?  In a heartbeat.  I departed feeling full from the generous servings, but would gladly have gorged myself further--I'll probably get the Moab next time, Deluca's has a good thing going for it and they know it.  The prices are a little higher than similar places I've visited, but are by no means excessive--part of what you're paying for is the atmosphere in the strip as well as in the diner.  It's definitely worth the hype.

uh6mlvNBv-r1b-sVfqq3mQ.text: One of the best breakfast places in Pittsburgh. My first time here, and it was packed on a Saturday, but we were seated right away. We had attentive service, but we took a while to order due to how confusing the menu is to read. I got the Eggs Benedict and it was fantastic. Our food was delivered quickly, considering on how busy they were. Would recommend to anyone.

cGi_K8pkPy4tQJvVBeK9tg.text: My friend and decided to eat at Roland's in the Strip District and thought why not go for their "famous lobster rolls" I was surprised how much YUMMY lobster was in the sandwich!   it's a definite must stop!

xnxIF3RZiiVUmpL1_X8YCQ.text: Unbelievably bad service to the point where it can't taste good enough to be worth it. Also coffee is literally hot water- just nasty and all decaf.

pqOpYuW3UXEWPleT8V3F2g.text: Love the pumpkin pancakes here! They are the best pancakes I ever had. My husband got the breakfast burrito and raved about it. There is a bit of a wait because it's so popular, but this place is a classic and not to be missed!!!

Y76b7dXmzStnZYG8CzyXeA.text: The staff is nice but the food doesn't match the price. I had the veggie burrito and the people with me had another of their breakfast burritos and pancakes. None of us really enjoyed our food. The door signs say it's the best breakfast, but I would give this place a pass and check out Pamela's or Coca Cafe for the best breakfast in Pittsburgh

mQDcXWNiOMzqibdoX3D9sQ.text: You just beat the food  here for breakfest.  The environment is also a treat if you have never been here.  The choices are more than ample and the servings are generous.  Give it a try and you won't be sorry.

JBY00r4Dadn7cZt6VmINmw.text: After sitting at the table the hostess directed us to, we got up after 10 minutes of no menus or anyone acknowledging us. Oh, but the hostess did come over to see if there was money on the table after the last group left. She even had the gall to say "Have a good day" as we left. Won't be back to DeLucas. Luckily, Pamela's is around the corner.

H11JwEkJjEj7LU-jaroxuQ.text: Oh boy- come hungry and leave happy-and full- but not full of diner grease.  Classic diner but serving legitimate food (such as proper thickly cut bacon, non rubbery scrambled eggs, fresh pesto, fluffy pancakes, etc).  Quality surprisingly is not compromised by the giant portions and volume of customers- instead you get creative, fresh options and plenty of variety.  Worth the wait!

81Jr37-fKOKd8zdKx3oGLg.text: We stopped by around Sunday afternoon before the pirates game.We sat at the counter,and I had the cheeseburger omelette which was wasn't on the menu,but they still managed to cook it up.My friend had the 6 egg omelette with the works inside of it.I was visiting from NYC and this spot was on top of the list,and it lived up to the hyped.

7rVuioFbcY40qPC1hk9qrQ.text: The food was definitely not as GOOD AS USUAL...   I was better off staying at home making my own breakfast .... french toast was hard and not hot..!   The potatoes  had no flavor none WHATSOEVER...+ the potatoes  were hard.   Overall I was not please with my meal.   Trump is in the White House  now, so maybe the cooks are having a hard time readjusting from yesterday inauguration...   Rating Deluca's 3 on pass experience....

VaGS1PvguQW-CdpjYUgs9Q.text: Surprised they didn't open earlier in a Sunday but it was worth the wait to get in.   Always want to try something new but couldn't pass up on the eggs Benedict.  The sauce is consistently the same and the Mancini bread has something to do with the experience I think.   Sometimes the eggs get overdone but one of the most consistent places for Benedict.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

VnJSOBXGkv-2nvUFk0VUMQ.text: Heard about it as a staple of Pittsburgh  Got the South of the border omelette, wasn't bad, decent flavor but nothing amazing, chorizo was nice and large potions, home fries were weak, not much seasoning  We also got the seafood Benedict, not bad, good hollandaise but again nothing amazing  Overall, good service, good portions, good price, worth exploring and it was on man vs food haha, but basically your solid diner situation

HmiLmWPcvy5PB3Vo-WEnHA.text: Everything good.  Breakfast sandwich awesome.   Coffee never empty.  Welcome to Pittsburgh in the morning.   18 min walk from hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Serious diner breakfast.

2kuOrR9YAXm_vjeyUmNd1Q.text: Food was great. Service was quick. Very, very busy place. We waiting in line outside for about 20 mins before we could get a seat. It moved pretty fast and they get tables turned quickly. We both had eggs and bacon with homefries. I also had pancakes. All the food was good for diner food.

ZphUI13crG15ft7Mt7QeOw.text: Great food that comes out quickly and in huge portions. Service is just okay, last visit I was charged for a couple things I ordered but never reached the table and they only take cash here.

_ticwtxq0SqJsvkYOdTFTg.text: Long waits on the weekend .  Omelet was okay. The coffee and service is good , and it is convenient to the shops I frequent on the strip. Would recommend going early to beat the crowds .

aJHMN95dHY1StSbNNrKHKA.text: The best place to get breakfast in Pittsburgh! Food is always nice and hot and made to order. The only accept cash payments no cards. They are extremely busy on weekends so if you do go then prepare to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fire!!!!!

8hcZU2F1SBPzT11aP-G1Ig.text: Friends and I came here after a good workout at the gym, so we were definitely hungry. We came on a Friday at 1:30pm, so there was no wait and lots of empty tables. You would think that since they weren't busy at all, we would get our water and be able to place our orders in quickly, but that was not the case. We sat there for at least 5 minutes before being asked what we wanted to drink. After we got our water, we had to wait another 10+ minutes for her to come back and take our orders. My friend asked for a diet coke which never came so he asked again and they brought him a regular coke. I ordered the California Benedict and thought overall the taste was good, but I wasn't really a fan of the home fries that came with it. It was more than enough to eat even after the gym, so I brought what I couldn't finish home. One friend ordered the chicken & waffle which he didn't like (thought it was undercooked) and therefore didn't finish and the other ordered eggs, bacon, and home fries, which she thought was okay. I was looking forward to this place, but it didn't live up to expectations so unfortunately I won't be coming back.   Taste | 3.5 Atmosphere | 3 Presentation | 3 Service | 1.5 OVERALL | 3

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. California Benedict
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. chicken &amp; waffle

zwyZ9ieelrICRQpGZ1mFow.text: I gave it another shot- Great service- great food.  Must have just been a bad day the last time or they got rid of the bad people there.  love it once again.  I will be back.

lB1V9bVYkGqd9_RDtvUzsw.text: Favorite place for breakfast in the strip. The pancakes are great and you can taste the life of the grill in the food. A must go to place before you die!

alSKTVSMuFkG5bkC5wsFJw.text: This place is what you call a legendary spot! The line was out the door and around the corner when we arrived. I never seen a place with a line that long in my city. It was worth every second of the wait! The  omelettes are packed with flavor and a generous amount of toppings! Loved every bite love the service and the entire atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6EUuZdhHgamhirzacN_1VA.text: Went here because a friend who lives in Pittsburg said that this is a very popular place for breakfast.   Had the pierogi breakfast with eggs--very ordinary. I wouldn't order this again. Can't understand why people would line up to dine here.   After we left the restaurant, my friend and I smelled like a kitchen. Definitely I would not return. The smell was really strong. Had to change my clothes before continuing my day.

ZsT2wVGzrDHNp8XREHlnag.text: Please add more stars as an option because Deluca's deserves all the stars! I came here with a large party for brunch on a snowy and very cold Saturday morning.  That didn't stop a line of people from standing outside to get in.  We, however, had reservations and walked right in much to chagrin of said folks waiting in the 5 degree weather. A table was waiting with a reserved table tent on us and we were immediately approached by our friendly server.  Two people had bailed (due to weather) and a few of our friends were running behind (due to weather) but the server had no qualms about telling us not to worry and to keep the extra two seats for our purses.   Once the entire crew arrived we ordered and received our dishes promptly.  I had the Super Bowl omelet which contained mashed potatoes, kielbasa and onions.  And that may seem a little odd to some but I tell you this was the most delicious breakfast I've ever eaten.  It came with a side of hot baked apples which I added to the omelet and it complimented it beautifully.  This also came with toast.   So, so, so very good.  There was not one complaint at the table and we all pledged to come back again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Souper Bowl.

mDyAeSw_7XK9XzFbG0p4Eg.text: We had a wonderful breakfast here this morning! I got the sausage and cheddar omelette, and my girlfriend got the banana creme crepe with strawberries! Both were wonderful. The proportion size was great for the price! Our meals were delicious as well! The staff was friendly, and the atmosphere was great! They had so many great looking items on there menu it was tough to choose from! We will definitely be going back to try more of there food!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sausage and cheddar omelette and banana creams crepes!

SHgyCjjaFqqQn9QC8cSzUg.text: We are here on Sunday of Memorial Day weekend after reading positive reviews. There was a 20 minute wait, but it was certainly well worth it. I got the ham steak, eggs and potatoes. The ham steak was huge with a wonderful flavor and the potatoes were outstanding. It was one of the best breakfasts I've had in a long time. The others in my party were equally happy with their choices. Due to the large serving sizes, I'm sure we'll be good until supper time. Highly, highly recommend this Pittsburgh jewel.

cYH0C-h7bUbNtvTOscLong.text: Great customer service! I got the Hotcake Special with hot sausage and bacon on the side. I always order my eggs runny soft and usually they come out scrambled to hard, but here the cool made them perfectly which is rare!  This place really has that homey small town diner look that makes you feel at home. Whenever I come back to Pittsburgh, I plan on indulging in a good breakfast around the lovely people of Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

uyzUPFhlABQnHwfT3xyzaQ.text: If you want to eat Sunday brunch before 10:00, DeLuca's is one of the few places that can make your dream a reality. Any later and you'll be playing the extended edition of the waiting game in a queue out the door and halfway down the block. What maybe lacks in quality, is made up in quantity with manly meals such as the oh-so-famous Mixed Grill + Toast (Thanks, Adam Richman!) or Steel City Breakfast of Champs to satisfy your sweet & savory soul and then some. The Breakfast Burrito is built for two, but you might be distracted by the half melted American cheese slice and quasi tomato sauce on top. But as a potato pro, their home fries are among the best in the 412. Seek this spot out for a bountiful breakfast and nothing more. Then, head to La Prima around the corner for a proper espresso and get on w/ your morning.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Plate numero uno of the Steel City Breakfast o&#39; Champs! French toast a la Mancini&#39;s in the background.

YynRQC7pJRL4gvZGIw5E_A.text: Another Pittsburgh classic diner experience. DeLuca's is absolutely fantastic all around. Food is great and the menu options are a wide range of classic breakfast and lunch. Service is friendly and the atmosphere rocks. Prefer sitting at the counter

un20c4bNVCxP2rZBLwyAWw.text: Quick, rough, greasy, cash only and not bad. An old school greasy diner with a truck stop mentality. Whatever image that conjures in your mind is probably what you can expect.  Food's alright. I liked it and I'd eat here again. It does get crowded, but I wouldn't wait outside for a seat to eat here.

4lJmjE-0F5mUNmP2c8KMyg.text: I came here with great expectations from all the recommendations, and I have to say I am impressed. The short Sunday morning wait was worth it. Ordered the championship breakfast come with eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, pancakes, and toast! I didn't touch the toast because everything else was too delicious. The potatoes were probably the best I've ever had. Crispy, yet delicate at the same time and most importantly not to greasy! The bacon was perfectly cooked, as was the sausage. Last but certainly not least, the PANCAKES! They were so amazing and fluffy and delicious. Next time I would be interested to try their specialty pancakes! For two people we got out of there for $24 with tip. Not bad. This place is cool, totally straight up diner! I will be going again!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pancakes, bacon, sausage, potatoes, and eggs... What else could you want?

qFX-bGOpPjVq3xAWCM7MGQ.text: Ok, I'll admit that I came here because I hear it's the official breakfast spot for the Obamas.  It was just after I grabbed a spot at the counter that I realized it wasn't.  It's fine, I was a bit hungover from a wild Friday night so a diner breakfast was just what the doctor ordered.  Service was fine, but the food wasn't particularly memorable.  I would never spend 20+ minutes in line waiting for a spot.  Ordered a omelette, which was massive, but I prefer diced veggies, and theirs were sliced and overly sauteed.  I also think the prices are a bit high for the quality.  $14 for omelet and OJ is what it costs for my favorite diner in SF.

8K6pggRKv5F-HV9ven0bYw.text: We never made it past the nasty lady hostess. My wife tried to check in when the line was out the door and the old hag yelled at her to get back in line. So loud i heard her from the street. I can't say anything about the food but if the service from the hostess and given her slovenly appearance I would go around the corner to Pamela's Diner which is what we did.

OfOl2seXXHgxX6DgE4tz3g.text: A Strip institution!  Try the specialty pancakes and you won't be sorry.  If you go on a weekend, be prepared to stand in line (even in the winter) for a while.  The best times to visit DeLuca's is during the week to avoid the tourists.

W5b9y1LGObFyHmQnH_wO7w.text: Honestly I don't understand where these great reviews are coming from. This restaurant is filthy, our food was dripping in grease (how can a turkey sandwich be greasy?) and I found a hair in my salad. We got lunch food so maybe the breakfast food is better but it can't make up for the filth!

jS0dX1BT8zBTJeNlhItbfg.text: Amazing food!!  The friendliest staff extremely fast service. If you are ever in Pittsburgh DeLucas is a must! The best food in the tristate area and then some. Super large portions for good prices. Cash only. Breakfast and lunch. I will definitely be back!

dwcxJx2WYnrCSujSY57TNA.text: Who complains when they have a belly full of Deluca's Pancakes?? This place rocks!!  On a recent trip back east, I was able to try this restaurant. We love trying and going to small diners that provide great food, large portions and a manageable prices. I had the warm apple pancakes....OMG....so so good. Try anything on the menu.....its all good!! Def new fav in the Strip District!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Warm apples and cinnabon pancakes.

PjaBO59f8QrQSfb2QVjEMw.text: This place was awesome. We showed up here on the hottest day of the year and the AC was trying mightily but not quite succeeding. I felt bad for the waitstaff that had to stay there the entire day.  I had the Reese's pancakes sundae with no whipped cream. Good god. The only thing that could make pancakes better is ice cream, really. They were light and fluffy and so sweet I couldn't finish them. Fab.  T had a Greek wrap that was AWESOME. It was served hot with chicken fresh off the flat top. It was grilled before being served so the spinach was wilted and the feta was heated through. Really awesome. I had a tad of food envy. The wrap was served with onion rings that were also pretty good.  A great local spot in the Strip!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Reese&#39;s pancakes a la mode. Sorry there&#39;s a couple bites missing. I couldn&#39;t help myself before snapping the shot. :)

OpJtW0M-t85Pbu9msWa_Yg.text: Great pancakes and delicious eggs, but the diner felt a bit dingy and dirty. It could definitely use a facelift, and expect a wait.

SbDxx2XduE5fedDQEoVxDw.text: The flavors are bursting, and the home fries are truly well made. Pancakes r crispy on the inside and battery, yummy on the inside. I got the California Benedict- ontop of Italian toast, topped with avocado, tomato, spinach, and Asiago cheese. The veggies were extremely fresh and tasted local (maybe it's in my mind) and the hollandaise sauce blended well with the home fries on the side. Ketchup not even needed. Extremely fast and efficient service. The man knew what he was doing.. Didn't let our coffees go empty. You will leave feeling sedated by the heat of the cooking indoors and a happy full belly. Lots to walk around outdoors to walk it off. We will be returning!

Txi-RirD5I_eRIt8ffT4hA.text: At first glance, it looks like any other typical grungy little diner.  Until you try the food - absolute heaven.  Had the cinnamon french toast with scrambled eggs - the french toast was hot and chewy and sweet, but the eggs... OMG, the eggs.   Best I've ever had.  Seems silly, but very few know how to make them well.  All the dishes looked great - smelled yummy and were HUGE.  Long wait in line, and cash only - but definitely will be back

cPiEJbzB734F_7gMx54cfg.text: Whoa! This place takes breakfast and goes to town with it. Awesome old school diner in Pittsburgh's Strip District. You walk inside and its like stepping back into the 1950s. Personable waitresses abound there to greet you. You can sit at the old fashioned counter or grab a booth. They have a pretty elaborate menu that offers breakfast and lunch but the breakfast is what you're here for. I ordered the Bionic Omelette not really realizing what I was getting myself into. This thing was mammoth and has practically everything in it you would eat for breakfast. Bacon, fresh sausage, onions, hash browns and more! After this meal I ate nothing else for the whole day. I was eating off of this thing for three days and believe me when I say I have a big appetite so that tells you how big it is. The coolest thing about eating here was watching the guy behind the counter cook the meal on the big fryer like someone cooking a homemade breakfast at home in their kitchen. Food comes out pretty fast and prices are okay. The bionic omelette was $13 and like I said it fed me for a few days. You can't miss this place if you're looking for it because its the place with the giant rooster on the roof. Also, theres a booth here marked where Tom Cruise sat during filming the movie Jack Reacher.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bionic Omelette!!!!

GAsMZIeq8HSZaTLq-9E9Bg.text: Deluca's in the strip district def defines a trip to Pittsburgh - I ordered hot turkey sandwich with gravy and mash- with out a doubt good! Staff was friendly...

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mh1Yy48BA8yeRNQgP_8kiw.text: Really enjoyed our trip to Steeler town and eating at this diner.   Don't expect to lose weight after this outing but that goes without saying when you visit a diner.  Try the seafood eggs benedict or any of the other items as I do not think you will be unhappy.  Another nice aspect of eating here is the ability to burn some of the calories you consumed by visiting the many shops and businesses nearby- they go on for blocks  Vibe:  It is a diner!  Check out the pics on Yelp Service:  No complaints- cooked as requested Food:  Not gourmet, but very good!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. View Inside
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs Benedict

JaQrFqadyAG87luj1zEoWQ.text: This place is OK for taste and great for service and portion size. I think the perception is overrated and if folks had to do a blind taste test that this place would not come in as the best breakfast in Pittsburgh. The menu items are creatively Pittsburgh. The kielbasa omelet is one item that sticks out in my head. I ended up ordering the spinach and feta omelet. It was huge and properly cooked. My wife ordered a corn beef sandwich which also came out as expected. Everything was good and I would definitely go back again, but not so good that I would wait 30 minutes for a table.

oZHpy_O7VlGIMaXC8pFS8A.text: Long wait to get in, but WELL worth it!  The food is fantastic, with large portions, so bring your appetite.  I came with a party of 8, and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meal. Our server, Rhonda, was excellent and quick to get us everything, despite being slammed with tables. Truly an excellent experience!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The insides of the Bionic omelet. Amazing!!!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bionic omelet

oWHAQRE8rJx1gHvNqV169Q.text: My PIC (Partner In Cuisine) and I went down to the Strip District one very warm Saturday morning on a whim.  We didn't know where or what we wanted to eat and down there, there are more than a few options to pick from.  Dizzy from all of the choices (and perhaps low blood sugar), we walked past Deluca's.  My PIC commented on the fact that he heard that place was "good" and it was featured on the Food Network.  He had me at "good" (granted, I don't watch Food Network).  Anywho, apparently we got there at just the right time between breakfast and lunch because we got seated immediately.  We were greeted by a detached if not surly waiter.  He was efficient in taking our orders and getting our food.  Unfortunately, we never saw him again after that (except to get our bill of course).    Despite the mediocre service, the food iteself was excellent.  The True diner menu, with its seemingly hundreds of selections, had a breakfast highlight as all diners do.  My PIC and I happily obliged the menu and ordered two different breakfasts.  I got the biscuits and sausage gravy and he got a breakfast with gigantic pancakes.  The portions were huge and the food was tasty.  The people next to us had breakfast burritos that made our breakfasts look puny in comparison.  Or maybe it was me being star struck by the "Tom Cruise's ass was here" plaque.  We agreed that our next trip would include those (burritos, not Tom Cruise).   Unfortunately, the last time my PIC and I tried to go to Deluca's, there was a line around the block.  We didn't feel like waiting, so we went elsewhere.  I do have to say though, that I wish we had waited in line for Deluca's instead of going "elsewhere".  That's a regret I will take to my grave.  Just wait in line at Deluca's.  It's worth it.

yMs3SAS-82ebWleVQ696FQ.text: I came here on a weekday for a quick after-work breakfast. I worked overnight and was starving. The place was pretty empty and we got our food quickly but it was pretty underwhelming. I got a Greek omelette that was mostly egg with one tomato slice, two leaves of spinach, and some bland chicken thrown in for good measure. I don't eat a lot of salt but had to add a ton. The salt shaker holes were crusted shut so I actually had to open it up and dump salt on the food. Next time I'll just make one at home. I would have been more disappointed if I had stood in line for hours

E9KU8HMqjeNWfLqeN-PCHQ.text: Our server was incredibly attentive and polite. I accidentally ordered eggs that had ham in them (  vegetarian) and our server traded it out at no charge. My dining partner and I assured him that we would pay for the extra dish because it was our mistake--and said dining partner even ATE the offending eggs to prove it. Still, no charge. We left a sizeable tip to compensate the place, which was our meager compromise with ourselves.   Still, the food was only so-so. My omelet was overly greasy, as were the potatoes. Great service, fun atmosphere, but my experience with the actual food was nothing spectacular.

HqZo6lnMsLEYOxHmHrBvcg.text: Hands down better than Pamelas.  Love the sci-fi space theme.  The line is manageable.  Try Tuesday morning at 9am, no one is there.

EbzvpUusF-nZ8aiwuA2ECg.text: Awesome service and awesome food! A line easily grows here on the weekends so the earlier you arrive, the better. We had the veggie grill and the veggie breakfast burrito. Both were fantastic! The veggie grill comes with a huge portion of grilled veggies - they hit the spot. I've heard the eggs Benedict options here are the best in the city. Cash only!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KOnYOt7kq03ot0kLQYOFyw.text: The food is very good. The wait time is entirely to long and food is very overpriced. Also, has a grundgy type of vibe to it.

K1j5nnsP12_i2rWKF_HX5w.text: Overpriced Food not that good Dirty inside Grossed us out Long wait Pamela's better Ritter's better Avoid this tourist trap

BNDLn9P_R60arstuhotunA.text: De-licious! Went to breakfast at 8AM on a brisk Saturday in February and we were seated right away.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

SJeiGJgl3GmOhOm-FdIVqQ.text: I'm never too impressed with this diner. It's okay, but really nothing special. I ordered this grilled veggie and egg breakfast, assuming it would be a breakfast bowl kind of thing. As it turned out, it was a giant plate of mushy, unseasoned vegetables (90% of that being onion) with a little pile of eggs on top. The eggs weren't even beaten before they were cooked because they were full of visible whites. Biscuits were ok. I've had regular eggs, potatoes & toast before which was a better experience, so maybe I'll avoid anything besides a classic breakfast from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled veggies with scrambled eggs. It was mostly onion. -_-
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Have a seat on the tiniest stools known to man. So cute!

kNa7oNxEh-NvPj3HDjUpYw.text: CASH ONLY! There's many options of breakfast and lunch. It's a great place for both with friendly staff. I got there famous breakfast burrito which was topped with their special Spanish sauce and a slice of what looked like a kraft single. I had to substitute my meat for chicken since there is a huge chicken on top of the restaurant. While the burrito was good, I wish I could have picked up the burrito to eat instead of having to cut it. Very filling portions!

CjVM-HpdkX47tUGrwzhWcQ.text: Used to have a better experience here. Today we were seated quickly at the same time as 2 other groups. Those people were eating before anyone even bothered to take our order ! We had to call over a waitress who said " did she get your order ? " it's obvious no one did we have our menus sitting on the edge of the table. Food wasn't as good as it was in the past. The whole experience put a bad taste in my mouth. I unfortunately will never be back.

iac7hVAeai0roceoqsR2ow.text: So this place was fun atmosphere wise. Fast paced, order, eat and go!   I got the steak breakfast burrito. The portion size was nice  but there was so much of the wrong cheese. Maybe some feta or queso  with some lettuce inside? Just something besides what was on it would go miles.  Servers were fun and talkative which was nice, but some people seemed annoyed by it.  Next time I am in town I will have to try something more classic off the menu.

2TUgdRazNho1XB-Ok-RjZQ.text: Went here on a misty cold Saturday morning with my daughter and friend. We'd heard great things about this place and it lived up to them. Had to wait about 15 minutes for. Table for 3- not bad for a Saturday morning after 9. Coffee was Ok but the food was great. Service really good- kept the coffee full and other glasses as well. I had the MOAB burrito a delicious Blend  of chorizo, eggs, cheese, peppers and Spanish sauce wrapped in a nice warm tortilla . Took mire than half home for later meals!! Friends had californiA eggs Benedict - yummy eggs cheese pesto and guacamole on Italian bread. Blueberry pancakes tasty w whole blueberries not mushy. Will be here again!!'n

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. California eggs benedict
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. MOAB burrito

aflD9yySYXkCfpwG3RTTGw.text: Wow! First time in Pittsburg, first time to eat here. Everyone raves about it and I can see why.   Service was similar to southern hospitality which I sound odd for a northern state. The real definition of an old school breakfast diner. CASH ONLY!   We had the seafood Benedict, banana praline crepe, Reese's hot cake sundae, and coffee.   The seafood Benedict was excellent! Perfect amount of seafood, avocado, and runny yolk to cover the toasted bread underneath.   The coffee is bomb. The hot cake sundae is a perfect dessert to share for 2-3 people. And the banana praline crepe is decent (the banana is just cold wrapped in a hot crepe with a touch of sweet ricotta and yummy pralines. I would have liked it more with sliced cooked bananas)

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana praline crepe
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot cake sundae
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

piFNrRvAA5ucwgrxt4wdjg.text: This is my go-to breakfast joint in Pittsburgh, especially since it's open super early so I can stop by after getting off night shift. Their menu is huge. Whatever you're craving, they have it! I usually go for one of their eggs benedict dishes or an omelette. Prices are low and portions are huge! It is a really popular place so there's almost always a wait, but once you sit down and order your food comes out unbelievably quickly. Parking can be tough sometimes.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Corned beef and swiss omelette with home fries
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The MOAB
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster bisque, so rich and creamy!

ag5OGovNHctz3TJP6yvJ8A.text: One of my favorite diners ever visited. You can see the authenticity of this place from the giant chicken statue resting on top to the busy yet homey ambiance inside. The menu is comprehensive and very delicious. I tried the spinach tomato feta omelette and was pleased with the giant portion and awesome home style potatoes. The wall is pleasantly filled with movie posters featuring films that used this photogenic location.

nnLXeZevjhI9_sqh1OCWwQ.text: You can't get more Pittsburgh than DeLuca's in the strip. When they say Pittsburgh's best breakfast, they ain't lying. I always get the steel city breakfast of champions-eggs, pancakes or waffles, home fries, bacon, sausage & toast for $11.95. You can't beat it. The breakfast burritos are Huge with many vegetarian options. Service is fast & friendly, honey. A real diner atmosphere. Food comes quick. Don't be intimidated if there's a line; it moves quickly.

PgoEVZ50myVEU7YE6s_9aw.text: This has to be one of my favorite go-to breakfast spots here in the Burgh! If you haven't been here, you're truly missing out! There's another location in Robinson but I haven't gotten a chance to try it yet. If you're here for the first time, just a heads up - the menu can be very overwhelming to look at. It had so many different options - from the pancakes and french toasts to your traditional omelets or steak & eggs. My boyfriend always order their T-bone steak and egg along with their home fries. It comes out perfect every single time. My go-to breakfast is eggs, turkey sausages & home fries. Yes it sounds so little & simple but trust me... it WILL fill you up! :) Overall I love this breakfast joint. But be ready to stand in a long line if you come here on the weekend (extra long if there's a Steelers or Pirates game)!   *CASH ONLY*

LG0GuQEPIW8jIS-6Br8MqQ.text: Went back and forth on my rating decision here. The food is certainly a five, the service a three (only somewhat fast, not particularly friendly, and expect to have to ask for refills on anything). The overall experience is in the middle as you are dealing with a ton of tasty options, a comfortable environment, a nice location for a Saturday brunch (outside of the wait and the parking challenges) and solid classic diner experience.   The price also is only decent, and though it's a single dollar sign option many of the menu items will push closer to the upper end. I had the breakfast burrito with their special sauce and yes that sauce was special, absolutely delicious. Couldn't find the breakfast menu anywhere online, so giving that as a personal recommendation.  Worth a stop if you happen to be in the Strip.

kzgS5oSYfHS_B5Bw6L4sAw.text: I don't understand why people line up out the door and down the street for this place. It seems to be very overrated and overpriced. We went early Tuesday morning and there was no wait (thankfully).  I came in from out of town and was told by several people that I had to go to Deluca's. I got the country breakfast and I was less than wowed by what I got. My meal came out to me in portions as they were ready at separate times. The fried chicken is merely a chicken tender with gravy and shredded cheese poured on top (not enough to put any on my biscuit that came out halfway through). The homefries were good.   Apparently, it is a seat yourself and grab your own menu kind of place. Another customer paying ended up handing us two menus before any staffers acknowledged our existence.  Our waitress was very nice, so I kept them at 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

-h8hEXDsS_bsNRxo0koiyw.text: Ooooeeeeeee  this is Americaaaaa. tipical american interior  huge portion of dishes  fast service.  but not all food is good. I think 4* it's fare for this place

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

yeWd4OjKCWGJiO9x9b2NUQ.text: I tried this out because just about everyone loves it. The line was pretty long and when being seated I saw a lot of empty tables, meaning they don't do a very good job turning tables over. The food was very disappointing. I split the biscuits and gravy & chicken and waffles. The biscuits were like cutting a hockey puck and were very dry. This place is nothing special, I'll be sticking with Pamela's!

NoW5yeKNtvRrxiNpTVhwIg.text: Delicious breakfast !! We went during the week so we did`t have to wait in line but still very busy I don`t think there was an empty booth, there was a few spots at the counter bar. The staff is very fast and friendly. Had the biscuits and gravy with bacon very very good!!

bapVv19NUVgeMezXloivWw.text: I enjoyed this place a lot with a friend of mine. We are both visiting from out of state. We couldn't decide between this one and another restaurant around the corner but this had more unique selections.  It was a quit turn around, seated, served, eat, and out. They were vey efficient and obviously have been opened for a while. It was all cash only though so I hope they will get with the times soon. I would've ordered more food if I could've used my card but alas I only had $10.   I ordered the apple cinnamon bun crepe. It was a good decision! So good. It had ricotta cheese melted in it and whipped cream on top. It was delicious and full of sugar so be warned. My friend got an omelet and she also loved it. The portions are big. Everything looked delicious around us too.  I enjoyed the venue, it was packed but not cramped. Old feeling but clean. It was a diner, so don't expect anything crazy. Will be back one day to try the other foods.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Apple cinnamon bun crepe
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Store front and line out the door!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best breakfast in town

D8MAKtQEbPWqcGZ11vKsjg.text: It's breakfast what is anyone really looking for from a greasy spoon? I had the omelette with bacon, cheese and veggies. It was great. Maybe too much cheese.  But whatever it's breakfast. I say wait in line and get your breakfast. And don't bitch about the service for God's sake it's breakfast not a gourmet meal.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

LUdKNBIy2FJtGnzae0BG9w.text: Saturday morning last weekend we were in Pittsburgh for a Pens game the night before (yay they won!)  And my husband took me to Deluca's on the strip.  We were lucky since there was no line at 830 in the morning and we got a table right away.  Decluca's first impressions are not great.  Considering it as a "hole in the wall" joint, the place still needs some serious TLC.  The ceilings look terrible and the walls look like they didnt know what they wanted to do - fix it or otherwise.  I like dives and hole in the walls to eat at, but I still want a complete ceiling up top, not one that looks like its under construction or caving in on me.   The service is decent.  A small place with lots of tables close to one another, you'll be able to get someone's attention for sure.  However, its the food and the reason why people are there right?  My husband had a Mexican omelet - or the like and I had a corned beef hash plate.  Even with my healthy appetite, I couldn't eat but a third of the food.  He didn't care much for his entree so he actually helped me eat mine.  Even so, there was leftover food.     There were lots of pancakes and similar items on the menu that looked tempting.  But with portion sizes so big, there was no way for me to even suggest trying to get something in addition to our plates.   I would suggest going there with big appetites and possibly consider sharing!  It's ok and I would consider going back if I don't have to wait in line.  But nothing so amazing that I'd stand outside on a cold winter day to get inside.

u_pnNL-zG1OqdruNnHO-TA.text: The Strip on the weekend is always busy and the day of a parade busier still.  But if you get a brave soul (Dad) to wait in line in the cold it works out well.  I was able to hit Penn Mac and do some other shopping.   Think it was about a 30 minute wait but when it's 25 degrees giving a good coffee as a peace offering makes it better.  I had eggs over medium, bacon, etc. which was good for the price but my eggs were more on the over easy side.  Others had the special - French toast with strawberries and got fudge.  I was told it was wonderful.  A definite Pittsburgh dive - and a must try.  Just beware of the stairs to the restroom.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Special - French toast with strawberries and hot fudge

nIw6N8eJP4jJ7-3LFolTCA.text: First time here and it is absolutely amazing! I had the Steel City Breakfast of Champs. I got my eggs scrambled and they were perfectly cooked...not over cooked and a bit hard like most places do. The hot sausage is definitely hot! Steer clear if spicy is not your thing. Ordered bacon extra crispy and was cooked just right. Pancakes were so yummy! The outside rim was just a bit crunchy with a fluffy center. Very tasty!!! Great food for a great price! Bring your appetites because the portions are very generous!!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside the restaurant
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Scrambled eggs, hot sausage, extra crispy bacon, and homefries
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Country fried chicken with scrambled eggs and homefries

na1HRHcMEBhA0dPqHJrIpA.text: When we first got there the line was very long,  but it was worth the wait for sure!!! My boyfriend and I both ordered the breakfast burritos. The burritos were so delicious!  Another thing that was pretty cool was we were seated in the booth right next to where Tom Cruise sat in a scene from "Jack Reacher"!!! I think we'll make it a tradition coming here on the weekends for breakfast! Definitely 5 stars!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

aPxBoRdu2XIcD-8z2Wi78A.text: Great service, get food! Whether a local or visiting Pittsburgh this place is a must!!!! Thank you all for the service and food!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Philly Cheese Steak Omelette

Br3sz3DHu4GYxYevk2oVOw.text: Always good breakfast. My sister and I sat at the counter top and there was not one moment when we didn't have fresh hot coffee and or cups! Portions are extremely generous and very tasty! It is making me hungry for breakfast right now. They only take cash so be sure to take some dollars with you. I love taking Family and friends here when they come in town

ZFubvifE7rW_UWJlM_H8Ng.text: Best diner I've ever been to. Visited with my aunt who moved away about from Pittsburgh about twenty years ago. She said it is still just as good as she remembers. Real, authentic experience with awesome food that doesn't cost an arm and a leg. One thing is it is CASH ONLY! Not a big problem, but can catch you off guard if you're not a regular. Great staff and great experience. Hopefully I can come back soon!

n0OM89BSqE_5UEm-CKMECQ.text: I walked in at around 7:30 AM on a rainy Saturday, and I had a 15 minute wait. The restaurant was absolutely packed, and I enjoyed getting to people watch while I waited to be seated.   Once I was seated at the counter, I was treated to friendly conversation with the people sitting next to me, while I made the grave mistake of ordering a Bionic Omelet because I thought it was a smaller meal.   I've never been so happy to be wrong in my life. While the omelet wasn't the best looking once I received it, the taste more than made up for it. The ingredients used were quality, and the toast and hash browns were perfectly golden brown.  I ended up with breakfast for the rest of the weekend. Totally worth your time, if you can get there early enough to not have to wait.

3HRCMTTxw8n83-1XvOxpmw.text: We stayed in downtown Pittsburgh to get the full city experience. This place was supposed to have the best breakfast, but I didn't find anything special about it. I got the Italian Vegetarian Fritatta. Some of the veggies were cooked okay, but the onions were not. They ruined the dish by the bitter flavor (which I have found are usually reflective of 'old' onions). Others had the full stack of pancakes, blueberry french toast, raspberry crepes, and kid's chocolate chip pancakes.nothing really amazing there either. Nobody finished their food. That is either because they gave us a lot (in most cases) or the person did not like it enough to over stuff themselves to finish it. We ended up leaving with lots of leftovers, and my son who wasn't with us when we went enjoyed eating them. But he also is a very hungry teenager with a large appetite :).  Also only takes cash. No checks or credit.

9GHRH1WuIcDHGYdTLZOvew.text: What a wonder Pittsburgh breakfast experience! Super busy just adding to the charm. No glitz or glam, just great food! Went moth my stepmom, sister and best friend from out of town. Had to give her a Pittsburgh experience of the strip district. My sister got eggs Benedict, she loved it on the Mancini's toast. My friend got the man vs food special (can't recall the name) but everything was mixed together in a heavenly mix. Stepmom got a classic breakfast, raved about the bacon. I had the moad, pronounced moe ad. It was a breakfast burrito with Spanish style sauce and chorizo. We then shared a banana split crepe. Yes, we went all out! Everything was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The mixed grille
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana split crepe!

ZeUALIbe45frz3rVaRD7fg.text: This place is one I always make a point to visit when in the area. Coming in on the redeye from the west coast we weren't served food so the hunger level was high. I have visited on weekdays and weekends. The former is always better. Lines are short to non-existent on those day's. Weekends always has lines out the door that provides wait times of up to 30 minutes. On this Tuesday morning I walked right in and was seated straight away. Drinks were quickly served; no coffee for me but some of the orange juice. It was good but I prefer fresh squeezed. So I decided on a short stack of buttermilk pancakes, 2 eggs and some bacon. Everything was tasty, as always and served quickly. The service was great and everyone was super friendly. I have visited a handful of times in each of my prior visits and will make it a point to continue that tradition as long as they are around when I am in the 'burgh. Prices are always fair and comparable to fast-food and chain style restaurants. Parking is on the street and can be limited, especially on the weekends.

dSO1F1mmp-z1z-V4ONfHNg.text: This place was incredible and I now understand why it was featured on Man vs Food. I had a MOAB (mother of all burritos) and my friend got the bionic omelet (should be called "freak of nature"). We waited about 30 minutes outside before getting in and now understand why. It takes extra time to make your way out of the restaurant due to all the food you eat here, thus slowing down the line. We had a great time and will be headed back soon. I will try Pamela's (a rival breakfast shop) sometime and then compare them. This place is highly recommended.  Cash only.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Not the only one smiling after breakfast...
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The MOAB and Bionic Omelet.
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Deluca&#39;s after a long wait.

ir-Y3f4c-aiIt82c4t7TZA.text: Since Pamela's had a ridiculous wait, we came here, which just has a line rather than a system of putting your name down. Much shorter though, so we got breakfast here and it was just what we needed.  I got the corned beef hash, well done/crispy, and was super satisfied. It still looks like the canned hash rather than homemade, but cooked perfectly and there was plenty of food. I didn't even need my toast, which he actually brought much later.  My one negative point was he never checked on our water or coffee. I put my empty coffee cup at the edge of my table, and he walked by briskly a few times with coffee but only served the table he was getting orders from. He was so busy if I missed him while he ran by, I wouldn't see him for a while unless I only paid attention to him. I'd rather eat than stare at a waiter. In the end I didn't get more coffee because it was such a hassle. I guess you can't have everything! And they can't have five stars.

tTK7iZc2TCskcEfkZ4-TDg.text: Be prepared to wait because it really was that good. Not only were the eggs perfect but the pancake was too and the bacon was -- and I mean this -- the best I have ever had. There's nothing like a good diner breakfast and this one has been the best one I've experienced to date. Highly recommend. I also heard the other location is even better and busier. Won't disappoint yuhs.

fb5d9-uTiS4hXrHNYK0aTQ.text: Nice place in strip district. We had California and seafood Benedict, which are ok, but I was a little bit disappointed because I'm a big fun of egg Benedict and it is not as good as I expected. The onion rings are great.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. California Benedict and Seafood Benedict

bskN9debDlFPSLu94CQ1Sg.text: Don't  see what the fuss is all about.  This place is not good. I ordered the biscuits n gravy with scrambled eggs n hash browns. I specified that the hash browns be extra crisp. What I got for my 8.79 was milk gravy that tasted like they scraped the griddle after making sausage patties and added them to the gravy and it was starting to congeal. The eggs were gone in 3 bites and the hash browns were mushy white paste on the plate.  My sister ordered eggs meat hash browns with a side of sourdough toast. Toast was 2.79 for 2 pieces of  toast so coldthat it wouldn't even melt her butter. The hash browns again, were white paste.  The only good part of this meal was the coffee.  So for 23 dollars and change, we will not be going back anytime soon!!!

GDf0INmLshIzdaHH_f3VBg.text: Ten stars (if I could). I was surprised by the line at the door, but super curious to see what the fuss was all about! I had the waffle combo, and ordered a side of peanut butter (as I always do). Our server, Kim, was unbelievably helpful and personable...even surprising me by bringing lingonberry for me to try with my waffle (so good!). DELICIOUS COFFEE!! 10/10 would come here again- even on a game day. Worth the wait! Yumm.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Now in Robinson town center! Yessss.

dzdSpJJI7rWzu7ZsZq-Grw.text: Steelers game day-after brunch! Of course, that was the great idea for everyone in town. Long line in the cold, but for the best breakfast in town? Our group would make it work. We were in a party of 8, and were willing to split into two parties of 4. However, the hostess was able to get us all sitting together! Score!  The place is a pretty authentic diner. Cash only, several tables, booth and counter seating, and an open kitchen so you can smell the bacon and eggs that gets everyone in good spirits. It also has very tight and narrow spaces, so be careful going to your seat! The menu has many, many options, so I just stayed on the first page. I ordered the breakfast burrito with corned beef hash and home fries. And coffee. Coffee is always necessary. Others ordered crepes, benedicts, and the turkey club. The breakfast burrito was as large as my plate, and satisfied my hunger.   Thankfully, the wait for our food was not as long as the wait outside. Service is efficient, and our coffee and water glasses were never empty.  I'd come here again if I was back in town! It's located in the Strip district with a parking lot close by!

pgEwSCP0hi_eQaFs8PrvGg.text: My family and I couldn't decide where to have breakfast while shopping in the strip. It was between here and Pamela's, and I'm glad we tried Deluca's.  There's almost always a line out the door. We did have to wait a while, but it didn't seem long at all. I ordered an ordinary breakfast with over medium eggs, bacon, and toast. It was good and satisfied my appetite. My mom ordered the mixed grill. It's not the most pretty thing, but it sure is yummy. My aunt, however, ordered their cinnamon French toast, and I had to try a few bites. It was delicious. That's for sure what I'm going to order the next time I'm there.  The only thing that sort of bothered me is how packed the restaurant gets, and I was feeling a bit claustrophobic. That's not such a big deal when their food is good though, and I forgot all about it when I was eating. I also hardly saw anyone on staff smile other than the cooks who seem to be the only people who were happy.  All in all, its a great breakfast and lunch spot. While the experience didn't wow me, there's plenty of items on the menu for everyone to find something they'll enjoy.

2cI5lT19nPfBDCFZjZyvqw.text: Breakfast Sat, 10/3/15, 9:30 am 30 minute wait. Food, not so much. Place packed. Bacon rubbery... If you want big pancake/waffle loaded with "stuff"...maybe for you. But for good eggs/bacon or omelet...wait not worth the wait.

DbeYIzUIsgXMR-mZKh-W9A.text: Passing by this morning I stepped through the crowd and went to the bar as per usual. Done this at least 5 times before presuming that people are waiting for a table which they usually are.  After five minutes of sitting there I was informed that I must go to the back of the line outside. So go and wait outside for a good 30 minutes for one seat at the bar?  At the time there were at least 10 empty seats at the bar. I strolled on to Kelly's which is where I was originally going in the first place. Walked in, sat at the bar, had breakfast. It doesn't seem that complicated but times have changed apparently.

xeXoXB1L1a2Mwt9UDmnDcg.text: HUGE portions of tasty food. Prompt service. Cash only. Preferred breakfast here over Pamela's. Got a cinnamon roll pancake, sweet Lord it was so delish I didn't even want to share a bite with my guy! The body builder egg white omelette with chicken, spinach, and Asiago was much better than anticipated. Omelette came with oatmeal, fresh fruit, and fresh Italian toast. Enough for two. Go here!

U3ncisBPvy9yfy-Hpo9wLQ.text: I know everyone loves DeLuca's, but the food isn't super great, and the wait is always too long. Also, the  time I have been there bathrooms almost never have soap, and if the bathrooms don't have soap, the servers and cooks aren't washing their hands. Just consider that.

h-UQcu4Ii6h3KWxaw9SFlA.text: Just, yum.  I pride myself on having eaten breakfast at most hole-in-the-wall spots in Pittsburgh (Pamela's, Square cafe, Coca cafe, Randall's, and quite a few places that I can't even remember the names of), but this place is my favorite.  I got the eggs bene, which was bomb, and the service was fast and it was all really cheap.  Good coffee, too.    It's definitely divey, and if you're the type of person who typically brunches in Shadyside, it's probably not for you.

mau48XlIVWyi1HHtOTvkww.text: I got the French toast and my brother got the Philly cheesesteak. With all due respect for the reputation and the long waiting line in front of this place (that made me curious to give this place a try), i must say the food was nothing impressive. They should find a way to deal with the smoke from the kitchen. My glasses got so foggy the moment i stepped inside this place. My coat smells like steak for hours afterward. The only good thing is the service. People are friendly there. Also, they only take cash.

6v7GY_dEbYsZdIwFhF0cAw.text: I recommend arriving at Deluca's early. I came with a group of six at about 8:45, and we were very lucky to be seated within 25 minutes as two tables opened up beside each other. By the time our food arrived, the line extended past the beyond the field of view from inside.  This time I order peanut butter pancakes with scrambled eggs and kielbasa. The eggs were good, and the pancakes and kielbasa were great. I was expecting house pancakes smeared with peanut butter but received pancakes infused with peanut butter flavor; they were soft and fluffy yet concrete in flavor; thus, the pancakes sufficed all of the principles I seeks in pancakes. The kielbasa was crispy; it was well done but not overcooked.  Previously, I've had an omelette and home fries, and I can verify that these dishes are  tasty and generously portioned.  The service was great too. As I mentioned, our larger group was quickly accommodated, our orders were taken promptly, and the food was delivered warm. The staff even offered some witty banter to a member of our group who decided to make an interesting choice for his breakfast.

C98BzO-J08ZeXDOgSpMJjw.text: Came on a Friday around 1130, not too long of a wait. Our server was very nice and the food was good! No complaints from anyone in my group. I'd love to try the pancake sundaes next time!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3nXmd0yEWwlZxTAeh5U4aA.text: After reading some positive reviews, we decided to venture over to the Strip District to round up some brunch at Deluca's. It seemed like the rest of the city had the same idea, but I was committed to visiting here and leaving satisfied. Done.  Yes, you'll wait for a table (and probably even wait outside), but the cooks, servers and bus boys moved very efficiently, knocking out orders for all the small booths and tables. Once we were seated, one menu item called out to me: Texas Cinnamon French Toast with eggs and bacon. Oh, and coffee, of course.  In no time at all, it was all sitting in front of me and in no time at all, it was all gone. The scrambled eggs were pretty standard, the bacon was perfectly cooked (not fatty and not burnt to a crisp) and the French toast was sweet and delicious, even without adding any syrup.  As already mentioned, the service was prompt and the prices were reasonable. However, this is a "Cash Only" spot, so keep the plastic in your wallet.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast in Adam&#39;s booth

6D7-ucKKH60jXnffyxBidQ.text: I had really hopes for this place. We waited in line for about 20 minutes. A couple behind us told us it would be well worth it. Interesting enough, the wait has nothing to do with my rating. The food was disgusting. I had the chicken and waffle, which was simply not good.  When asked if I was enjoying my meal, I gave my honest feedback. The waitress was accommodating with replacing my meal with something else.  This time I chose French toast...playing it safe.  It was horrible...the worse French toast I've ever had.  The flavor was really bad and it was undercooked.  I had my husband taste it too and the look on his face was classic.  I can't even explain the taste other than BAD.    Yesterday, we went to Pamela's which is around the corner.  It was delicious!!!! Considering people seem to compare the two, I thought De Luca's would be comparable.  NOT AT ALL.

PzOQkC07faDuqyi7F1MexQ.text: We stopped at Pittsburgh specifically to eat here on our way to NY.  And it's worth the detour! Love the food! It's ridiculously delicious! No wonder there were people on line waiting for a table. I got the country chicken with biscuits and gravy, eggs and home fries, and man oh man, they would make a killin' in NY! I also tasted the banana pancake. DeLuca did not disappoint, not one iota. Service is fast and courteous as well. A must for everyone!!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mixed veggies w/ hot sausages and eggs
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Biscuits
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Country chicken w/ biscuits and gravy, eggs and home fries

L1JIJU9MnFw-mzWwntvBHg.text: Can't go wrong when you hit up Deluca's. For the price point and the food, it's totally worth it. This is a little diner, it's a gem to me. Great place to get breakfast or brunch. I won't be able to review about their lunch and dinner as my fiance stopped by to eat breakfast. I got the grilled mixed, amazing especially if you love veggies! I had fresh veggies with over easy egg with a slice of ham. I loved the atmosphere of the place. I was pretty jealous my fiance got the country fried chicken.  I wanted to eat all of his food. The fried chicken was fried and seasoned to perfection!! The gravy tasted just like biscuits and gravy. This is an absolute place you have to check out in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Country fried chicken  Taste just like biscuits and gravy. Chicken was seasoned amazingly!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mixed grill. Feature on Man vs Food   So amazing!

xUuBksoXj5LwS0hG3yxp1g.text: CRAZINESS... so many options on their menu from eggs/omelette to pancake/crepe/french toast/waffle both sweet and savory to sandwiches. I was worried the table of 7 would take a long time, but a table had opened up in 10 minutes. It was fantastic! Great place to take friends with all sorts of food preferences. I ordered the 2 eggs with homefries and bacon. BACON was so good. Thick enough and crispy. Wasn't a huge fan of the homefries, I would like them crunchier. The fried chicken was really good though. Super tender and savory. We also shared the pumpkin filled crepes and sundae waffle with strawberries. OH MY... it was soooo loaded. I really like both desserts and we even finished the pumpkin crepe. Not overly sweet!

zPgYYFnttwTwrHrKfoHVEA.text: I stopped by here today with my parents and sister for breakfast.  We were debating over a place to eat in the Strip District and I offered up DeLuca's as I have had decent experiences there before and there is always a line out the door waiting for seats.  We arrived at around 9:15 and walked right into the restaurant and were seated in the upstairs portion.  The inside of this place is nothing special and looks like many other diners.  They did have a t shirt from man v food (circa 2006) on the wall above us.  For my breakfast I decided to start off with a coffee which was poured within seconds of ordering and delivered to our table.  Then after a few minutes of deliberating over the huge menu I ended up going with the Huevos Rancheros for my breakfast.  After ordering our waitress disappeared and I am pretty sure that I never saw her again until we had to ask another waitress to get her for our check.  That meant that after about 10 minutes of waiting with an empty cup of coffee, I ended up helping myself to the pot that was sitting nearby.  I never did get a third cup which would have been nice.  Anyways, after a reasonable amount of time our food made it out to our table and my Huevos Rancheros looked pretty good.  The egg was sunny side up and whenever I cut through it, the yolk dripped nicely onto the tortilla, cheese, salsa and chorizo underneath it.  It tasted decently enough although I would have personally liked it quite a bit spicier.  After I was about half way through my my meal the avocado that was supposed to come on it materialized to our table.  It was maybe 1/4 of a total avocado cut into 4 very small slices which were quickly gone.  Whenever my family and I had finished our meals we proceeded to wait about 10 minutes for our waitress to come to our table.  Finally giving up on that we asked another waitress to ask our waitress for the bill.  She did and about 10 minutes later and after again asking our waitress for the bill, we were able to pay.  The sad thing is that we were trying to get out of there and there was a huge line of people outside waiting to get in.  The bottom line for me is that I would probably avoid coming here in the future.  While the food was decent tasting I found it to be overpriced and our service was just miserable.

I0-JuJ2kMvR3GapVyrsCRA.text: This place is sort of a local legend, and rightly so, as any place that serves ice cream as a breakfast food (on waffles!) is a place you should go to at least once. Having said that--We just went again and the service was terrible. It was a slow day, and there were a ton of staff on, and we still waited 10-15 minutes to have our order taken. My food didn't come as described in the menu, and the mashed potatoes came in a gigantic flavorless mound. If you want a ton of mediocre food, in a fun, old-school diner atmosphere, this is your spot. If you want something truly delicious, look elsewhere.

M0COlDIHMxgtp96D_XOccQ.text: I've been wanting to try Deluca's for such a long time. The first time I wanted to go there there was quite a few people waiting in front of us, so we decided to try it another day. I went just this past Friday....and I absolutely love it there!! We didn't have to wait at all at the time we went around 11..I was so surprised it wasn't busier, but I think it just all depends on the times and day it is. First off, I do want to mention the staff is not very friendly at all there! They almost seemed bothered that there are people eating at this place. That's the only negative thing I have to say. The atmosphere is cute, typical diner, I love how it looks like an old fashioned diner. We sat at the booth where Tom Cruise sat at during a scene filmed at Deluca's for Jack Reacher. I think that adds a cool touch to the place! Their menu has to be the biggest menu I have ever seen! There are so many options, it's a little overwhelming to be honest. They don't just have breakfast items, they have lunch and dessert items. There food is absolutely delicious!! I can not wait to go back!

3ZLNan_21K-T83Scwi-TWg.text: Rocked the chocolate chip pancakes with chocolate ice cream on top and split the huevos rancheros. Delicious! Very good food and loved the coffee.  Unfortunately, my concern wasn't for the food, but my self esteem, as the server was both intimidating and aggressive. She kept the coffee full, but my soul empty. In her eyes was a contempt that few humans truly possess and I must admit a weight was lifted from my shoulders when I left the place. Let the PSTD begin.

DJD4lSZ3wbEFrTWa1VxKzw.text: Great breakfast place in the city.  It's best to try to get here early on the weekends or come on the weekdays due to all of the regulars and tourists on the weekends. They have huge portions for a reasonable price.  It is your typical "no frills" diner but that is the beauty of it.  I really enjoy the California benedict.

KESz17fOTYScILhKM4elCw.text: Yes, Deluca's is the iconic breakfast spot in Pittsburgh and one of the few places I will wait in line for breakfast on a weekend.  In the snow.  Why?  Do you really need reasons?  Well, for one, the breakfast burrito that barely fits on the plate.  For another, the Steel City Breakfast of Champions that includes all the breakfast food staples.  Need more?  The Bionic Omelet made of 6 eggs and as many fillings.  I've taken on all of these challenges (not at once) and triumphed 2 of the 3 times.  (The Bionic Omelet's onions got the better of me and I just couldn't finish.)  And I just have to love any place that serves Mancini's Italian toast.  This place can get busy, but it runs like a machine.  Sit at the counter by the grill on a Saturday or Sunday morning and just watch in amazement at how quickly and efficiently orders are filled when there's a line out the door.  Sometimes the wait service can be a little slow.  And it is still a cash only establishment.  But it is still my go-to breakfast spot in the Strip.  The prices I sometimes feel can be a little steep, but then I see the portion size and it makes sense.  Deluca's is always, in a word, dependable.
