jaZ6Wff_sx0wuPfNB0Fqbw.text: I know this place typically has a long wait but somehow I snuck in on a Saturday afternoon and sat at the bar for breakfast right away.  The service was amazingly fast.  I ordered the Huevos Rancheros and it literally came out in less than 30 seconds.  I was sitting next to the grill so I saw that they really made it and didn't just reheat something and their speed is impressive!  The food was pretty tasty but it had a bit too much chorizo (and I love meat).  Huge portion sizes and definitely a very Pittsburgh sort of place.  Don't go here if you are looking for something healthy ;)  I went back again later with a couple of friends and we all had a great experience.  The portions are HUGE and everything was delicious.  I think my friend's omelet had like 6 eggs and at least a pound of meat.

9FhteU36hVJI8XlKM54WiQ.text: Always visit when I am in the city. Everything I've had is amazing! Fair priced, service is quick and friendly, big portions. Gotta try a pancake sundae while you're there!

GhnJjsrC1Fud-3urnD-KeQ.text: I like!  Here's my take:  PROS: - Food is great. Is there a better traditional breakfast in Pittsburgh?  I doubt it! - The breakfast sandwich is my fave. Eggs, spicy sausage, and cheese on Mancini's bread. Just do it.  - Service is very quick and efficient. Try to run out of coffee. You can't! - The menu is huge, lots of good stuff to try.   CONS: - Its CASH ONLY, and it's now year 2018...  And that's all I can offer on the negative side.   If you've had this on your list but still haven't tried it, DO IT NOW!  Then write a Yelp review!!!

ysiJ5KBp-60SDkADxDQswQ.text: Perfect little breakfast spot. Food was amazing and fast. Friendly staff and great atmosphere. Don't be intimidated by the line. Quick turnover and service. Highly recommend.

AUjVRqVpWkDC3nNx8_PzMQ.text: Love Deluca's for a good weekend brunch spot!  Their menu is huge and there is definitely something for everyone, even if they want lunch.  Even though the restaurant is large, it is always packed and there is always a line.  The good news is, they get people in and out fast so the line moves pretty quickly.  The experience is always a bit hectic but the food makes it worth it. The portions at Deluca's are huge and so far everything I've tasted has been delicious.  My boyfriend makes sure to always order the cinnamon roll pancake which is a pancake with cinnamon and frosting glaze on it and it's amazingggg! I don't think you'll be disappointed with anything on the menu! Come for a fun and delicious breakfast in the strip district.  Also don't forget that it is CASH ONLY!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cinnamon Roll Pancake...it has frosting on it! Yummm!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seafood Breakfast Burrito
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2fqYug-GAjRtSAxm0OWoYw.text: Cool, old school yinzer eating experience. Nothing like a Sunday morning walk down the strip and a pit stop here. Had the seafood eggs Benedict...really cool take. Lobster and generous amounts of shrimp with avocado, Asiago, and more of a Texas toast than a traditional muffin. Also tried the cinnamon roll pancake which was a fun bite.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

CL4ws4DuZ5vSx6hgn2Chkw.text: This is my favorite diner in all of Pittsburgh. Everything I've tried has been great but my personal favorite is the blueberry pancakes. I can never pass up some diner style pancakes! But go early if you don't want to wait in a big line. However, if you do find yourself waiting in line keep in mind that it moves quickly and is 100% worth the wait.

2A3h7uVAAkdLUAsSEWhsBg.text: Lol at this place. You will feel very local eating here, greasy food, long wait, huge menu, you get the gist. Not my kind of place but I didn't look on yelp first, I just took the local advice. I did get the famous burrito, the sour cream came out in packets  we had a riot. Oh and my photo is of the bucket on the floor collecting the water from the leaky ceiling.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0eNw2YIJyqkZTNghw729dQ.text: Going here you're going have to wait in line especially on the weekends. Well worth the wait.  Followed other's advice and just ordered multiple things and it all came out awesome!   Had the banana pepper omelette and a waffle with pecans inside and both were amazing and cooked perfectly.  Even the coffee was good and I normally can't stand diner coffee.   Must stop in Pittsburgh and prices were cheap as well.

cD1IZ8HMoKzA8N_efk5XJA.text: Deluca's just gets me. I am not fancy and always hungry. Deluca's is not fancy and always gives me enough food for the next 3 days.  Deluca's is located right in the middle of the strip district in Pittsburgh. They perfectly embody the Steel City with the older and interior and hearty offerings. I've never had a bad meal here. I'm not a big sweets person, but I have taken large bites of my sister's chocolate chip pancakes. They're absolutely delicious, and enough to feed the whole family. However, I am a savory omelette type of morning gal. I've had both the Super Bowl and the Seafood omelettes, and they're amazing. I especially love the seafood omelette because for $13.99, you receive an omelette the size of a newborn child and it is STUFFED with seafood. It is such a good deal! Besides the omelettes, my favorite item is the seafood Benedict. Their hollandaise sauce is incredible and of course, you have a solid 3-4 meals out of it.  Ugh, I'm sad I won't get my Deluca's fix until next month. If you're in Pittsburgh and have some cash (no cards!), definitely stop by. It's worth the hype.

M2HBg3yIIkjf82UgsnlceQ.text: DeLuca's has been a nice breakfast treat for me when visiting Pittsburgh. Today was my third trip here over the past 5 or so years. I don't plan on going back. The kids ordered chocolate milk and were given spoiled milk. I complained and they brought more spoiled milk. My French toast had a hair and an onion in it. The poor service, uncleanliness, and lack of care are unforgivable.

nsZgjv5SumnHRmbNW1Hc3w.text: You know a place has great food when the line just to get seated is about 30 people deep outside in the cold. We were here for the Steelers/Ravens game and this place is set in the middle of all these small local shops which were all wonderful to see while you wait. The menu is extensive for all meals we personally were not expecting this much food. We had massive plates with hot food and even though the place was swarming, we had excellent service. Would highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hgmCPYfxPwKC-XpQ9cMFnA.text: We came in to Pittsburgh and the first stop we made was DeLucas! The server was very sweet and friendly. We ordered the corn beef and Swiss omelette (husband), I ordered the mix grill with kielbasa, and my son ordered a waffle. Everything was delicious! Coffee was perfect. We arrived early Thursday morning and did not wait, we were seated immediately. It is cash only but atms are all around and we didn't mind stopping and getting cash out. We are from California, but if we return to Pittsburgh we would definitely return to DeLucas

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0L-uhztAOGOfCueEHNwLUQ.text: This is our breakfast spot--our "go to" for a good breakfast--and we are picky. . We go to many breakfast places but this one is tops. Atmosphere, food and staff.  (Kim is the best!)

sPTOC0tYuD7uf9oTtVfsAw.text: CASH ONLY!  When in PIT for business I was told that I had to go to Deluca's for breakfast.  Now, I am telling you the same.  This place is in the Strip and has been there for a very long time.  A nice variety of items on the menu.  This is old school dinner at it's very best.  CASH ONLY! CASH ONLY! CASH ONLY!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Old school!  Cash only

OAh9Q5bhAQDEaSCPIcZxUg.text: Best breakfast burrito ever!  Friendly, fast service.  Don't miss this place.  Huge servings in a classic diner.  This place should be featured on The Food Network's show Diners Drive-ins and Dives.

v7QOgzZxNvT9Y8cFzuA3BA.text: Ok, so up until this point, I would say Deluca's gets 4 stars. However, yesterday I had an experience to give them that extra star. I always get one of the eggs Benedict or something in the sandwich section or a regular breakfast with pancakes.   But wait so back to yesterday, we had multiple servers come up and wait on us and try to fill our water or get us stuff. On top of that, my friend doesn't eat pork so he asked for all turkey sausage with his meal. Unfortunately it came out with bacon piled on it. However, the waitress immediately took it back once we said it wouldn't have been a big deal but he doesn't eat pork and they started making a whole new plate of everything.   I decided to branch out and get the chicken and waffle. I'm picky about chicken and waffles no matter where I go because I've had some great ones and some ok ones. But let me tell you, this no frills chicken and waffle was amazing. It's nothing fancy, which is what I expected. But the chicken was soooo juicy and breaded and fried perfectly and the waffle had just enough sweetness to it to balance it out and was dense but fluffy at the same time. And the best part is it comes with a side of eggs. Usually when I get chicken and waffles I want eggs and get them as a side but this one it comes with it and I got them over easy and it was great.   Honestly I can't wait to go get it again.

9vhw5d650PSIEfi9V2GfwQ.text: Update: this place has gone downhill and is so overrated. I came here again yesterday and brought some people from out of town. I had the California Dreamin salad: greens, chicken, feta, pecans, strawberries and blueberries. When it came out, the strawberries and blueberries were not fresh - they were thawed out frozen fruit, that were very soggy and wet in my salad. If you can't have fresh fruit in your restaurant... WHY PUT IT ON THE MENU? After removing the fruit from my salad, I did enjoy it - it was tasty without it. Two more things that made me uneasy: watching a member of staff prep vegetables... she was sitting at the counter slicing tomatoes with her bare hands. These were obviously not going to be cooked (which would sanitize them), because they were sliced to fit on sandwiches.  Next, another woman emerged from downstairs and immediately started a screaming match with coworkers across the room. She was right next to our table. Awkward.  Needless to say, this place has gone downhill. I feel like it needs a health inspection.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mixed grill with sausage
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana split crepe
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu!

bClQhDJnlOWHzHKkrggjDw.text: I genuinely do not understand the hype about this place. I'm all for waiting in line for 30-45 minutes if the place is "worth the wait", but sadly this is not the case.   My family of 5 was split into two tables, we were told they were not allowed to seat 5 people in a booth, even though we voiced our preference was to be together. That's fine, everyone has rules. Their entire back section was reserved for a party of 20, which was expected to show up about 10 minutes after our arrival. This party of 20 never showed up and the diner staff never offered that we be moved to those tables where we would've been able to sit altogether. Minor detail, but it would've been greatly appreciated.   When I ordered my breakfast, I paused waiting for the waitress to ask me how I like my eggs, bacon or sausage, etc. When I paused, she snapped back and said, "You have to tell me how you want your eggs." It was so short & so rude.   The food was subpar, it was at least cheap but so was the quality.   These instances are small in nature, but they were not countered with any redeeming qualities. All in all, this place was not worth it: the line was long, the service was horrific, and the food was terrible. After years working in hospitality, I tend to be pretty lenient and understanding of the different struggles that go into a restaurant. This place does not deserve leniency or your time.

BgpOIV-vOOZ5z4wDXXYsqw.text: I went today with my boyfriend around 10:30am. We were sat quickly at the counter despite the fact that they were busy. The food came out quickly, both were large portions, and our server was awesome! Definitely a must go to breakfast spot when visiting Pittsburgh! Be sure to stop at the ATM as it is cash only!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Raisin French roast made with Mancini&#39;s Bread.

xP3VQ2xbvF1qgcxDTcwehA.text: We got there early on Sunday morning,  7:15am.  Because the line for this hot spot is insane on the weekends.   Rightly so. Because even its breakfast proper you're not  interested in eating again until the dinner bell.   Atmosphere is diner loud. Employees are focused, happy and active participants regarding service and quality of experience.   The crepes are fabulous, we the apple and the lingonberry. Both generous, sweet and flavorful. Side of bacon is FOUR slices.   The men had ginormous combos. They raved over the pancakes. But there was also eggs, hash browns, toast and breakfast meat...  a LOT of food.   If you haven't eaten here, do it.  That impossibly long line isn't for nothing.   Great eats. Great service.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

B4ISvAPmec4_6xbkAeJJOA.text: Food, and lots of it. The best breakfast in Pittsburgh ! Great service and very busy. If you want to lose weight and you like to eat, don't go here. The platter of food I ordered arrived quickly and hot. The corned beef hash is crispy on the outside and warm and tender on the inside. The meat and eggs were cooked to perfection and the cost is reasonable for the amount of great food you get. Other family members ordered pancakes that covered the platters, not plates. The toppings looked great, but they would not share. If you are in the City of Champions, this IS the place for breakfast !

5K-5knnKS-XxtYLO28WTqg.text: This review was brought to you by the letter P.  P is for patience and I hope you have some if you're choosing DeLuca's.  My friends alerted me to the fact that they've never been to the Pittsburgh staple, DeLuca's.  So after a rough previous day/night we decided we'd venture down to the Strip and get our fill on diner breakfast at noon on a Sunday.  The line out of the door didn't sway our choice.  We were in it for the long haul and what else can you expect, it was a beautiful Sunday and people were hungry.  The four of us waited probably 20 minutes to get in and by this time we were very hungry and in desperate need of caffeine.    The first "problem" with DeLuca's is that their menu is too expansive.  Some would view this as a problem, myself included in that I have too much of a hard time deciding what I want to shove down my gullet.  The waitress, a nice enough lady, swung by after a few minutes to get our drink orders.  A round of water and coffee please.  The drinks arrived soon there after and we finally figured out what we'd have to eat.  The place was packed so expected to wait a bit for our food and we did probably another 20-30 minutes, which was fine.  However, after finishing our coffees we weren't pleased with having to wait and wait for fill ups.  As a former waiter this is a red x with me and coupled with the black grease encased around some of my homefries knocked this heavy weight in the Pittsburgh food scene down a peg.    I enjoyed my meal though and it was definitely a huge portion as were all my buddy's.  The fried chicken and biscuits with gravy, homefries, and eggs was exactly what I needed after a long day of brew festing and staying up way later than I am used to.  The chicken was fried very well, moist on the inside, crispy exterior even with the gravy.  Eggs were over easy as I ordered.  The biscuits were warm and tasted homemade.  And aside from a few homefries swimming in black grease from the griddle were exactly what you want in a homefry.  Some crisp with that griddle fried skin and some mushy.    DeLuca's doesn't need any help from Yelp and won't go out of business because of this review or any other review, it's a giant because of their portions, location, and history so go if you're patient and have a hunger for something greasy.

GLR3G0DzjTluW9mm7dgF7Q.text: Oh my Lord, y'all. This place is all around fantastic. There's a reason famous people come here to eat. AMAZING food, INCREDIBLE service, and that small time diner feel with food that surpassed expectations. Before I talk about food, I have to mention the management. My dad grew up here, and when we came to eat here in November (we were visiting from Texas) they were already closed. Well the owner was outside and she heard we had friends that liked this place, she let us in and fed us a HUGE meal for a perfect price. We were the only ones in the diner but she made us feel so welcome. She was so nice and easy to talk to. It was really cool. The portions here are huge so come in hungry! Their French Toast and I believe other bread items on the menu are from Mancini's bread shop next door, which is the best Italian bread ever, so the French Toast was literally THE BEST French Toast I've ever had. That's saying a lot because I love french toast and try it at every breakfast place I go to. I still have dreams about it.  I can't wait to visit The Strip again and come to Deluca's for a huge meal at a great price surrounded by friendly, caring people. Great experience all around.

wsRVHufXvpT160NQZxzadQ.text: Awesome breakfast I had to stop in, I  heard great stories and it was presented on food network. The services was great & fast. I order the western omelet and every bit of it was great as I'm typing this review it make me want to stop in I wish they did all day breakfast.  Best in Pittsburgh &  strip district

GpP-EsF8rlNRUaWSVbyZlg.text: There are always disputes among fans of Deluca's, Pamela's, and the rest.  This is my favorite all around breakfast place based on my enjoyment of a working man's breakfast, the old greasy spoon, if you will.  I'm talking old school, blue color Pittsburgh style.  A place where one meal can get you through the day, with the help of some antacids of course.  Servings are large, hearty, and filling.  Always enjoyed hitting this place up on a Saturday morning following a late night with friends.  My favorites are the Eggs Benedict on that local Mancini's Italian, the Mixed Grill, and the Cherry Coke's flavored with their own syrup.

6ihjz3By1ewKonQdQIUlwg.text: The only reason I give Deluca's four and not five stars is because going to the Strip District--especially on a weekend is a nightmare. It is not the easiest place to get to via the bus and parking is near impossible on a Saturday or Sunday. So if it is at all a possibility, go to Deluca's during the week and you will eliminate this hassle from your experience.   That out of the way this place is definitive of Pittsburgh through and through. It is a great greasy diner and the service is great! I have only ever had the breakfast burrito and the pancakes -- both of which are delicious. The only knock my friends have on the food is that it is so "predictable." To that I say: IT IS A DINER PEOPLE!   I don't know if people are expecting gourmet cuisine, but if that is what you are looking for do not go to Deluca's. Go to Deluca's if you want an awesome diner breakfast and do not want to be hungry for the remainder of the day.

guszWJI9Pjm0PJdFWvUYeg.text: I was strolling through the Strip District and really had no intention on eating here. It had a huge line outside. Unfortunately my girlfriend was quite hungry and the line cleared out shortly there after so we decided to stop in.  If you love a greasy breakfast, this might just be the place to go. The portion sizes are pretty decent, I had a 6 egg omelet with a lot of meat in it. It tasted good enough, and filled me up. Like most diner food, I felt pretty queasy later on in the day from all of the grease.   There were 2 huge negatives to this place. First was the price. It wasn't out of this world expensive, but just not worth what they charge. It came to about 25 dollars for 2 people. We only drank water and there were no add on sides.   The second was, some nasty waiter walking around putting his fingers on everything. I saw this guy working at some desk, rummaging through drawers then back to serving the food. He was touching a lot of peoples foods with his bare hands, not washing or sanitizing. It seemed very needless to touch them the way he was.  They do not have the best breakfast in Pittsburgh, nor would I go here again.

4NjautoRF0QWS2aZ0f8-Ug.text: This is what I consider the quintessential American diner. 4 stars for the food and 1 star for the authentic experience.   - Capital D diner food: Lots of butter, bacon, and carbs - Great old-school booths and counter to sit on - Breakfast hits it out of the park in classic diner fashion - Food comes out quick - Free coffee refills  Easy beats Pamela's. On the food front there about toe-to-toe, but this place wins on the experience. If you're in town for just a few days, this is definitely one of the places to check out.

HcDBxOlo0ACjJkOJbTnZCA.text: Picture it: Sicily.  1924.  A young peasant girl with some lire and a dream takes her place in line at a humble trattoria run by fellow paisan, signore DeLuca.  Wait, wait.  I got "Golden Girls" mixed up with Yelp.  Picture it: Pittsburgh.  2013.  A [ahem] young couple with some cash and a dream take their place in line at a humble diner run by........someone.  Probably no longer related to the original DeLuca.  At any rate, they were prepared for a long wait; had just hunkered down to weather the blowhard frat type behind them bellowing into his iPhone about the difference between a wine and beer hangover and repeatedly declaring his determination to see what waiting in line for breakfast was all about; when the angel of breakfast mercy, a rotund little bespectacled woman, called out for two people willing to sit at the counter.  Counter, you say?  This particular couple *loves* counter-sitting at greasy spoons, watching short order cooks literally sling hash, fry eggs and flip flapjacks with deft precision and enviable speed.  And so the counter is exactly where they landed this Saturday morning, entranced by the choreography behind it, ignoring the sticky Linoleum floors.  He had Chicken and Waffles -- buckwheat waffle, to be exact -- she the Cinnamon Bun Pancakes.  And, oh.  They were both so happy.  Crisped, crunchy white meat chicken atop a flavorful and toothsome waffle, dusted with powdered sugar and drizzled with syrup; cinnamon-studded hotcakes with swirls of icing and swaths of maple syrup.  Washed down by the requisite *okay* drip coffee.  Served by a manager with his finger on the pulse of every server, line cook and bus boy in the joint.  Cash only, dear reader.  [15 Minutes of Fame: "Man v. Food: Pittsburgh"]

gZBlyXjZtfg5SCAnsenGYw.text: Great food! Really good coffee. For the price you get an incredible amount of food. I wish I was in town longer to go again.

7I8ov4uiDXp6BVWe3CSzjg.text: Deluca's isn't a IHOP you pull up park and stroll in. The Strip District has parking, but you'll pay to park and walk to get to Deluca's. I saw people standing in line waiting to eat while jackhammers were chipping up the sidewalk a few feet away. That kind of devotion says it all!  The food was good, the service was great. The food isn't greasy or nasty. The menu choices are unique. I would eat there again. I would recommend eating there on weekdays to avoid the crowds.   Pittsburgh's Strip District has some great places to shop and wonderful foods to purchase. I can't wait to go back.

m9UK831K4qLYUYdsGTh3XA.text: Best breakfast I've had in years. I'm not a carb kind of guy for breakfast so I stuck with a meaty omelet. My family of 6 fell in love and we went here 2 times on our vacation in just 4 days. The coffee and their breakfast sausage was just amazing. We liked them so much we went next door a few stores down and bought the coffee, and a few blocks down we bought 5 pounds of sausage to bring home.  Service was excellent, staff was very pleasant.

ujK9GEqNt2d6Ji3hoH_tag.text: Now for the conclusion of my Deluca's adventure... Insomnia, Daylight Savings Time, The Devil, and I "Springing Forward," a lack of Kay around (she was visiting relatives out of town for the weekend), and a looming Monday morn cursed me with a fitful night of near-sleeplessness. There was however a brief, tortured dreamtime interlude in which I had a second encounter with The Adversary, he who caused me to gorge and involuntarily purge at Burgatory over 2 years ago... Delusions of Grandeur, The Great Beast, and Growling, Animate Grub From a ring of black smoke, The Adversary introduced me to The MOAB, the MUTHA of all Burritos, and there is nothing maternal about it. The Fallen Angel and his emissary of stuffed tortilla belitted me, spat at me, and became intangible when I attempted to thrash them. "You'll never finish it," The Adversary derisively shouted, his voice sounding like broken glass as the lumpen ogre that is the MOAB uttered gutteral, gutter epithets. Destroy My Digestive System At Dawn My skin clammy, and my stomach somewhat queasy, I foolishly leapt from my bed, washed up, dressed and headed to The Strip to defeat a burrito. I arrived ten minutes early and waited patiently to enter. Once I did, however, MOAB and The Adversary decided to play mindgames with me, telling me that I could get my hands on either of them IF I bested both an omelet and a dessert pancake. It would be a handicap match with a stipulation too gratifying to resist. "In this corner, weighing in at a combined weight of err...several pounds, and seconded by The Adversary and MUTHA of All Burritos, the team of Captain Drew's Seafood Omelet and The Funky Monkey Pancakes." The crowd jeered, eagerly awaiting the arrival of the hero... *Entrance music* youtube.com/watch?v=Uu4e... "Coming to the ring and weighing in at 210 pounds, he is Proletarian Steel, ladies and gentleman, Darren W!" The crowd stands and collectively roar like a turbine. 10,000 feet meet the arena floor, making the sound of a marching army. The pancake dish is a tower of terror constructed from 3 chocolate-chip banana pancakes, whipped cream, hot fudge, and golden vanilla ice cream, and it attacked first, punishing me with carbohydrates, sludgy cocoa, cream, and frozen dairy products. As I was halfway finished with it, in came Captain Drew's Seafood Omelet to blindside me. Topped with avocado chunks, a buttery Hollandaise (one of the better Hollaindaise sauces I've had at area restaurants) and suffused with garlic sauteed Langostinos, lump crabmeat, phat-ass shrimp, and an Asiago/Swiss cheese blend, the newspaper-roll omelete threatened to engulf me in eggy, yellow oblivion, yet I munched and chomped my way to victory, hitting Captain Drew with a quick spear to get the pinfall while Funky Monkey was dumped outside of the ring via a fireman's carry. Those pancakes however... Perhaps it was that I was running out of time or that the ice cream was heavy and rich enough on its own, but I was only able to eat 2/3 of it. Call it a non-contest after The Adversary and MOAB interfered and TV time expired, but not being able to fight them all off, I was quadruple-teamed, taking The Adversary's cane in the stomach along with several splashes. The Adversary and MOAB would then "cut a promo" promising to clog and crush my "working-class chump heart" as I was carried away by officials. "You did good," said my spry, affable, and conscientous waitress (she reheated my sourdough toast when it had gotten cold). "Most people would never be able to eat all that food." "Eh, I wish I hadn't," I told her. "It was real good, though." But I'll be back. I've a vendetta on my shoulders.

hBbEepdeR5yA4U9xD7tI9Q.text: Yummy dirty breakfast!  That is a compliment for me... sometimes we just want a breakfast that does not cry out to be healthy and DeLuca's offered me just that on my day off this past Monday.    Any time I have been in the Strip, I have wanted to go but the lines were too crazy and out of control.  So being down in the Strip when it was not nearly as busy finally allowed me the opportunity to finally have the Mixed Grill that I had been yearning for.   This amazing home fries covered in grilled mixed veggies and then eggs with toast was scrumptious!  My coffee was always full, and my stomach left full so I was very much a happy camper.    If you hate lines and waiting, come here during the week... it is a definite must have!

cMemPIYL0iUZFJMIBVCSRw.text: Try the Turkey sandwich. It is so good. The gravy is the best in town.  You don't open this sandwich with your hands. It's a fork sandwich.  Excellent service.   Bring back the Italian Sandwich!!!!

PxMfYwJ2h_CTPIO_KLzKIQ.text: This is my favorite place for breakfast in Pittsburgh. You can't go wrong with their pancakes or waffles! If you're going here on the weekend, you can anticipate that the line will be out the door. They are excellent about getting you seated as quickly as possible, so don't let it intimidate you too much!

KAM_3BMc_3G1AqYwmoF4-g.text: Love this place omg! Just wish it wasn't always so crowded. The prices are cheap and you get PLENTY of food for the price. Waiters are usually friendly when I come in so that's not an issue, only issue is parking. The strip district is always busy. It's worth the parking hassle!! :)

s80Xat4Y539mgdmCWm5lkg.text: Hands down the best breakfast place in the Burgh!  You will wait in line and you will not regret the wait.  Try the eggs benedict!

SoHh1R1DrwW2ezmCNLgi8w.text: Everything was delicious! Had the breakfast burrito and the wife had the hot roast beef sandwich with mounds of mashed potatoes.  Soo much food!

j_Fffm-p80XXRvMVRwMW8A.text: Breakfast is by far my favorite meal of the day. Some days I like it so much that I eat it twice (not at the same time, well mostly). So please understand that my rating is serious! as a serious breakfast connoisseur. Deluca's gets hype because it's awesome. It's not fancy. but it is some serious down to earth good breakfast foods. no pomp, no circumstance. just food. and a good amount of it also. I can often be found here eating eggs benedict, with reckless abandon, a big grin on my face, and a side of bacon well done.   Favorite foods: Greek Eggs benedict! steak tomato and feta? INSANE. Seafood benedict! equally insane Any of their pancakes (I don't even like pancakes, but I like theirs)  There is some times a wait, but they really do their best to keep it moving, and the staff are all super nice and speedy at getting you your future food coma. I'm not a fan of their coffee (read my reviews about my coffee snobbery elsewhere) but it will get the job done, eyes bright and alert! - their proximity to 21st street coffee as well as all of the other wonderful places in the strip makes a visit here a great start to all days that end in Y.   They are cash only but there is a PNC ATM 2-3 doors down. I'm a repeat customer, a fan, and I'm sure you will be too.

vYgrTvvXDwCdL-cEfXOgYw.text: While on a red bus tour, we heard about this breakfast place. We went in with high hopes.  There were three of us, and the line had about 15 people in front of us.  It didn't take long for us to get a table, maybe 15 minutes.  Our waitress came over shortly afterwards and took our order.  It then took about 15-20 minutes for her to bring our drinks.  The food was just mediocre.  I had a waffle that was undercooked.  Someone else had the oatmeal that was not very hot. The last person got eggs, bacon and hotcakes which was maybe the best choice.  The food came out pretty quick, considering how long it took for drinks.  It was just so-so, possibly even less than so-so.  I'd recommend Pamelas's over Delucas.

qTUcSCIaHSWhIbTTjEfPOA.text: Fast service and delicious food. Great prices. Cinnamon  sugar french toast was to die for. This was my first trip but there will definitely be more.

_NvEVCa-6CysxextUPmDjA.text: People talk about the line the wait etc but it was fast getting in and getting served food was good and great price service real Pittsburghy and I loved it

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu with keys
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Typical breakfast yum
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Turkey links eggs and waffle yum

FUJULHk8JRekJPHKsbir5Q.text: I think I died and went to heaven here. I went for breakfast after a night of drinking (it was Friday, so the wait wasn't very long). And omg, the eggs benedict I got was some of the best I have ever had. I am getting hungry right now just thinking about it. They put it on some sort of French bread instead of a biscuit, and it didn't get soggy fast, which made all the difference. The avocado on it was fresh on the eggs - and the sauce on top was perfect. Our waitress was also super helpful and nice. She did a fantastic job. The only downside is that they are cash only. Oh well - small price to pay for being so delicious! I can't wait until I am in the city again to eat there.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The most delicious avocado eggs Benedict ever

edJg5h2IcognedDlQcJfkg.text: I cannot believe how many times I've been to this place without being in a food coma. Hands down one of the best brunch place in Pittsburgh. It is strange I waited that long to write them a review. I don't think I've ever gotten anything here I don't enjoy. I always order more than one item, I know I'm a fatty at heart. I always get a sweet stuff such as pancakes or waffles, and a savory entree. I usually got either omelette or egg Benedict. They have a huge selection on breakfast food, they also serve lunch food but I've never tried them before. The only reason I didn't give them a five stars is that they don't take credit cards, and also sometimes the servers are too busy to check on you as often as I wanted to. Other than that, de Lucas never fail to satisfy :) it is a great place to take your friends or out of town visitors. Oh, and it's worth the long wait ;)

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My egg Benedict. Yummm
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Our Belgium waffles, we literally killed it in two minutes

wk40yc-a3h7ABwlnUmGUUw.text: One of those cool little hole in the wall places.  Place probably hasn't been updated in 40 years, but kinda the place that I like to look for food gems.  This place was featured on a episode of Man vs Food, and has been heavily reviewed up to this point, so no real big surprises here.  Overall the food was good.  We had their breakfast burrito, apple pancakes, and Denver omelette, all of which I tried and all good choices.  We got there early and although not very busy, the service was slow and a bit lackluster and probably the one thing that keeps me from giving 5 stars instead of 4.

ZSTU_G0Bx3cbg5u3PN45vQ.text: Trip to Pittsburgh....  Wasn't very welcoming.... no hi, hello or how are you? when entering. Dirty tables, empty jelly containers under the table and staff checked on at the end of the meal. ooooohhh and the flies....   As for the food..... I ordered pancakes,  philly cheesesteak omelette and home fries.  Pancakes-Nothing special  Omelette- Pretty good no complaints  Home fries- Bland and mushy

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2LCIDzKoqdGLEtt4QWL-sw.text: DeLuca's is a Pittsburgh landmark with a great reputation... and I found it to be "all that and a bag of chips."    Get there early... as it gets packed on the weekends.  There is no wait list, so you need to get in line.  Once seated, I found the wait staff was very attentive.  The food was delicious and I will look to return here next time I'm in the Burgh.   Loved the Pittsburgh Slam with 2 eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage and French Toast (Lingonberry Preserve & Lemon).  The Coffee is good and the menu has a lot of interesting dishes for both breakfast and lunch.  As I was here for breakfast, I hope to go back soon to explore some of the other dishes.

8qxlffi52ekgDRrzMBWeCA.text: This is the best diner breakfast in Pittsburgh. It is always packed but they move people through relatively quickly - not to mention it's well worth the wait! Their omelettes are huge, the food always comes quickly and hot, and the service is always exceptional. 10/10 would recommend.

yuktWSd_wYMT9ekkGGDHJw.text: I love food! I think for the most part everyone on Yelp does. This is why I wake up in the morning, this is what we all have in common, and this is why I would wait on a line for 45 minutes, for good food. The local people outside waiting like us said this place is amazing. The couple being older told us about all the local spots, but insisted we picked the right one. They also mentioned Deluca's was featured in "Jack Reacher" and on "Man vs. Food". There are other famous people that dined here, but I don't have the time to name them all. When we finally got inside we had to wait to be seated. There were empty tables but the staff moved slow. I was surprised by that, but not everyone moves like a New Yorker. My brother asked if they could hurry up and seat us but the waitress was rude and kept walking. I didn't worry about it as we were seated next. When I walked to my seat I noticed a plaque which stated "Tom Cruise" sat here. Oh boy, now I felt like I was lucky. The rude waitress ended up being our  server, how's that for Irony. She was still rude but it was ok, I am here to eat! They had so much food already cooked the wait wasn't that bad. When my meal finally came I had to wait because the waitress forgot my bacon. But when it arrived I dug right in. I am running out of words to use to describe incredible food. This breakfast was by far the best meal I have ever eaten. Words can't be put together the right way to explain the full measure on how amazing this meal was. I have no negative other then the packaged butter being to hard. I am so annoyed with finding these gems and not having them in New York. If I come to Pittsburgh again this will be my number one breakfast stop. I just need to bring a bigger pair of jeans.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steel City- Scrambled Eggs with Cheese, Home Fries, Bacon, Sweet Sausage
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Part of the &#34;Steel City&#34;
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wheat Toast

QR3vsCOZ4Qqw1ZoIKZ_URg.text: Well... this is the famous Deluca' s with big portions and old school 50's diner feel. They're right. Very old and run down but the service is good and the food is too. Large portions and huge menu selections. Cash only so if you're using cards on your trip and you want to come to Deluca 's get cash.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Huge portions and good grub... just don&#39;t look for a lot of healthy options.
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rustic diner decor from the 1950s
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Adam Richman seat from Man vs Food

VZcWzFn91G4dqFmC1kOuqg.text: I'm so in between 4 & 5 stars. Maybe I'll decide by the end of this review.   We stopped in after I've been patiently waiting to have breakfast here. There was a party in front of us, but we were fine sitting at the counter.   We took a little while to look over the menu. It had so many options. Multiple choices for omelets, french toast, pancakes (AND crepes), breakfast sandwiches ect.  I even noticed a dessert-type of pancakes which had chocolate sauce for example and whip cream-- again multiple choices in that section as well. We took a little while to decide. Note: This is just the breakfast menu that I'm referring too ^^  I ordered the steel city breakfast of champions. It came with 2 eggs, 2 pieces of bacon, sausage patty, home fries, toast plus my choice of pancakes, waffle or french toast. I chose the french toast. My breakfast definitely satisfied me and filled me up! The french toast was extremely fluffy and had powdered sugar on it :D Loved the home fries by the way! It was fun to witness the cooks make them from the counter (if you're counting calories, don't watch them make the home fries, fyi!)  Bobby started ordering an omelet with whatever he wanted in it.. The kind server suggested the Bionic Omelet which has 5 eggs, sausage, bacon, ham, pepperoni, onions, cheddar & provolone. This omelet was huge (take a look at the picture I added) I'm not exaggerating. I should have shown my little hand compared to it. I wouldn't have guessed 5 eggs, it looked like maybe 8. He was only able to finish half the omelet. His words "I need to finish this to feel like a man" haha.   We had a great time & I'm excited to head back. Next time we may try the Robinson location since he works up that way. I believe they have longer hours as well.   okay, 5 stars :) I don't even care that I have to stop at the ATM before heading here (cash only)

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steel City- 2 eggs 2 bacon + sausage &amp; homefries. Not shown are my toast &amp; French toast.. it wouldn&#39;t fit w/o making a scene lol
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. the bionic omelet.. bigger than my bighead!

-Lzva2fwUILPXbqo8t0GcA.text: This has been the worst customer service I've ever encountered! I don't care if you're busy, you can still be nice to your paying customers! Not worth the wait.

YxWfnn6E5v0UZXSXdekGrQ.text: Only Italians could take something as perfect as a breakfast burrito and make it...better! Seriously. Italian sausage, the most amazing tomato sauce, peppers, cheese, eggs. I thought I was going to die it was so good. Plus, it was the only place open at 6:30. I liked it so much, it features in a book I'm writing.

nXPEd8ARao6bJfKqMn0Txw.text: Great place great food if you don't mind waiting a little bit outside until some room clears out to be a seated its a small place but some of the greatest breakfast food in town the service is very very quick. We went on NYE and it was 10 degrees but it was worth the wait for cheap great food! The breakfast is the best I highly recommend The chicken and biscuits! Big portions of food The staff is very nice felt very welcomed! So if you're in the strip district I highly recommend!

ds9MamsvLoyEJpWuYRM4rA.text: I really can't believe I've never made it here! And I went on the worst possible time too, during the holidays! But the wait wasn't too too bad, even if it was out in the cold for about 15 minutes. Totally worth it once you're warm inside and a hot plate of breakfast food is staring at you!  I'm going to do the thing you shouldn't do but everyone does, compare it to Pamela's. I mean, it's one of the most popular breakfast spots in Pittsburgh, how can I not!? And happily I'd say it was totally on par. Would I say it's better? Probably the same, but for different reasons.   They looked to have a bigger menu than Pamela's, serving hotcakes (what Pamela's is famous for) and regular pancakes. Although I'm a huge pancake fan and most of the options looked amazing, I really wanted a regular down home eggs, homefires, sausage and toast breakfast.  And with an expanded menu they have so many choices beyond the menu! When I asked for sausage she was like, patty, turkey, hot, veggie... the list went on! I had to hear them twice! My homefries were good, I added onion and pepper to the mix, I just wish they would have been a tad crispier.   The place really does have it's own identity, with the red vinyl booths and memorabilia on the walls. Service was friendly, but remember they are CASH ONLY!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs, turkey sausage and home fries
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate Chip pecan

LQJ1d4HTdx8rnQaHHPhXGQ.text: Looking to avoid the long lines at Deluca's, I did breakfast before class at 8:30 AM with some friends.  I had been wanting to try here for ages, and as someone who is unimpressed with Pamela's, I wasn't sure if Deluca's would be a big disappointment too.  I am happy to report that I really enjoyed this place, and it is significantly better than Pamela's.  Let me start with the decor.  It is so tacky and wonderful.  It is totally bizarre and gives this place a unique vibe, considering it is just a diner.  It fascinated the group throughout breakfast.  I ordered the Western Omelette ($10.29).  It came with toast and hash browns, but I don't eat potatoes so I just opted for toast.  The omelette was good and loaded up nicely.  They also threw in both red and green peppers which was a nice treat.  There are lots of toast options to choose from, and I enjoyed the sour dough.  The biscuits and gravy one of my friends ordered were yummy as well.  The price was a touch high, but the food was good.  After seeing the pancakes go by, though, I would have to try them next time.  Overall, it's not worth waiting in line for more than a few minutes, but this place is good.

zQbgzQS3l-cLje6rbt794A.text: I hate to give this review but I think I have to... We went there on the day Steelers are playing the Broncos. We were there around 9 and there was a long line.. My friends and I always thought the long lines mean good things.. Boy we were wrong.. Half of us ordered the steak and eggs and it was the most disgusting steak I had, Bland... Not cooked to what I asked... My eggs had all sorts of black residue.. The bread came after 10 minutes of giving us our meal... Customer service was okay....

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak and egg

Sk-Ey1pD8MyTPJulQsRATw.text: What a great place to go for the best pancakes ever ....... There was a line outside of the restaurant, don't be intimidated it moves fast , the restaurant is a lot bigger then it looks !   Bring CASH , no credit cards taken !  Ice cream on pancakes is a huge hit at least with my kids !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. What kid doesn&#39;t love ice cream with their pancakes?

5uAxDJlAWc6qZeriJwi0dA.text: Deluca's dinner had great food at least for my non vegetarian friends... They didn't have a great vegetarian selection but they had some great and really soft pancakes ... The quantity was massive and I wasn't able to finish... The building had a nice ambience and an old restaurant vibe and the waiters are really polite and helpful..( In case you can't finish they'll give you a box so you can take the food back home )..

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pancakes with whipped cream and chocolate sauce...

6TUr-mh9YyPnu4jqDRxfMA.text: Best place in Pittsburgh for brunch. I had the chicken fried steak with sausage gravy and it was the best sausage gravy I've had in a very long time.

PFBay6hW6G14UK5EN-uiHw.text: Excellent breakfasts in a old fashioned dive atmosphere. Even had a healthier option: Had an excellent frittata with fresh vegetables and cheese. A long wait, but classic large-sized plates full of good food. Affordable to boot.

Tlfqy8_IU7FFU0okdSkV6w.text: I've gone to Deluca's multiple times in the past few years and every time it's delicious! There are an extensive number of breakfast options that are really great, depending on what you are in the mood for. They have stacks of specialty pancakes with extravagant toppings and tons of other, more savory options. Watch out and plan early to come, cause the line is always out the door!

K3LhBpXC3qkHnCThRj06xg.text: Amazing place for breakfast.  We came here on the last morning when visiting Pittsburgh.  So good!!! Everything on the menu is solid.  You really can't go wrong.  We kept hearing about this place and we even walked by it one of the days while exploring.  I'm so glad we got a chance to eat here before leaving.  If you are visiting Pittsburgh this is a must.  Check it out!

VUHfxOq54TcD8UPao6w9dQ.text: Still not sure how i feel about this place. While some say that the service is good, our waiter was hostile and scary at times. Yelled at us for not saying our order loud enough. In terms of food, i had an omelet which was good but a bit overcooked. I prefer fluffier eggs, like the ones in Pamela's.

xg6hh6IcJEc3BIXQXzqEvw.text: Long on my list of places to try, I finally got to this long time Pittsburgh breakfast spot. Friend of Joe's, Kevin was in town for some R&R and called me on a cold Thursday morning for breakfast, I offered Deluca's as a choice since I've never been there and neither has he. After he accepted, I got to thinking how bad parking was in the strip. Low and behold a spot opened about a half block away. We walked in and immediately were seated in the same booth Adam Richman sat in filming a spot for Man Vs Food some years back. Once seated, a waitress zoomed in with menus, coffee cups and a hot pot of coffee, almost reading my mind. The coffee was okay, nothing special, think the same coffee at Eat N Park or Kings, a little disappointing. Looking over the menu it was loaded with Pittsburgh favorites and gluttonous offerings. I choose the thin, crepe like pancakes served with loganberry preserves. Kevin on the other hand chose the Steel City breakfast, 2 hot cakes, sausage, bacon, eggs, and toast made from Macinie's bread. It was huge amount of food. My crepe like pancakes were lite, airy and delicious. The loganberry preserves with the perfect compliment for them, adding a touch of sweetness, a perfect foil for the savory crepes. The bill came to under 16 bucks which isn't too bad, about the same as Eat N Park or King's. the only trouble is parking, and would derail me from making this one of my go to places.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sat where Adam Richman sat

1JNVWgM9o_4oYr4TnbJFdg.text: Went this morning with my girlfriend and we got almost the same thing. The home fries where just a little under cooked but everything else we had was great. The pancakes where amazing and the food came out lightning fast.

h2566eLhyWo8hXiiuhdpvA.text: I was told you must visit Deluca's, we had to do take out because of the long line and and time constraints. I had the blast blt with the Cajun fries. I was not disappointed, very good food! Can't say to much else because of doing take out, but just from seeing the line to get in, plan accordingly.

d3ziweNK-YbTVNtxTfU2dQ.text: I'm always looking for local hole-in-the-walls places that have a feel for the city, people, and culture. Places where the atmosphere is full of history and of course the food is good! This place was both. Nothing glamorous at all but that's why I liked it. I took my family for breakfast and it was a quick and great meal. My daughter and I had the biscuits and gravy and my wife has the veggie breakfast. We all agreed that the food was great! If I had any negatives at all it would be that the temperature was hot inside and the booths are very small, which in my opinion is worth it for the experience. The waitress was pleasant, quick, and helpful. If you are in Pittsburgh and looking for a great breakfast and experience, go here!

ZzHwUCaoQwvnLX9wPNCPHA.text: Waited 30 mins for a table, which is apparently normal, was seated in a booth. Ordered the danish cakes with lingonberry preserves, companion had cinnamon bun pancakes with a side of eggs for both. Total cost including tax + tip was around $20. Great place, fun decorations/pictures!

3ZhRseg6xnqieJ2cMa8DPA.text: Decided to give Deluca's a try one Sunday for lunch because we were on the strip and I was in the mood for breakfast/brunch food.  Overall, I'd have to say that I left thinking it was nothing special and, later, feeling like it was very overhyped, when I found out Deluca's is somewhat of a Pittsburgh Icon.  Food was ok, but I did find HAIR IN MY FRENCH TOAST.  Which of course, made things rather unappealing, even after a new order was brought to me.  Service was average to poor.  The server didn't seemed to be too shocked or sorry about the fact that there was hair in my food.

LDF_yuCgXK_QifXMu2Tnnw.text: There was a very long wait time on a Saturday morning. Took us like an hour before we were seated.  The Italian veggie frittata omelette tasted average. It was very greasy and lack of flavour. However, the MOAB burrito and apple cinnamon pancake were amazingly delicious.  The MOAB burrito has lots of flavours with many filling inside the soft tortilla. The apple cinnamon pancake was very fluffy and soft.   The server was unfriendly with a poor attitude and she took a long time to re-fills the coffee.  Overall, I think this place is over hyped. But we did enjoy the food except for their poor service level.

Xxmzdmqx3pA8GiojYV3ZSA.text: Whenever I visit a city that I haven't been to before, I insist on eating at a place that is True to the character of that city.  After my visit to Deluca's, I have no hesitation in claiming that this restaurant is Pittsburgh at its finest.  This efficient and popular greasy-spoon joint serves up hearty meals at a decent price.    They claim to offer the "best breakfast in town," and I wouldn't argue with that statement...nor would the millions of other people who waited 30+ minutes to even get into the restaurant on the cold, wet, and snowy Saturday morning I went.  I ordered the seasonal pumpkin pancake special, and I was pleasantly surprised that they gave me the option of ordering kielbasa as the side meat instead of just the usual ham or breakfast sausage.  I almost feel bad giving this place just 4 stars because I really liked it.  But alas, it just wasn't my favorite type of food, and as much as the long wait and cash-only policy is characteristic of this diner-style restaurant, it wasn't exactly pleasant.  Beware that if you come during a busy time with a large group (5+ people), expect to wait a bit longer than smaller groups.

hgyU0kGJwB_a9518mhDpHQ.text: My cousin took me here as one of the local places to go when in Pittsburgh. This is what I think dining is all about...localoclaocal! Glad they recommended it. My cousins are vegetarian and were able to find things on the menu that they liked. Rather than going for a sandwich, or breakfast, went for one of the their wraps. It was big, sloppy to eat, and very tasty. I had their Southwest Chicken melt..gooey cheese, chicken, avocado, and more. It hit the spot and provided plenty of energy for a whirlwind tour of Pittsburgh. Look forward to returning to share the place with my husband.

35j3qalKqILkZPuqLBEtNQ.text: This is my favorite place to get breakfast in pittsburgh! I'm big on breakfast and have been to quite a few places in pittsburgh known for their breakfast and delucas is definitely my favorite! The meals are unique but at the same time have a traditional feel. I have been here a few times and have yet to be disappointed. The only negative is it tends to get very busy and there's not a lot of places to sit.

GrpiZbPDsGcg9UayCwaFnA.text: This place is a very good choice for breakfast. The food was delicious and very filling. As far as I could tell the service was ok but it was memorial weekend during the middle of a large race with a very large group of people. In conclusion, this restaurant is a very good choice for a family breakfast.

u1xNwdhb5agpPYl6ILKXDA.text: Very no frills place and exactly what we were looking for!  What we sampled:  Steel City Breakfast (Eggs with american cheese (I don't even like eggs and these were stellar), Biscuits (yum), hash browns (under seasoned, but good), chocolate chip peanut butter pancakes (enough said ;) ).  The MOAB (Mother of all burritos is right!  This thing was packed full and delicious!)  Overall the service was good and the food was hearty and reasonably priced.  Just remember to bring cash and an empty stomach!

6Y-U6aBUtwVY4nMjPcc75w.text: I had breakfast here and enjoyed it. The large mural rocked. Don't get the burrito, it is weird tasting. I had the eggs Benedict served on fresh mancini's bread. It was great. I only wish that I had ordered 2 plates. The service was meh, but most places in town are that way. Give it a try.

A5meKuey7HQXPZ--sVUROw.text: If you are a fan of breakfast food, you will be a fan of Deluca's Restaurant. That is really all that needs to be said about this iconic Pittsburgh breakfast spot. If you are reading this however, I am sure you would probably like a little bit more information on what is actually happening here.  Located in the Strip District, and featured on Man v. Food, Deluca's Restaurant is the top choice for those looking for some grub to start their day off. During our visit, we arrived later in the morning and were greeted with a line that went out of the building and extended onto the cold sidewalk outside. However, the line moved very fast, and the employees did everything they could to get people in and out in the most productive way possible.  After being seated, and looking over the menu, I decided to get the Steel City breakfast, which is basically a little bit of everything on the menu. In fact, I felt a little glutenous when they brought out my three plates of food, but hey, I needed to get my foodie on. From the eggs, to the french toast, everything I ate was absolutely delicious. Greasy, and delicious. It was one of those meals that is just so delicious, that you don't even take the time to make conversation with your fellow diners because you are too busy stuffing your face.  I wish that Deluca's was here in Cincinnati. I would go to this wonderful restaurant every morning if I could. If you live in Pittsburgh, don't take this gift for granted. To do so, would be a great dishonor.

-8zjUKCHktksRSPASubmzA.text: A must stop when shopping in the Strip District. This looks like a traditional Pittsburgh diner but once you enter you will see how amazing the menu is and will get a diner experience unlike no other.  They have dessert pancakes which are awesome but only for those with a big sweet tooth. In the fall I ordered the pumpkin pancakes which were tasty. This past visit my date ordered the apple cinnamon pancakes complete with whipped cream with caramel drizzle, ice cream and hot baked applies. It was to die for!!  I ordered the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich.  For a True breakfast sandwich I had them hold the tomatoes, lettuce and mayo.  It was on fresh baked bread from the local bread company, Manconi, with cheddar cheese, scrambled egg and tasty bacon delicious!  The service is quick and they only take cash (PNC mac machine right outside).  There is always a line around the block on weekends so expect to wait although the line does usually move quickly.

9UpMeNRRQ_m_bJEupPr_YA.text: Another Pittsburgh legend . Always voted "best breakfast in the burgh  " and I have to agree . I like the unusual breakfast combinations . Who can't refuse ice cream on your pancakes in the middle of a hot July ???

JfiLsVHQLUUznRNNlv5fBA.text: We were going to be down in the strip so we thought we would try this place since I have heard so much about it. Just in case you forgot, the parking in the strip is terrible to say the least. We got there about 9:00 am. Sunday morning. The line was out the door and down the street. It took us about 30 minutes to get a seat. The portions were large and if you wanted huge portions, they had those options on the menu too. The sausage biscuit and gravy was lacking the sausage. There was only two small crumbles of sausage. The lobster bisque was lacking substance too. The taste was really good except that the few  pieces of seafood that were in it, were smaller than a grain of rice. I expected more. Our silverware was sad looking. I had to straighten my fork so all the prongs were even. It just seems like they are so busy that they quit caring about the quality. I don't know how this restaurant has been here so long and is still this busy.

qZm8imTqtc1kLw1VLYq0SA.text: Great portions, good flavor. So many choices on the menu, you could go 100 times and not eat the same thing twice. Cash only

AaEfZLyMj7E1Z0APxDlZ7A.text: DeLuca's does a relatively expensive breakfast, much like Pamela's and Square Cafe.  The food is good, but, like Pamela's, they don't take credit cards.  If the food was inexpensive, like Ritter's, I could understand this.  But when breakfast rings in at $15?  Pretty much inexcusable not to take plastic.

9nrYXu1tV4Kf4Ra1S32iIQ.text: Super greasy, dive inspired diner located in the strip district.  The choices are vast, but everything mostly tastes like low quality fat soaked all purpose man feed.  Yea, so there is some culture/history/tradition of greasy spoon diners of Pittsburgh, of which Deluca's may be the best, but in my opinion it is still not worth it.  Visit the spot, buy a t-shirt, take a picture, then go get some food somewhere else.  I went with some sort of sloppy breakfast option, with biscuits that came out rock hard and tasted like stale Bisquik.  The eggs were runny (not in the good way) and the cheese was plastic-esq American that had somehow managed to not melt, but instead quickly congeal into one stringy mass on top of my potatoes.   The coffee (while refilled many a time, my mug never saw the bottom) was watery and quite bitter.   So you may be thinking why the 2nd star, well the upsides of Delucas are the massive amount of food on the plate (quantity over quality should be the tagline), and the service was efficient and prompt, if not overly friendly. So this place is famous for something, I am not quite sure what, but it certainly isn't because they have good food.  If you manage to find out what makes Deluca's famous please let me know, until then I will not be returning.

ShCIUtiabEzSKuFHYSocEQ.text: Awesome Breakfast.  Try any of the flavored pancakes.  My wife has had a few of the different flavors and they all have been outstanding.  Also try the Breakfast sandwich on homemade bread with Uncle Charlies Hot Sausage, it is by far the best Breakfast Sandwich I have ever had.

RwzCibUJtl_4gzOOJVETcw.text: Great breakfast with the family. Busy but we got a seat for 8 in about 15 minutes. Wish they had some black t-shirts!

ilBNu9Ic0iOX8q7tVbqTDw.text: Love Deluca's Eggs Benedict! Crazy busy place, but if you're willing to sit at the counter in the back, you can get seated pretty quickly.  Cash only.

76x4Ql-FBkBhCsQ9VyOyug.text: Amazing. Best breakfast I have had in pgh. Awesome atmosphere and staff. Greek eggs Benedict is absolutely the best Benedict I have ever had. The only downfall is if you go after 10 on weekends you will have a 40 minute wait - well worth it.

hpGwPXKOsC9wf7d-pihj2w.text: This is the best greasy spoon you can find and it is awesome.  I had the veggie mix grill.  The prices are perfect the atmosphere is classic dinner / hole in the wall / grandmas kitchen and it is packed every inch full of hungry customers.  One of the best breakfast places in town.  Get there early and I mean early the line may be down the street but the wait is worth it.

8PSgQ2PEWuWGsgc3GYiu4g.text: Great spot!  If you're thinking big,greasy breakfast...this hits the nail on the head.  Get there early otherwise expect to line up outside.  Service was good, food was awesome.  Try the MOAB for something different, the egg, chili, hash brown, avocado, banana peppers, onions make a great combination of flavor.  2.5lbs of tasty goodness.  Next time in Pittsburgh will definitely be back!

dkbxOiOTpZNH4RsnIX11kQ.text: Wow... wow... one of the best breakfasts I've had in a while. There's a good amount of parking around, especially if you get there early.... and you'll want to get there early, because there's a FREAKING LINE OUT THE DOOR TO GET SEATED!! So worth it, though. Everything is yummy.

DjZEyTiNVMRb7n16dbT1dw.text: Service was slow and there was a long wait because it was a Sunday. The food was outstanding. There was a fantastic selection and I had Greek Eggs Benedict which were incredible.

xXuAwYbhka4pByGwVFCQxQ.text: So far the best breakfast place in Pittsburgh! Try their egg Benedict

hfu7pCla-_Gz9un2g3R2-w.text: I used to think Pamela's was the best breakfast in town, until I came to this place.  Amazing.

SSGAE7OKriUoJ79xMwAodg.text: I recently went to Pittsburgh for one week trip and this was my favorite breakfast spot in the city. My friend and I went here three times during my trip because I liked it so much. It's a True hometown diner with good food and great service.   Even though there was a heavy amount of drinking going on during my trip we always managed to get up ridiculously early to brave the crowds at Deluca's. It was well worth it and you definitely can not beat the prices (anything is cheaper outside of NYC though!).  Everything was tasty from the pancakes to the breakfast burritos. A truly good greasy spoon!

kqePwW_j7OTkTcj6qmUCnA.text: After walking past the long Saturday lines numerous times, I brought the kids here on a week day.  Great idea.  No wait, and no hurry.  The pancakes were excellent..light, fluffy, and perfect.  The omelet with Chorizo?  Horrid, but I blame myself.   What was I thinking?  Like ordering oysters in Iowa.    Good cup of diner coffee, and counter service was great.  Kids want to know when we're coming back...soon!

vP1v_4NEuQmmYa2bptS3tQ.text: Lucky find of the week.  We stumbled onto this gem just by fate.  We were hungry and did not know where to go, so we followed a couple of kids into this place and I am sure glad we did.  There was no line or wait we got in and out increadibly quick.  The server was very nice and the Breakfast Burrito had this delicious sause covering it.   My girl got an omlette with fetta cheese and spinach.  We watched the cook make it using fresh spinach and fetta.

yOH09lflQXKZapQAAewoEQ.text: Holy huge breakfast batman! We went on a Saturday early afternoon and there was no wait at all. I will admit that the waiter was a little absent minded, forgetting my friend's strawberry jam, but I've worked in food service before and after a long Saturday shift stuff like that happens. To make up for it our food came out quickly...I got the mixed grill with turkey sausage and my lady got the strawberry fields pancakes. Very rarely do we leave food on our plates but there was a little breakfast graveyard at the end of this meal. Everything was superb and we wanted to eat every last bite but it was impossible. 3 of us ate for less than $30 which rocks my socks! I agree Deluca's is a Pittsburgh institution and there is nothing better than breakfast at a diner and walking through a slew of street vendors. Be warned--Cash Only! Enjoy!

7_5sD6Z7zgvdpkWS9uLacA.text: Come here for a good hearty breakfast of absurd proportions, but be prepared to wait.  if food were my only concern, I would not hesitate to say DeLuca's is one of the best breakfast joints in the 'burgh.  Alas, they have terrible coffee, and for me, that's a deal-breaker.

10kKRR2NYExQcw3Zj09hBg.text: Sit at the counter on the left side. See all the great food on the warming table & the energy in the kitchen. Had the seafood crepe, tasty & good portion, also the BLT with Avocado, & Swiss on Mancini bread. Great experience!

m8zIKoYstJqfqNl46PlrbA.text: I was pretty underwhelmed by this place which was disappointing because I had seen the yelp reviews and all my friends had raved about this place.   My eggs weren't cooked well. Maybe it was just an off day for them and they were quite busy but my food was not made well that day.

n9nYs_CrO2NruXr_26wlOA.text: This place was your typical greasy local breakfast spot. We were told to go here by some friends we know in Pittsburgh and the minute we said we wanted breakfast, this is where they told us to go. I was not disappointed. The portions here are definitely shareable, but it's hard to give up half of your dish because everything is so delicious! I will definitely be back here anytime I am in the city!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Famous Breakfast Burrito
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Country Fried Chicken W/ Eggs
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Front entrance.

gbTCP0XjiW3VZAMEEOUChQ.text: This was my first time at DeLuca's,  I really wanted to like the food here, because of all the good reviews and famous people that have been here. Our breakfast was just ok it is something I could have made myself and the prices are high for what we received.  I'm a little disappointed.

Hiza4c0M4tjm_cU3jRhFbQ.text: So yummy! Don't be afraid of the line outside you will be seated quicker than you think. Make sure you have cash. Our waitress, Cat, was outstanding. They keep everything moving quick and they are super friendly! Hot spot in the heart of the strip district. The Georgians approve!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French Toast (1 piece)

5Zcammx7fgzqHt7ERNJUZw.text: Alright this joint is great!  Very welcoming, and homey! The food is great I would say homemade with love. Or at least well versed in making the food!   I ordered the country sausage biscuits and gravy with eggs and country potatoes.. I fell in love!!   Hubs order Steel City breakfast or champs but he ate it all and liked it as well.   This is the type of place where you will see or hear the regulars.. I like it and will be coming back!

C_l3snYtlZXp4jrde3QOGw.text: oh my lanta. this place is delicious! This was our first time here even though we're in the strip quite a bit. We knew it had to be good because there is always a huge line. Turns out he wait is worth it! I got the special which was a pepperoni and mozzarella omelet and the hubs got the MOAB. Everything was so good that even when I was full I had to keep eating bc i didn't want to leave any behind. Keep in mind that the line seems to go pretty quick and it is cash only (there's a PNC atm right down the street) We can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The MOAB

DR-5Kuro0ZhGa5rJcqHB4w.text: It was pretty good. The waitress was very attentive. Good atmosphere. Good chicken and  waffles

DCc1KbFQd5-_nfaI-TG03w.text: I've really wanted to like Deluca's but I just can't.  I've been here twice and it's been the same experience both times.  The wait to get into this place on the weekends is nuts.  I've gone during the week and while there isn't a line out the door, the staff inside always seems a bit disorganized.  Folks coming in are left standing between the register and the door while diners are trying to pay and get around you to leave.  That's logistical based on the layout of the place, so that's forgivable.  The food is my real issue here.  The portions are ridiculously huge and I feel like they opt for size rather than taste.  On this last visit, I ordered eggs, bacon, hashbrowns and toast.  The hashbrowns tasted as though they'd been sprinkled with onion powder and then over cooked, which made the onion powder taste burnt.  Other than that, the only thing on my order with any flavor was the jelly I put on the toast.  My hubs ordered the mixed grill (again, ridiculously large) and a coffee.  The grill comes with a pound of veggies, and the hubs said the flavor was good.  However, he sat with an empty coffee cup for quite a while.  The service was sparse and the servers all looked like they'd rather be someplace else.  Which is understandable because about halfway through the meal, I wished the same.  I'm not planning on giving Deluca's another shot.  2 times is enough for me.  There are several other great breakfast places in the Strip (Kellly's and Pamela's to name a couple) and I think I'll stick to those spots.

deTSW5mKKVQaaC5vtR3fHw.text: If you go to Deluca's around 1 pm on Saturday, there will hardly be a line! My girlfriend and I didn't have to wait any longer than 5 min. Those who know about Deluca's consider this time to be a miracle. The breakfast choices are a lot cheaper than any place I've been for brunch/breakfast in Pittsburgh. I ended up getting an omelette (avocado, sour cream) which came with hash browns. The omelette was very tasty and I probably will get it again when I go back. The hash browns were a nice addition as a side, not too soft. The waiter kept our waters full and the food came out quickly. Pro tip: restaurant is cash only to keep the prices low!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Avocado + sour cream omelette

9qjWrzH_b3cVE0PjBJvxmA.text: A line long enough to spot miles away, in downtown Pittsburgh. Everyone comes here and lines up for the amazing food that Deluca's serves.   We didn't want to wait for hours, so we called and got the food picked up. There was still a bit of wait, but nothing compared to standing in line. We got the food, and ate them in the car.   I would always lower my expectations about half a Yelp star for take outs, simply because it takes away the whole "display food on plate" and "serving it glamorously to the customers" thing. And also, food in a box doesn't always taste amazing. Surprisingly, everything we ordered was bomb. The portions were massive, and they were simply satisfying, perfect brunch material food. Only thing that went wrong was, they messed up our order.

kxReDdeJbE3NqSEEyF7Khw.text: We have only been coming here for 25 years. I had to shout out because it's been five or so since my last visit. Some things are just worth coming back to.  Benedict on Mancinis? Absolutely!!! Priced right and worth the wait.  Don't forget to bring CASH.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

s3wwUQEkj7xCNgy02tgB4g.text: Went on a Sunday afternoon around one. The wait time to get in was fine, around 30 mins. It was very busy inside with diner feel atmosphere. Coffee was good and kept coming while we waited and they have Franks hot sauce which is a huge plus for us. When the food came out everything seemed like big portions for the price which is good as well. Syrup went great with the pancakes and the chorizo in the omelette was amazing! Some things I wished could have been better was home fries could have been better or the server forgetting my toast for my omelette. Not deal breakers for any means just things left for wanting more. Overall I would say good experience for breakfast food in Pitts.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chorizo omelette with a side of Home fries

QwMnaNjqBa-AHAJEllmEMQ.text: Deluca's is definitely up there on list of favorite breakfast spots. The portions are huge but still tasty and service is friendly!   Most recently, my boyfriend and I stopped in while doing some shopping in the Strip. We got there a little after 1, so it seemed like the breakfast/brunch crowd was done - in the mornings, the line can go out the door & down the block quite a bit! The menu is large and they have a selection of savory and sweet options, as well as breakfast & lunch items. For sweet, I like to get a short stack of pancakes with a fun topping (apples & cream = amazing!). Otherwise, omelettes are always a solid choice for a savory option. Never had a bad meal here!   Other info: cash only, ample seating inside, very pittsburgh-y decor!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Short stack of pancakes w/ warm apples &amp; cream!

eE1Wsv66jUS-uuHoLUcEaA.text: What can I say..got here and it was very hot outside.  Thought it was gonna be a long wait but, as the sign said, our line moves fast.  Took 10 minutes to get inside.  Now we let's get to the food.  I had he Pancake Breakfast(includes homefries, eggs, sausage bacon)..daughter had the French Toast breakfast with the same sides..food was well worth the wait.  Service was excellent and I definitely will be going back here again when I go for a Steeler game.  If you are in Pittsburgh, make your way down to Deluca's and enjoy some good food at a very reasonable price).  Would be very wrong if I didn't include the fact that my son(who loves chicken tenders and fries) was very impressed with the quality of his meal as well.  It's the small things like that that makes a place like this excellent for families to eat at.

gLI0xSWZbD40_m-x5X6wBg.text: Wife and I where there yesterday for late lunch. Deluca's is right in the middle of the strip district. I had the Da Burgh which is a Philly Cheesesteak and I also had fries. The service was excellent and the waitress was very helpful and friendly. It has been many years since I have had a really good philly cheesesteak. This one was among the best I have ever had and the fries where good as well. I would definitely recommend Deluca's for all your diner needs. Can not wait too go here for breakfast.

pm-7uGo1-qQur8aENIgqbQ.text: I absolutely love it here. I am from out of town and this place was recommended by a friend of mine. You walk in an it's straight old school feel. It feels like you are dining at a relatives house. Staff is friendly, a lot of locals here and the vibes are great. Ordered eggs Benedict and it was the best I've ever had hands down. I will definitely be coming back as soon as I can. Cash only so don't forget to hit up the atm before you come.

lFt6XtyuuOcGgwosHKiBCw.text: Five stars in MY book. First of all it is very hard to find a diner where I can sit and eat in downtown Pittsburgh. So the FACT that I walked thirty minutes away from my hotel to come here and they did not disappoint is mind blowing. Now,  Let me take a moment to thank the other Yelpers that has viewed this place because of you guys I am fulfilled.  Now back to this spot. It was a great experience. I was recognized immediately once I walked in nd everything my waitress offered was delicious. I orderd the Steel City Breakfast of Champs breakfast and it was soooooo good. Not to mention I got my money worth. I feel great and satisfied. They were very attentive with my order and I appreciated the conversation. Hey told m the history of the place as well as knowing this is cash only place.I really enjoyed myself. I recommend his place to anyone looking for More than coffee and McDonald's or burger king or bagels.
