8V4HXgGidWQMjn5a2GNM3w.text: Awesome diner with great hours.  Our plan was to come here at 6:00am on Saturday after a night out and eat before we went to bed, but that failed.  So we came later in the afternoon after walking around the Strip District.  As I was already full from our previous meal before coming here, my boyfriend was still hungry and decided to go for the bionic omelet.  He's not a small guy, but this omelet completely put him in a food coma. It was so big and filling, he was only able to finish about a third of it before throwing in the white flag.  Services is what you would expect at a diner.  We got there around 2:00pm and closing time was at 3. So it was pretty quiet in there.  Bathrooms were downstairs.  There were 3 stalls in the ladies room, but tell me why the bathroom door was open???  Prices were great. Would love to be back with an appetite and try out other items on the menu.  Cash only and you pay at the register on your way out.

YxJan5cHHBxA2Peiw13Eug.text: Breakfast is great. If you arrived on weekday before 8:00 am there are not much people, and no wait time. I know a lot of people went on weekend, and the waiting time is worth it. Service is excellent with great portion and greta price. I will come back to try other menu.

twR3bfidRdonv4SagBQcqw.text: They only take cash :( We saw the reviews and the hype and decided to come. I'm glad we went but I wouldn't be dying to come back. I got the MOAB and it was one of the less enjoyable breakfast burritos I've had with a really sweet salsa on it We also got a nutella pancake which was delicious but just about anything with nutella is delicious. If you're looking for OK food and ok service  with something for everyone for a reasonable price this is your place. Bring cash.

pG0d4ix8QR1xtfH0mlmPQQ.text: As I get older I become much pickier than ever before... I don't like the way anyone does anything.... I won't even eat if it's displayed wrong....  So I'm not a fan... iv have experienced better...   Would you believe a gray bearded short fat guy with a big smile on his face?   came in the back door & notice a good portion of staff at the deluca's diner ...There's a bunch of diners who make you wonder what so good about this particular diner... the service was great...but the food was just mediocre ...i ordered an omelet...to be more specific a Philly cheese steak omelet and it was probably the worst omelet i ever had... the omelet was served with a side of homemade hash and and fresh Italian bread... the hash was dry an tasteless... the only thing i liked was the bread...which they purchases form another restaurant...so after that disappointing meal i decide to purchase a crepe....meh... i shouldn't have done that....

jX3npuR8WftILeQALEcFiA.text: I've driven past Deluca's Diner for over a year now, each time with the intention of eating there. Because I usually visit the Strip on the weekends, however, there would always be a (long) line outside of Deluca's. After asking a few potential patrons how long they have been waiting, to which their responses would be between 30 and 45 minutes, I just walked away.  Sorry, while I consider myself a patient guy, I can only last so long before I hulk out from hanger.  This is why I make a point of avoiding diners on weekend mornings, unless I have a snack before surrendering myself to the dreaded line.  Anyway, I finally had the chance to come here on a Wednesday morning with a friend for brunch. We found street parking without needing to circle around the area for half an hour and fume silently over endless pedestrians crossing the streets. As expected, there was a line, but it was nowhere near as long as that on weekend mornings. The people in front of us said that they've been waiting for 5-10 minutes. Not bad.  Within 10 minutes, the hostess seated me and my friend at a table near the back of the diner. The wall to which our table stood adjacent proudly displayed their achievements of being recognized by former Steelers players, and of being featured in movies and on "Man vs. Food." Miscellaneous posters pertaining to Pittsburgh and diner-esque themes covered the rest of the walls.  Our waiter promptly introduced himself, gave us our menus, and asked if we'd like anything to drink. My friend requested water; I requested water and coffee. Within a few minutes, we had some water and I had my steaming mug of coffee. I usually take my coffee black, and this coffee was pretty good. After perusing the menu and debating whether we should get omelettes, pancakes or waffles or French toast, or breakfast sandwiches for almost 10 minutes, we finally made our decision. By this time, a waiter would have checked up on us at least twice; our waiter hadn't come by. We waited a few more minutes and eventually he came and took our orders briskly.  Within 10 minutes, we got our food. I got the Italian Veggie Frittata, my friend got the "Da Burgh" Philly Cheesesteak omelette, and we got full stack of French toast with strawberries. Our omelettes were excellent. Both of ours came with homefries and biscuits. My omelette with stuffed with veggies and a good amount of cheese, while my friend's was stuffed with juicy, tender steak, onions, and peppers. The homefries were all right. I came across several pieces that were undercooked and several pieces that were charred. I thought the biscuits tasted great but my friend thought that it must have been made using Bisquick because of their texture and taste. I didn't care; I just slathered my strawberry jam on them and stuffed my face.  According to the menu, the French toast is made using bread from Mancini's bakery. The toast itself was good, but the "fresh" strawberries on top brought down the dish. Upon arriving at our table, the strawberries lacked their vibrant red color; instead, they looked wilted and gray-red. I tasted one and I immediately thought "defrosted frozen strawberries." It was so mushy and lacked any taste. I then proceeded to slide the strawberries off my piece of French toast before finishing it.  I guess I was loving the coffee because by the end of our meal, I had downed almost four cups of coffee! Whew, I knew I was going to be jittery today (with an overactive bladder).  Overall, our meal was good, but nothing really impressed me. I found the quality of the food to be that of a typical diner. Even the breadth of the menu wasn't too impressive. I've been to several diners with similarly extensive, if not more, menus. Nevertheless, I suppose DeLuca's gets a lot of attention and praise because it is a historical venue and a staple of Pittsburgh, just like Pamela's Diner.  Anyway, as for any diner, I would come here again if I woke up in the late morning with a hangover after a night of heavy drinking and couldn't will myself to cook my own breakfast/brunch. Just remember to be prepared for a long line and a long wait if you decide to go on a weekend morning. Bring a snack or a sports drink (and a sleeping bag for those who partied a bit too hard the previous night) to tide you over during your wait.

188g5p8VKsQG4aTQfIxssQ.text: Line at door moved quickly. Tea included two teabags and hot water refills. The Italian omelette was brimming with delicious veggies and meat. Home fries were perfectly crisp and salted. The cinnamon roll pancake topped this meal off for two. Booths were comfy. Service was great. Bathroom had no paper towels or toilet paper. Non working toilet in one of 2 stalls. Long wait for women.

OWpMKx4Rf2O_b1_pOYhhNQ.text: Came in just for a place to sit while feeding the baby her bottle and to have a milkshake.   Next time I'm in Pittsburgh I will definitely come back as I saw mountains of good-looking breakfast-type food and sandwiches coming off the griddle behind the counter.   And it must be good because I saw about 200 fresh eggs ready to go.

SMMoQdGxgjQ3wWLKLOtGWA.text: Portion sizes are huge here. Don't come here if you're on a diet. I love their benedicts. Their California benedict had lots of avocado, tomato, and spinach. I like that it comes with a large piece of buttered toast instead of English muffins. It also comes with a sizeable side of diced potatoes.  Also had their pumpkin pancakes and blueberry pecan pancakes. Pancakes are again very enormous. I'd say they were about 8" in lengths. This place is cash only but prices are decently cheap and there's an ATM around the corner.

62PlwfZb1NCvTNB7SilE9g.text: There's almost no way to give this less than 5 stars. The line is outrageous no matter how early you get here. There's a reason for that! That reason is because it's one of the best breakfast diners you'll ever have the privilege of sitting down at. The good far outweighs the bad, especially since you should already expect lines, and the fact that they only accept cash (which fits in perfectly with the old school diner ambience).  They. Have. The. Best. French. Toast. I. Have. Ever. Tasted.   Please don't think I'm exaggerating. I try not to do that when it comes to recommendations. I know that it sets people up for huge let downs. But the french toast here is on another level, in my opinion. Maybe I don't get out enough but I've never had such amazing french toast. You have to try it at least once. If you don't agree then I respect that. I'm also a breakfast food lover. I can eat it at all times of day. Please trust me!  Everything I had on my plate was good. I don't have any complaints because I knew exactly what to expect. Service was fast and courteous. It's been far too long since I've been back.

-K0MFySNbWV8RmlxOPHifw.text: After years of living in Pittsburgh I finally came here with a camp-anion before she left town as she had never eaten here either.  We showed up to the door and we waited, and waited.... and waited.  The line was out the door and up the sidewalk, mostly people out of town.  We finally get in and to be honest I was ready for a let down another over hyped place that relied on its name rather than its food.  Thankfully I was wrong!  Menu is quite large there are alot of breakfast staples and some new twists on classics so there is something for everyone.  People are packed in a bit tight but I guess it beats waiting in line longer.  I got a eggs bacon and pancakes and my companion got the California omelette and a milkshake.  Food came out pretty quick and was really good and the portions were generous.    Definitely lived up to the hype and was high quality diner food.  Only let down was it being cash only.  I know its Pittsburgh and some places that still dont accept credit cards but for a place that is pretty centrally located and has people flock to from out of town I think they need to get with the times and fork over that 2% to the credit card companies.

Xl_MpdTND9rHH9o4H-f_tA.text: Fun spot to people watch activities on the strip and people watch people inside the diner. Great greasy spoon right on the strip. The french toast made with Mancini's raisin bread was really good. DH had omelette with chorizo and reports that it was pretty spicy. Homefries, which we requested to be extra crispy, were perfect.

eLUMOzY3bQY6U1BXe2zL3Q.text: one word...DELICIOUS!!! A must try when in town. I had the fancy pancakes with eggs, potatoes, and bacon. Really good food. Go early because it gets busy really fast.

UPfCAQfbZxB9VDJ3MF1wBA.text: Amazing!   We were a party of two. Probably could've been seated sooner as no one seemed to want to sit at the counter in the back, (definitely check with host to see if available).  We loved it as we could watch the cooks in action!  I had the seafood omelette with hollandaise and avocado on top, ask for it without the roasted red pepper.  My waiter came up with the recipe, minus the pepper.  They added it for some reason, but I feel took away from the taste sensation.  Had the Italian toast and ordered a side of the lingonberry preserves to share.  It was incredible!!!  Highly recommend this fun experience!

CnqVP1fUDaBi27RRJ9QeDQ.text: Our server Norma was excellent. They also have an extensive menu which can be good if you have perfected it all. We ordered the chicken and waffles had a side of bacon and a side of avocado. The coffee and orange juice were delicious and we enjoyed the free coffee refills. The food was expected of diner food but not of one that is a famous location. The chicken and waffles were too pricey for the taste and size. We are glad we can say we went there but will not go back again.

TW9PFgL8E_d7GkEKUEhtlA.text: I stopped by DeLuca's yesterday with CM for brunch at around 11am.  Initially, I tried to call and make a reservation, but they told me that they only accept reservations for parties of at least 5.  However, they also told me that business was a bit slower than usual yesterday.  I believe CM and I waited about 20-30 min. to be seated.  Neither of us had been before, despite having lived in PGH for 3.5 and 1.5 years, respectively.  For my entree, I debated between the fancy french toast and a heavenly pancake sundae, but I ultimately decided on the latter, due to the recommendations of other Yelpers and its Man vs. Food fame.  Despite not being someone who's super into apple pie, I decided to get the apple cinnamon roll pancakes, again due to others' recommendations.  When it came out, it looked impressive, and when I dug in, I was quite pleased with it.  The warmth of the canned apples complimented the cool creaminess of the ice cream perfectly, with the zest of the cinnamon taking it to another level.  Despite being an apple pie naysayer, this dish was delicious!  Obviously, it was very sweet, so if you're not into sweet breakfast foods, you may want to order something else.  CM was less adventurous than me and went with the short stack of pancakes with bacon.  I tried a bite of the bacon, and it was very crispy and minimally greasy, and was bursting with the smoked savoriness of well-made bacon.  This was certainly basic diner breakfast fare, perfected.  What impresses me about DeLuca's is the breadth and interesting options of the menu.  Although they have all of the usual breakfast standbys, they also have a variety of creative options for the more adventurously-minded, such as the heavenly pancake sundaes and the fancy french toast.  They also have some interesting options on the savory side, too, such as the bionic omelette.  Speaking of which, I love the sci fi-themed names that they give the items (out-of-this-world omelettes, sonic sides, etc.).  My only caveat is that if you're trying to eat on the healthier side, there aren't many options in that vein here.  (I'd recommend the Square Cafe in Regent Square for a more health-conscious breakfast.)  Despite the slight annoyances of the wait and the cash only policy, I'd recommend DeLuca's over Pamela's for a quintessential Pittsburgh breakfast--though I do enjoy Pamela's crepes.  Needless to say, it's a strong contender for one of the best traditional breakfasts in PGH.  Do your visiting friends a favor and be sure to take them here for a hearty meal before browsing the Strip or visiting Heinz History Center!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Apple cinnamon bun pancake sundae

WAvee5e1FoMBfE5R2J9mMA.text: Outstanding breakfast. There will probably be a line, it's very worthwhile though. It's in the "strip district" near downtown. A wonderful area to walk around and explore.

cqV6wTtaSO49nrmH5P5KOw.text: I feel like my experiences here have been a miss but other customers have had hits. I'm not sure whether I just have bad luck or if my expectations for food and service are high, but I don't think I'm asking too much when all I'm looking for is quality food and attentive waiters.  The first time I came to Deluca's I ordered one of their extravagant sweet pancakes. I was so excited for it, but was incredibly disappointed when I was instead served a burnt pancake that was barely edible... I'm not sure why you would even think it's okay to serve burnt pancakes, but needless to say, I was not impressed with Deluca's since then.   Fast forward to 2013 when I decided to give the place another try since there's always so much hype about this place. This time around, I tried the california eggs benedict. Was it hands down the most delicious eggs benedict I've ever had? Definitely not, but it was decent enough. I also ordered a strawberry banana milkshake, which was a great disappointment. I thought it tasted watery and expensive for the quality of the drink--I'm never getting that again.  There's always been a small line on Saturday mornings and they're cash only, so by no means am I itching to come back anytime soon. Also, they're always so busy that the service is subpar. Waiters are only there to grab your orders and have no interest in showing any appreciation for their customers. The wait for our check took forever as well because our server was inattentive.   Deluca's will do the trick if you need a breakfast place to go to but I've placed it dead last on my list. I've had much better experiences and great food in other places like Pamela's and the Original Pancake House.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. california eggs benedict

Oniw29lU3vJttjZcirVl7w.text: The breakfast we had was pretty yummy. I had no complaints. The menu was large considering they are not open most of the day. Parking can be a pain. However, if you are in the Strip District, you will like this place. It has a great deal of history. Many people in the area have frequented that diner. Even famous celebrities have eaten at the joint while filming. You will find this to be a trip down memory lane. The place is sort of frozen in time. Somehow the ancient feel works for the space.

xFJuRfuVJj9SdKMNXNAKrg.text: A Must-Visit restaurant if you ever visit the Pitt. This place gets super crowded, but it is well worth the wait. I had the pancake breakfast. Pancakes 1-5=4. Bacon 1-5=5. Eggs 1-5=3. Toast 1-5=3. Syrup 1-5=4.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

rnf8A8IvDgtuqjLhzK9Qyg.text: Yelp reviews sent me in this direction when we were looking for some diner food in the Burgh.  DeLuca's definitely has the diner feel.  It's a lot larger than it looks from the outside.  We got there around 10:30 a.m. on Sunday and were seated within about 15 minutes.  Not bad.  The menu was overwhelming.  So many omelettes! So many options!  I had no idea what to pick.  My friend saw Man v. Food and went for the mixed grill and I designed my own omelette.  The mixed grill was MASSIVE...pounds and pounds of veggies.  My omelette was pretty giant as well.  We ate and ate and barely made dents in our plates.  The food was decent for diner food.  I can't say it was the best I'd ever had but it's definitely a cool place to people watch and you can feel the history there.  The service was fast.  All in all a nice stop to try in the Burgh if you're super hungry.

MExs2lX41gi9dmCsbl2J6g.text: i could probably count on one hand the number of times that i've waited in line to eat at a place with fluorescent lights.  this is one of them.  we waited in line outside next to the "best breakfast in pittsburgh" sign for about 30 minutes before being seated.  the wait was partly due to today being labor day, and partially due to our showing up at 11:30am.  was the wait worth it?  every minute of it.  +1 for a menu FULL of wonderful breakfast items.  most items are non-traditional.  deluca's has many non-standard items that are locally well-known.  +1 for friendly service amidst the demands of 100+ hungry people.  +1 for a great location.  strip district.  +1 for relatively quick service.  +1 for the best (and largest) omelet i've ever had, named the "bionic omelet".  +1 for the best overall breakfast i've ever had.  -1 for cash only.  highly recommended.  favorite of both locals and tourists.  i will likely return.  come early to avoid any lines.

YuLRzYOouQIdwsVSblpixA.text: I am in love with this place.   If you just want to get to the review about the food, skip this paragraph. If you enjoy the long, drawn out nostalgic reviews, read on:  Let me preface this by saying I have very mixed feelings on living in Pittsburgh. I find it hot or cold, and that goes for everything. The people, the night life, the restaurants, it's all a love/hate relationship for me. I rarely encounter anything where I'm just like, "eh." There are things that make me love it here, there are things that make me hate it. I find people as nice as I found them back home in WV or absolutely the rudest EVER. The weather...ugh...don't get me started. So why am I telling you this? Because when I debate packing my things, selling my house, and moving away, I have a list of things I love (which are usually very simple things because that's the kind of person I am) that keep me here. They are things I know I'll never find anywhere else and things that make me love it here; the things I imagine give Pittsburgh it's awesome city rep, and this place is at the very top of that list.   This wasn't my first visit. The boyfriend and I walked in around 8am. We had just been to Home Depot and had a long day of yard work ahead. The last thing I wanted was to cook breakfast. We hopped onto 2 seats at the bar, as usual, and I ordered my usual, the Banana Split Crepe with a side of well done sweet sausage, and a coffee, and a water with lemon. It was astounding, and it always is. I take 2 bites of the sausage and take it home, every time. It's sweet and as lean as sausage could be and cooked to perfection. The coffee is perfectly brewed. The crepe is golden and delicious. The fruit is perfectly warm, the cheese too, and the toppings abundant. It's my favorite breakfast. I want to go on about the atmosphere though, because if the food were stellar and everything else sucked, I probably wouldn't return. The flip side is, the food could be mediocre (it isn't) and the rest would probably still bring me back.   We were greeted by a friendly tattooed waitress. We are tattooey too, and are always happy to patronize places that allow employees to look the way they choose (side note, that's why we Home Depot over Lowes, but that's another review).  Most of the staff here is sporting some ink, and black and white work side by side laughing and looking like they enjoy their job. I know Pittsburgh is known for it's diversity, so it may surprise you I mention that, but sometimes I find it to be quite the opposite. Not here. Not ever. Everyone smiles, everyone is friends, everyone is nice.  I was sitting next to a Jewish man, a table of young Asian students behind me, business men to my right, and old ladies dressed to the 9's across the way. Next to my boyfriend sat the waitress' well behaved young daughter, eating cut up banana and a milkshake. Cartoons were on, and I was cool with that. This is a place for everyone. I dig that the most.   As I'm drinking my coffee, waiting on my crepe, the restaurant is noisy. The radio is on. Prince comes on, and employee wiping down tables walks over and cranks it up. He's wiping and dancing, a few waitresses are dancing, too. We are laughing and dancing in our seats. The cooks on the line are nodding their heads.   Breakfast is delicious, the place has a pulse, and life is good. There isn't a face in the place without a smile on it. The boyfriend looks over and says "this is the best f*cking omlette I have ever had." Our waitress laughs and tops off the coffee.   This is the Pittsburgh I was told about, and this is the Pittsburgh I love.

VHxw9s8bPOsssu99gzh9KA.text: The business blew me away, wow !  The food was decent, could be better.   Maybe it was just too busy of a morning, the line was out the door, fun place to have visited.  The pancakes were awesome, but couldn't eat more than one.

zkfpQ5ZE1ISRLXSKlzm94w.text: When a place has a line out the door on a cold January Sunday morning, it's a good sign about the food. We did end up waiting a while to be seated, but it was worth it to enjoy an old-school breakfast in this Pittsburg institution.  I got a veggie omelet which I thoroughly enjoyed; others in my party ordered diverse items from their extensive breakfast menu. From eggs to pancakes to the biggest ham slice any of us had ever seen, everything was well prepared and the service was great as well.  The atmosphere here is unique; the place is a bit (or a lot) of a time warp, which was fantastic in and of itself. This place knows what works, and has apparently just stuck with that, for decades.  Do check this place out- it's worth the wait!

FXlQwQT3h5-5F8tUV-XW0A.text: This place is amazing.  I need to get my pictures of my food on here.  I love it and I will wait however long to sit here and enjoy their delicious breakfast (which is the only thing I have ever had).  Love it.

1JWXTM6z-s1ojY5N9S5Mxg.text: My experience eating at this place resembles Manny T's. I only give it a 2nd star because it was open on a day when everything else was closed. The fact that some Yelpers give this restaurant 5 stars, and it has an overall rating of 4 stars, really diminishes Yelp's credibility in my mind. 'Disgusting' is a big word, but this place comes close.

FnE4IrJ3U9qiaoOtKyZqow.text: Have been Pittsburgh for almost 4 years now and have passed here many times, impressed with the line on the weekend. Finally went and I'm clueless as to why the line is so long, aside from the many options on the menu. I got an omelette and my dining partner got some eggs with bacon and potatoes. Both dishes were ok, but they're nothing that I can't make at home with groceries from the Strip. Service was efficient and payment is cash only (PNC location within like 100 ft of the restaurant).

mI6vkJVAXcp_gIq1rp_eUQ.text: My family ended up in this area and since I had seen a rave review for Deluca's on Man vs Food, we decided to hit it up. Let me preface this by stating that I'm a breakfast man. It is my favorite meal of the day so I get excited when I find a place that does it right.... unfortunately, I wasn't that impressed.   But, to be fair, I wasn't terribly disappointed either. I ordered chocolate chip and strawberry pancakes with whipped cream on them, scrambled eggs, and sweet sausage. My wife got that massive veggie and egg plate that they showed on MvF (I can't recall what it was). Both were acceptable, but underwhelming. My wife makes better pancakes and eggs, and the plate she ordered tasted under-seasoned.   It wasn't terribly expensive so I didn't feel that it was a total waste, but surely didn't think it was worthy of its claim of "Best Breakfast in Pittsburg". I also felt that the inconvenience of cash-only would make it not worth a return visit.  Also, the dining room is definitely not built for comfort. The tables were packed in so tight that we literally had to climb through another booth to get to our table and the benches were incredibly uncomfortable.

NVp6DDHHHzZuSFEM933EnA.text: My fiance and I loved the food and the service. It it definitely a great place to go if your an out of towner and what to get a feel for the Pittsburgh culture. They give you more than your money's worth. The pancakes are delicious.

L10mWH8R7sw18IMxO8MIBw.text: Went there for lunch, had a steak and cheese sub, it was unqiue because they used thick slices of steak in the sub. But the experience was kinda so so. I'll have to try the breakfest, since I love breakfest and their supposed to be good at that. We'll see !

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mGNZdai5GJgBd8ry-726qQ.text: Truthfully I don't understand what the whole hubbub is about this place. It's yummy for sure...some of the better eggs benedict and coffee I've had around these parts but an hour wait? Really? I went to Deluca's a few times (truthfully out of the urgings of a nytimes article) and was pretty disappointed each visit. It's just ok food, ok atmosphere, and bad service.   Come to jersey I'll show you a good breakfast.

AnpnNVsr-8T8CodPNxazLA.text: Visited this Labor Day for breakfast. We actually intended to go to Pamela's, but they were closed today. There was a line at Deluca's, as usual, but it moved pretty quickly and we were seated in about 15 minutes.   Service was brusque, no nonsense...not friendly but not outright unfriendly either I suppose. I had my usual breakfast burrito, good as always, and quite filling. I tried some of the hub's waffle with ice cream and whatnot on top...delish.  I noticed today that their booths along the side are rather uncomfortable...the seat feels too shallow so you feel like you are just about the fall off it the whole time and your butt starts to hurt. Really not that big a deal though.  All in all, still some good food.

Hmy0Bt6ynpajfnxXtuDHwA.text: I've been to Delucas a couple times before and it's always been good. I tried going this morning and was seated by an unwelcoming host/server. A guy came over and asked what we would like for drink. When he brought the drinks, he just sat them down and walked away.. No straws! (I can't stand that.) After waiting 10 minutes for him to come back, we just left. Not sure what the hype about this place is.

yC30QEz1b3yUGksBs8TVpw.text: The lobster bisque was amazing.  The Super Bowl omelet was different but a definite touchdown.  I would have never thought mashed potatoes would work so well in an omelet. i Would have given 5 stars if they used a list like Pamela's instead of standing in line.

QVWfEOXNuAy3kSSlLMRz_w.text: I'm not saying Delucas is McCormick & Schmick's.  I'm just saying if you want a great diner breakfast without the frills you will not do any better than Delucas.  Somehow, every time we head back to the 'burgh to visit, we end up having breakfast here.  There's a reason for that long line down the sidewalk on Saturday mornings.  (Don't worry the line moves fast and it is worth waiting for.)  What am I doing here?  Wait.  Can I change my review and say the place stinks?  That way I can keep it all to myself  (-:     (Too late.)

7o0eFJsORqaSGCH-r4eAzQ.text: Ohhhhhh Deluca's.  In my experience, there is a great divide in the city of Pittsburgh, similar to Montagues vs. Capulets.  This divide is Pamela's-lovers vs. Deluca's-lovers.  I am firmly in the latter camp, and I will be pleased to challenge Pamela's patrons to a duel, as long as I have been fueled by a breakfast burrito the size of my head and innumerable rounds of coffee.  Deluca's has quirks: It takes forever to get a table (because everyone's trying to eat there), the ambiance is old-school funky diner (weird mural, propensity for stickiness on the formica tabletop), and you should not expect to be pampered by the waitstaff (they do their job well, for the most part, but the restaurant is always busy, it's not a high-end place, and they aren't going to make enough in tip money off your $10 breakfast to put up with a snotty attitude from their customers).  Personally, I like this in a diner, and it is something I actively seek out.  I like to come here kind of hungover, devour a massive burrito and a huge orange juice and about three cups of coffee when the waitress has time to refill my cup.  My favorite diner is still that diner under the 16th street bridge, which I forget the name of it but it makes kick-ass biscuits and gravy.

7NV6arPZ9lUuhqP_zyhtOA.text: This place is quite overrated.  The food was rather bland, and I was wanting ketchup and hotsauce.  The coffee was pretty bad too.  If you are wanting a lot of food along the lines of an average diner or Denny's, then you might like this place.  Service was good.  For me, it was definitely not work the effort of traveling into the Strip.

dZl7pdGWnFFIOrx4GaSYig.text: Meh - Nothing special just a greasy spoon diner serving up decent but very average breakfast. Hollandaise sauce out of a mix, average potatoes, average pancakes, really nothing to the place except it is a Pittsburgh icon, much like Primanti brothers, it's legendary for what it once was not for what it is now.  I'm glad we didn't wait for breakfast and if I was going show off a breakfast spot in Pittsburgh I think Pamela's would be my first choice.

z1LOMLc-VZPtEO-k2QtZgg.text: The chicken and waffle is awesome ! Delicious breaded fried chicken breast on top of a fluffy waffle.  The fried chicken is salty and savory along with the sweet waffle powdered sugar sprinkled on top.  Pour on some sweet syrup and a little hot sauce supplied on the table already.  It was great really hit the spot.  It also came with 2 eggs whatever style you want - I got sunny side up and dipped my chicken and waffle in the egg yolk :-) FYI the place is cash only

V-pCKxCD6EuFSl7hYmoOqQ.text: I had high hopes for this popular breakfast spot.  While the long line did move fast, you feel pressured to get in and out and therefore are not able to relax and chat with your party after finishing your meal.  Portions are way too big.  Food is not bad, but not good.  I would not go here again by choice.

_hCPxkgn14MB5af8c4P5BQ.text: Deluca's is a great diner in the strip district! I love their eggs benedict and pancakes both are amazing! It is really fun to sit at the counter and watch them cook while you eat!! You won't be disappointed but make sure you get there early on Saturdays!

JKKm2PS4nKvJH6o8L528Zw.text: I finally visited this place.  I, however, did not order the famous breakfast pancakes with ice cream and whipped topping.  Instead, I got a fish sandwich and fries.  My friends ordered breakfast and they said it was delicious.  The fish sandwich was good.  It was what I expected.  The water tasted terrible.  The restaurant was extremely busy.  It took us at least a half hour or more to get in the door.  Every employee was running around like crazy and the kitchen floor was covered in food.  It was so busy that there was no time for them to clean.    The seating is cramped and there really is no ambiance.  I recommend ordering the pancakes featured on Man vs. Food to experience what the place is famous for.    The low score is due to the wait-time, cramped feeling when entering and sitting down at a table, and the overall craziness all around you while eating.  I don't really have the urge to return unless there is no line to get in.

g-5Urdj2K3kj7qVtfL-uwQ.text: I was expecting more from this restaurant. I was enjoying my husbands efforts in putting this date together. The food was slightly disappointing.  I had biscuits and sausage gravy. I received biscuits and floury tasting gravy. The sausage was M.I.A. My husband had the lobster bisque soup. The same lobster M.I.A. The staff was kind to us but very busy. I had that experience but will I go back NO! I will however visit the strip over and over it is a blast of fun. Take plenty of money with you because you will spend it.

0-XK0DVCRX7vElBuwvvkgw.text: Stumbled on the gem while at a convention in Pittsburgh. My group wound up eating there every day of the trip. The breakfast is the best I've ever had. You have to try the Mancinis raisin bread!

HAfBSdq7iLydwALB2T5aGQ.text: After reading the reviews about the line and wait, we got here at about 8:00 on a Saturday morning and were seated right away. The menu is extensive and I was having a hard time choosing what to get. After some thought, I went with the strawberry pancakes and scrambled eggs. Breakfast sausage came with it but that went to my husband. He ordered a breakfast sandwich, after seeing the amazing bread it came on. One thing I liked was that they were really accommodating with making things just the way you want. My husband wanted scrambled eggs on his breakfast sandwich and that wasn't a problem! Service was quick and our food arrived shortly.  My pancakes were delicious, however I was disappointed with the strawberries-they were FROZEN! Well, thawed out but a mushy, pre-frozen strawberry mess! I understand this is a diner, but I guess in June I was just expecting some fresh strawberries. The eggs were good, nothing spectacular. My husband enjoyed his breakfast sandwich but said the sausage that came with mine was tough and he didn't eat much of it. We were in and out in less than 30 minutes.  Overall, it was a decent breakfast, but I would definitely order something different if I were to return. The service was fast and friendly, but I would have been disappointed if we had waited awhile for that breakfast.

r7KvIo6Lsa7HMxxAS9rRRw.text: French Toast is amazing. Definitely worth the wait in line. However, I've had the same waiter the last two times who was less than inviting. He spoke so loud and uninterested it felt like he was yelling at us. Despite the relatively poor service (he didn't even come back to check on us) it's still the best breakfast ever! I keep going back for more.

v5sc0lylRsXzTgF8Mo-7jw.text: I went with the egg, cheese, and ham sandwhich with the lobster bisque soup. Since it was early afternoon I wanted more of the brunch feel. The sandwhich bread was well buttered but small compared to the large portion of egg, ham and cheese. The ham slab was overwelming so I removed at least half. Next time I will stick with just the egg and cheese sandwhich.  Cash only policy was a totally let down but the prices were good since its a dinner.

8VwtbgvH01rhMF1H2pAnUA.text: Under omelets, it said "frittata". So... is it a frittata or an omelet?  It's an omelet with lots of vegetables in it. So good with breakfast potatoes.   There is a line to get in but it moves fast. It helps if you buy snacky stuff out on the street beforehand. We sat way back at the counter and it was perfect. Nice and quiet.  I f'n loved Pittsburgh.

yAKGjx29UB2ARpgETq9yVQ.text: Went here for a late lunch or even later breakfast with a friend. I had the Banana Peppers omelet with the hot sausage. I felt like something with a bit of a kick. There were tons of banana peppers but the amount of meat paled in comparison so I wasn't super happy about that. But it was good, just not good enough.   While we were seated very quickly, the food took a while to come out or I imagined it to be longer than it was b/c I was ravenously hungry...who knows. But maybe that's normal for this place.   I would like to check this place out again and try one of the pancake specialties. I saw folks around us getting what looked to be a pancake sundae - mmmm...sugar rush!   They had a ton of options which made it hard to choose what I wanted. Also the menu is quite busy (with graphics and colors and nonsense) which made it even more difficult to focus. When presented with so many options, I just feel scattered and couple that with visual distractions and I feel ADD.   While I may not opt for the omelet next time around I will be stopping by this place again to give it another try.

fmdKIu62U62PdKfU5vmS3Q.text: This place is Pittsburgh!  The breakfast here is legendary.  I came in on Monday for my second visit.  Had the breakfast burrito with turkey sausage and coffee.  The burrito was fantastic.  Filled with all kinds of goodness and topped with their wonderful salsaish sauce.  The place is very quaint and mom and pop dinerish.  I've seen the lines on weekends and they are crazy.  The waitress was very nice and had awesome ink.  Love this place!

FFCQCFsW6XG81vn_wiwGUw.text: I was seated at the counter immediately. Coffee arrived quickly and my order was taken as soon as I put the menu down . Omelet was large and tasty. Home fries were plentiful. Sever kept my coffee cup full.  Did notice a person at the counter for five minutes that never received attention. He got up and left as I would have.

KCPdF-iwSE2KNTjDpADpcQ.text: Deluca's is the ideal delicious, greasy spoon breakfast establishment.  It is not quite a diner, but it has that kind of vibe to it.  It's busy and a bit worn, but the menu encompasses a wide variety of breakfast and lunch items that has quite a following in Pittsburgh.  The weekend I went, the line crept out the door just after 10:00 am and was extremely long once my coworker and I got settled into our seats at the counter.  Who even has a legitimate counter space anymore to serve people?  The kitchen separates the two sections of counter seating and this is the heart of Deluca's.  If you can grab a seat there, do it.  From what I have read, this place has been featured on both the Food and Travel Networks and the whole time in which I was eating there, I felt like there should be a show devoted to this place's operation.  It was totally intruiging.  Up above the fryer and griddles was a huge plate of bacon to plate and send out with orders.  Egg shells were discarded wherever was away from a cooking surface and pancakes were shot out with a little dispenser to get them to a big, even size for the griddle.  It was magical.  How this place keeps orders straight, I have no idea.  Papers with orders are all over, but my meal came out correctly and so did my coworker's.  If it ain't broke, don't fix it, right?  Service was extremely amiable even though they were swamped.  From the host to the counter girl, everyone was attentive and kind.  My coffee was literally bottomless--at no point was I sitting waiting for a fill up.  The coffee is not fantastic (a bit bitter) but it hits the spot and considering how many cups you can get in a sitting, it's the only flaw that I found of the place.   I orderd a short stack (two) of specialty pancakes: pumpkin.  The flavor was ever present without being overwhelming.  I also ordered scrambled eggs and they were pretty good as well.  They were not perfect, a bit moist, and I prefer eggs to be cooked a bit drier.  My coworker had kielbasa and really enjoyed it.  The meat looked so juicy and I regretted not getting some as well since I love that Polish sausage ohsomuch,  Overall, service is prompt and food is delicious.  I'm still thinking about it and would be willing to also wait on that really long line should I ever need to again to get some of that delicious breakfast again.  Oh, and if you're into cramming as much food as possible into you for a low price for breakfast, get one of the breakfast burritos.  They are bigger than your arm and filled with all sorts of good things.  The guy next to me had one and it was unreal.

kOhg7S5uO6Ys6bfNhkLd5Q.text: De Luca's was featured on Man V Food - Pittsburgh. I had been going to this place since my junior year at CMU and I find it to be the best breakfast place I have ever eaten at. Whenever I go back to Pittsburgh to visit friends or for Steelers games, I always try and hit up Pramanti Brothers, William Penn for the the Kitchen Sink Wings and De Luca's for their breakfast.  Well. There is always a line to this place. I've seen it go around the block sometimes but there are also times when you can be the first in line. It all depends on what the crowd is like. This place specializes in breakfast but you can also get lunch food as well. You have to pay cash and you will most likely not find street parking anywhere near there so look for a lot or try the streets around it. The place is ALWAYS crowded so if you see some seats open at the bar, grab them cuz those are first come first serve.  Onto breakfast, I've tried a lot of their options but I love their Steak Mixed Grill. This gets me a sliced medium rare steak, 2 eggs over easy, veggies, sweet roast peppers, tomatoes and home fries. This meal was one of the dishes that Adam Richmond ate when he went there for Man V Food. I'll usually get this with a strawberry milkshake (which is enormeous) and that will completely fill me up.  I've also had the eggs benedict which is really good, the famous breakfast burrito (best breakfast burrito I've ever eaten), the buttermilk pancakes (better than Pamela's short cakes) and a Greek Omelette.  However, I now that I only go back to Pittsburgh once or twice a year, I usually just get the steak mixed grill. De Luca's is so much better than Pamela's and Pamela's is a really good breakfast place too. I definitely love coming here.

MCeLzOuTxBhP35TdpFVOKA.text: DeLuca's is a classic diner experience.  The portions are massive and the food is decent.  The scrambled eggs and pancakes stood out as best in class.  I ordered the MOAB which I was told is 2.5 lbs of food.  It was good but the chorizo was slightly burned which effected the overall flavor.   Service was attentive and really outstanding.   Set expectation to "big" and enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The MOAB....2.5 lbs of food!

irC7VHHPsIv1sLWczUsp-A.text: Oh man...I miss this place. I haven't been here since high school. We used to stop here all the time on highschool field trips to places like the history museum, etc. The pancakes are SO GOOD. Peanut butter cup pancakes! Need I say more? Ahhhhhh!! I usually end up getting strawberry ones though because I think I'd die of diabetes if I ate peanut butter ones. xD

rlXKhPb_KKOD5BrEOL1YVA.text: I totally have a mini-crush on Adam Richman (you know, the Man v Food host). Nothing gets a girl smitten more than eating your way through the US. Oh c'mon. Don't act surprised. You'll have been with me through many a buffet or sugar-induced coma. So anyway, when Adam chowed down at Deluca's - I knew I had to prove my worthiness...   And conquer I did... Survive the line at the door? No sweat. 20 min is nothing to me. I live in Asia now, people. It's the land of queues. Hell, people wait in line simply because there is one, even if they have no idea what it's for.   Order the massive breakfast burrito? Of course.  Was it bigger than my face? Check.  Was it delicious? Double check.  (Although, if I had one criticism, it would be put less potatoes inside and more egg. And that slice o' American cheese on top added nothing...)  Ice cream for breakfast? Yessssss!  Cinnamon bun hotcakes offered a delicious sugar rush, with fluffy pancakes topped with ice cream, whipped cream and delicious gooey apples and pecans. I only wish there were more apples. And pecans... And pancakes. 2 was not enough.   Okay, the breakfast was tasty but not as amazing as Adam made it seem. But maybe Adam makes everything look tastier...  (oh, you know you love him too!!!)

p1GRd0xT9LNEeVe8kANb6g.text: Had breakfast here during a weekend trip for a game. Finally got to try the Strawberry Fields heavenly hotcakes! ( I had vanilla ice cream instead of strawberry) Ok, perfect name! Because i was definitely in breakfast Heaven!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

kdx8-2KeAZ43RRFARe0-iA.text: They aren't kiddin when they say this is the best breakfast in Pittsburgh. This was my second trip and it just may become a tradition on every visit. This time I got the dessert pancakes that consisted of strawberry ice cream, chocolate chip pancakes, chocolate fudge and caramel sauce. It was amazing but almost too sweet (if that's even a real thing). It was tough to take down before the ice cream melted but I had fun trying! I highly recommend this place. Be prepared to wait a while to get in though. The lines are long but for good reasons.

yJdLN1mvIP1R2wjcNRHbJw.text: About a 4.5 or so... I went to DeLuca's because I saw it on MvF and I was in the area for a baseball game. I wound up getting the 2 pound breakfast burrito with bacon - I must say, I highly recommend it. The bacon at DeLuca's is VERY good, and every bit of the burrito was great. $10 may seem pretty pricey, but you get two pounds of it, and it will certainly fill you up for awhile.

1xPDB0LYirxy0feBcYZZYg.text: Great local diner. Not much more to say but if you are hungry and looking for a hearty breakfast this is the place. Great prices large servings friendly staff.

0B9NUy8Sl9GmLcI6LUH2pg.text: We got lucky going here! No line. I asked the waitress, I wish I remembered her name, for her favorite meal on the menu. She suggested the fried chicken with sausage gravy. She did not disappoint one bit. Sometimes you eat a meal and say it was good and think it would be better if... not this time taste buds. Everything was spot on! I was so delighted to have zero complaints on such a fantastic meal. I even left my wallet on the table, totally forgot about it. When we were leaving she gave it to us. This was after I gave her a hug and thanked her for one of the best breakfast experiences I've ever had.

aY92vgMelXeEn8ih-Cdg1w.text: So for the past 15 years or so I've eaten the same exact breakfast almost every day.  It's simple and old school  2 eggs over medium Side of bacon Dry eye toast   I travel all the time.  Over the years I've found favorite places to go to each time I'm in the area.  From Newark NJ and VA beach to Kansas City, Denver and everywhere in between.   NOBODY COOKS A BETTER BREAKFAST THAN DELUCAS.  Nobody.

BpbQQLR6WvLhqxwNorAMCA.text: Good enough that I've been back 3 times in 4 days within the week I've been here in Pittsburgh. Tried something new each time and never left disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana Pralines and cream + Chicken and waffle.  Both were delicious!

GfqjecGYGqXcgsXjySln_Q.text: Make reservations to avoid the line. But even with a line, they turn tables quick. My 20 minute wait was worth it.   Ambience: First this is your classic greasy spoon diner and dive kind of place. It is not fancy. It is classic.   Service: nice, courteous, and efficient. I watched them systematically clean up, re-seat, and keep it moving. Their hustle and bustle is an art in itself.  But for them to be as attentive, letting us know the status of the table, just kept sort of checking up with us as we stood there, it was pretty impressive... Then our Waitress was smiling thru my kids changing their minds and all their city slicker requests for this and that on the side. Appreciated her patience... She checked up during meal at the right times. And she had a quick chat with us before she handed the check over. She was just real nice.... Some of the best restaurants in the world could learn from this pretty humble easygoing waitstaff.   Food: it was everything you expected, wanted and more. Everything was pretty much perfect for a diner. Waffles were fluffy and perfectly cooked. Home fries were delicious. And their version of eggs Benedict was amazing.   Verdict: 5 stars for it's perfectly classic meal and for its reasonable prices.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vanilla milkshake. Yummy.
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs Benedict sans Swiss cheese on Texas toast. Amazing. And the home fries were awesome.
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Plain Belgian waffle with strawberries on the side. So yummy.

E671J3LXt13yvYa7qNeYug.text: My favorite breakfast place in the Strip! The wait is long, the dinning room may not always look spotless, but the food has always been worth every penny.  The pecan pancakes come with a hearty amount of pecans, and the bacon medium thickness and full of juices!   Tip, they take cash only, and the restrooms are not handicap assessable (down a flight of narrow stairs - olde building).

z1su4Lk7E1u6_khwHPE5AA.text: I understand that sometimes when a restaurant becomes an establishment, it's more about the experience than the food. But I still don't see why Deluca's is so popular. I got a breakfast burrito that was filling but pretty underwhelming and a sauce that was too sweet for my tastes. The rest of my party had things like corned beef hash and pancakes that didn't stand out from any number of other diners I've been to. If I had their meals I might go with three stars, but even then I would expect more for the popularity.

-ykuKs6C12qRmn2TZfukSg.text: Classic, no frills diner with fantastic food. The pancakes, mixed grill and omelets are my favorite things to order. It's fun to watch them cook at the grill too. The bacon is perfectly crisp and thick. Yes the lines can be long if you go on a weekend but it's well worth the wait. Even better is going during the week. Cash only, so be prepared :)

P3DPhrmDN8phK5Wq4f06bA.text: Friendly Service and amazing food.  Great for breakfast with friends or family. Be prepared to wait if you go on a weekend.  We done on Friday at 10:30am and waited approximately 10 minutes, much quicker than the weekend.  CASH ONLY, so you know it's legit!

rV2w8kZSIOsiUAhx3j2gIg.text: Only 2/5 because you can't just order a side of eggs and bacon. My waitress said you have to get the whole meal for ~$8.50.  I think it also comes with home fries and toast, but she was rattling things off so fast I'm not quite sure. They weren't even busy yet. Seems odd to me for a diner not to have separate sides.   Aside from that I got the pumpkin pie crepe which was great!  Overall, it's too expensive. The bill was $21.00 for eggs, bacon, and a filled crepe.  I will not be coming back.

_NGya0YQlfQq9Vde98YnUg.text: I recommend the pancake here! It's very good! For omelets, they are pretty delicious, but too greasy for me. The home fries (potato) are must-try food. Also the size is so large, so it's suitable for hungry people! Really awesome!  If you can come here on weekdays, the restaurant is very good for you to have breakfast or brunch. If you are only available on weekend, come here as early as possible (maybe before 7:00am), because I don't think it's worth to wait for more than 30 mins even though I give it 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Bionic Omelet!! This is the most famous one!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. South Of The Border (Eggwhite)! Mexican Style!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hotcake Special (Corn Beef Hash &amp; Buttermilk Pancake w/ Banana Pecan)

s098kTyzHVE0KARe2GMmDA.text: My dad & I walked from downtown Pittsburgh because we heard Deluca's had the best breakfast in Pittsburgh. When we got there, the line was out the door. After 20 minutes, we got a table. It was a small little diner, but the food was very good. I got French toast & bacon. My dad got a ham & cheese omelet. We were both pleased with our meals & left full. We will definitely be going back when we return to Pittsburgh.

bOP7PF884XJITkn959eI_A.text: Best meal I had in Pittsburg was breakfast at this place. Located in the heart of the Strip District, we went at peak time and probably waited for about a half hour. I'm glad we did. Trying to be healthy, I ordered the Greek omelette and asked to make it with egg whites. For $11.99 (+$1 for egg whites), this delicious creation comes with spinach, tomato, feta and asiago cheese, and choice of steak or chicken; I went with the chicken. Wow, this thing was good! One of the best omelets I've had in a long time, and I don't usually do the egg white thing. The home fries, cooked to crispy perfection, were also excellent.  Service was top notch  and the old school diner ambiance is a fun experience. 5 stars for an excellent breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Greek omelette with home fries. Delicious!!!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

pW1jEOBm_Fajslj4S7H7kQ.text: Dinery diner you've ever dined at. Huge super filling menu, awesome staff, friendly faces and all the interaction or lack there of you want. Highly recommend the MOAB (that's pronounced moe-ahb NOT M-O-A-B).

9Kk0iod4cwQXoXPBOaEfcA.text: After seeing Deluca's on TV, my friend had to go during our trip. We've walked by in previous years and it had a huge line.       This year, we walked right into disappointment. We sort of expected something special but it was more like Alice's Diner. Old booths, old equipment and old grease mist floating in the air making it hard to breath.      To be honest the food was good but average. Not worth all the TV excitement or driving more than a mile or two for. And not as good as other places near by.      The service was good and pretty fast.       All in all it was an average meal, in an average diner. I will say that some of the lunch menu items sounded more interesting.

eW2z8Xyo7lizKlyD1yr3Dw.text: I had no idea what to expect when I did a Yelp search, but I was pleasantly surprised by this local establishment.   The menu was huge and the prices were super reasonable.   I went on a saturday morning, so it was insane, but well worth the wait.   Just what I was looking for - except next time I'll come earlier so I don't have to wait in the freezing cold.

I7ZueOmRRjgGFaNM6mfyiw.text: My favorite breakfast spot in the city! Get there early on weekends to beat the crowd. Even if there is a line, it usually moves pretty fast. Coffee is hot and food options are endless. We have tried it all from omelets to French toast to burgers to crepes to pancakes. Everything we have ever eaten there has been delicious! Prices are extremely fair too. This place runs like a well oiled machine...and we can't get enough!

2jpK8ALF6FqcU6vsL3U2Og.text: Awesome diner experience! The line was out the door, so I expected a great meal. We waited about 15 min on a Saturday morning before we were seated at the counter. We received coffee and water quickly. The coffee was good and our cups were full the entire meal, thanks to great service.   I got the mixed plate with poached eggs. Definitely lived up to its hype on Man vs Food. Perfectly grilled veggies, crispy potatoes and the runny yolk. Each bite was great. Definitely filled me up! Also had a few bites of hubby's French toast. It was soooo good! Thick, custardy and chewy. Loved it!    We had a great Pittsburgh experience here!

zC2sb36wlJsj5k1STtrgwQ.text: quick service even when really busy. Huge proportions. Good prices. Lots of menu items and variety to pick from- not just breakfast. the Superbowl omelette is really great and highly recommend it. Friendly staff too.

PT5ikRXjZ51MX8M5GXCwwQ.text: Came here today for breakfast. Definitely a bit of a wait to get a table but the food was good. Large portions good food- I got the Reese's Cup hot cakes and they were good until the end when the pancakes soaked up all of the ice cream and got a little too rich. Other than that I was a fan of them.  The apple crepes looked really good as well and are something I would go back to get.  I liked it and would return for sure but at the same time I would put it at just under 5 stars

k1kSkx0FOZwzY0V6INdrUQ.text: Haven't been here in a long time and we looked forward to visiting this establishment today since we drove to Pittsburgh to visit family.  Very disappointed! Prices went up, cash only, owner/Manager very rude! Had to ask for coffee refill twice! Overall breakfast was good and plenty of it too! Hostess very friendly. We won't be visiting this establishment anytime soon! I rather revisit Door Stop in  Dormont or Bobs in Carnegie! Adios DeLucas!

3MZtp8dEjI3we6FI8wKAQQ.text: Not the best brunch I've had but it's solid good breakfast joint. Pancakes were some of the best I've had. I would probably repeat for the hot cakes if ever in the area again.

SDLH6DQ5KTPRcKuBJ3V_tA.text: Came in for a late breakfast, no one at the front to greet me, saw 6 open seats at the counter and no one waiting, so I just sat down. Big mistake, got Barked at by a woman behind the counter for seating myself. Be aware, she's mean as hell. My star rating is for the attitude, the food was good. My waitress was an absolute sweetheart.

cpbCr0_B8jxdX_ntGWiv2A.text: I know that many people think this is the best breakfast joint in town.  I just don't see it.  It's not bad, but its nothing special either.  I certainly wouldn't complain about eating here if I was with someone who wanted to go, its not bad at all.  But, it would not make my list of suggested breakfast restaurants either.  What this place does have is history.  If someone is recommending this for breakfast, you can guarantee they are a long time Pittsburgher.  It may very well have been the best place in town 20 or 30 years ago.  But with so many great restaurants in the city now, this one is living off nostalgia.

yK9YmrbMKBu010Vy3Qt9tg.text: I love Pittsburgh. The city, the people, the sports, the beer and THE FOOD. I am a huge breakfast fan, and I can honestly say without hesitation that Deluca's Diner is my favorite breakfast spot of all time. I have had the privilege of eating here five times now over the years and it is always amazing.  I am always torn between the mixed grill or the M.O.A.B. (Mother Of All Burritos). Likewise, I can never decide on the sweet sausage or the hot sausage, and typically just order a side of whichever I don't get with my mixed grill breakfast.  There is ALWAYS a line up here so plan accordingly. As well, service can be extremely slow (as it was this past Saturday) but some things are worth the wait. I love this place and could never visit Pittsburgh without a stop in!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. It&#39;s always a beautiful day for DeLucas...
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My all time favourite
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. M.O.A.B. Mother Of All Burritos

jp4CydNZLnLHSdWnpLi6cw.text: This is a classic diner. The food is good, even above average. They have some very unique tales on the omelet and the quality of the food doesn't disappoint. I had the "Super Bowl" which was kielbasa, mashed potatoes, cheese, sauerkraut kraut in the omelet. The home fries were a little over cooked but there was a huge portion. The rye toast was done well and flavorful. Coffee was good too.

geiOWmUcs47kZ5bqt3PNow.text: Great spot for a quick Northeastern breakfast. You get a lot of food for your money's worth, so come with a big appetite.   I went with the Steel City Breakfast of Champions and it did not disappoint; eggs, sausage, bacon, 'tatoes, toast, and two huge pancakes (my choice was chocolate chip); I was, however, forced to concoct a strategy with which to approach all the food that was put in front of me. Decided to go all protein first and leave the carbs for last, which ended up being the best option; I had to get a to-go-box, hoping to encounter a hungry homeless man. Food was good, nothing fancy and def greasy but it definitely hit the spot.  Service is super fast and attentive; the staff definitely puts in a full day's workout in a few hours.   CASH ONLY, so come prepared.

yac2pdgvEgf082_d8U6Wpg.text: One of the clerks who worked at our hotel recommended DeLuca's for breakfast. We got there around noon on a Saturday, and only had to wait about 10 minutes. We were seated at the counter which was fine as it was in the middle of the action. The place has that old school diner feel down pat, complete with line cooks screaming at each other, and waitresses slinging large cups of sweet tea. I ordered the Huevos Ranchero with refried beans and was NOT disappointed. Massive serving and the taste was fantastic.  The location is right in the middle of the Penn strip and it was a busy, bustling afternoon. It was a great way to lay down some food before hitting the Yeungling's at the Pirates game later that day. Will definitely go back when Im in town next.

Xp5kxePgmwhr0K8s_YLBxQ.text: Stopped in for a late breakfast and to shop the Strip. Not to be disappointed. We sat at the counter, and our drinks were immediately served. I had an egg & cheese sandwich with lettuce, tomato and onion on lightly grilled Italian bread with a side of homefries. My guy ordered his usual softly scrambled eggs, bacon and homefries.  My coffee was pleasantly filled by attentive employees. The homefries unfortunately were cold but the quickly rectified. The bathrooms?  OMG. Remodeled!  Nicely redone and that was truly a shockeroo. Very nice. Sae a little placard ib the counter indicating the Yankees may soon be updated too. Wowee  Our fav free parking spots are now fenced off so we used the on street parking kiosk. Not bad. $3 for two hours.   Everyone knows that this is THE breakfast spot in the Burg. Keep going because it's always good.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Now this is a how a breakfast should be.

26yWg6I7JOjHM8iBNw-eRQ.text: To start off the "strip" is an over priced tourist trap. Nothing here is outstanding. Cheap knockoff t shirts etc. Diner is old fashion looking which I like. If you sit at counter you will be subjected to hear the staff's conversations. Old fashion looking is where it stops. Service was friendly but prices were high at $13 for coffee eggs and bacon. And the kicker which I found out too late. They only except cash. The ATM 2 stores over will steal $3.50 for the fee. $16 for breakfast is not old fashion. I suspect rent is higher for this area. Any place else this diner would not survive. Not worth the trip.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The strip. Dirty over priced tourist trap. I fell for it.

TGtWPq11cm9IoK0rO4miOw.text: Super classic greasy spoon diner in the Strip District. WELL WORTH THE WAIT OUT THE DOOR. The food is fantastic and it was very cheap. My partner and I had a table full of food and the bill was under $25. We didn't eat that much for that cheap all weekend. Incredible, keep doing what you're doing DeLuca's!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

1k1k-vwbyMhRAgn8I5bKGA.text: This is the ultimate diner, from the intimidating long but quickly moving line that sprawled several store lengths along the sidewalk to the frazzled hostess and the no-nonsense wait staff. This cash-only establishment harkens back to the time when people entered a diner to eat and keep going with their busy day rather than to lollygag while Instagraming pretty but quickly cooling plates of food.   We walked to The Strip from our hotel to check out the scene with two establishments in mind for breakfast. We were starving. So we initially passed by the long line at Deluca's to find our other option. But when chaos was the order of the day there, we hightailed it back to the end of the line at Deluca's. All in all, we waited roughly 25 minutes and met some very nice people with whom to chat.   Upon being seated, our waitress immediately served us coffee and water and then gave us plenty of time to peruse the huge menu of offerings. I ended up choosing the Veggie Burrito, even though I wasn't particularly in the mood for Mexican(ish) food and Loverboy ordered his go-to - a bacon, egg and cheese sandwich with a side of hash browns. The bustling diner has all of the expected cliches; the nice waitresses spare few words of conversation beyond taking your order, line cooks call out plates when completed, and the food is served piping hot on plates that are likely older than me. Our coffee cups were never empty thanks to an attentive waitress and we dug into our meals happily.  Loverboy polished off his sandwich in record time. He clearly was hungry and appreciated the local bread. I was very pleased with the Veggie Burrito; although, I was initially intimidated by the sheer size of it. Do not expect a dainty dish. It's a huge flour tortilla chocked full of grilled veggies, scrambled eggs and potatoes, topped with a slice of cheese and a mysterious red sauce that was slightly spicy and to-die-for! After some persistence and a break or two, I managed to clean my plate. Granted, there were a lot of veggies. So I wasn't bursting at the seams. But I certainly had no intention of eating lunch anytime soon.  The check was left on our table after a final check-in from our waitress and we paid at the register prior to leaving. This was one of the best diners we've visited. It's plain, simple, no-frills food that tasted great. Stop in if you get a chance. Don't let the line scare you away. It's worth a short wait.

uAXI-GRxiCBJgGQJfOgnOQ.text: DeLuca's Diner is a good little breakfast spot if you're ever in the area! Although it is a little messy inside the food makes up for it! Highly recommend the biscuits and gravy! Also a quick tip before you go: they only accept cash!

nam0QRzSOrF-Wa9ReVz5Dg.text: Surprising even though I've grown up in Pittsburgh this was my first visit to Delucas.  A friend and I decided to grab breakfast her on New Year's Day. I was pleasantly surprised to find open since it was a holiday.  This is definitely a greasy spoon type joint which is definitely part of the charm. However, the prices didn't reflect this.  When I think dirty little diner I normally think affordable food.   I ordered blackberry pancakes and bacon. I was surprised when I was just given a normal short stack and some blackberry jam on the side. The food was just okay. Nothing special. I did appreciate that the portions are HUGE. But for the price I paid for the meal I could have spent that same money somewhere else got a higher quality dish.  Over all I was disappointed in Delucas but if you're in the strip District and want over priced diner food this is the place for you.

BbmFTx8nowwv6pSz82yM_A.text: Fantastic little diner place? Yup.  Gigantic plates of decadent food that no human being can reasonably finish in sitting? Definitely.  Reasonable prices? Absolutely.   The wait can get long, but it's worth it for fresh pancakes topped with drizzles of chocolate sauce, a large dollop of ice cream, and whipped cream, or gigantic omelettes stuffed full of anything you can imagine (the seafood one is surprisingly good despite being a diner omelette filled with seafood)

ejTkZB3mqy8r9DBMf4pafA.text: The hunt for a proper diner continues...   Not sure why everyone likes this place so much, but I didn't dig it at all.    For starters, there's always a line out the door.  There's no waiting space inside, so it's not as long as you'd think, but it's usually a wait.  Once inside, the place is dark and diner-y.   While that was what I was looking for, it was also really hot in there, which was a downer.  My area was also quite sticky, which didn't really work for me either.    Service was quick and efficient - what you would expect of a busy diner.  When it's time to pay, you have to go to the front, where it is Cash Only.   Annoying, but ok.      The food was where they really lost me though.   I ordered the eggs, kielbasa, home fries, and toast.  The toast was the best thing I got.  The eggs were overdone.  The potatoes underdone.  The kielbasa was browned on the outside, but cold on the inside.  Overall, a poor performance on a standard breakfast.

nNrQiCW495R7qEe_oChNJQ.text: Cash Only!  We didn't think it was all that great. Now service was actually pretty good it's fast, but still friendly. I ordered a fish sandwich that was supposed to come with cold slaw and it was forgotten, but I was full anyways.  I also ordered a potato soap that was good, but not great.   My husband had French toast with jelly would have been nice to see fresh fruit?   It wasn't our thing, but I'm still glad we went. Also the serving sizes for my husband and I were not huge, it seems that many had larger servings.  No wait at 1100 on a Thursday.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seafood Sub (tons of cheese on it)
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dining area
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Potato Soap

eBR2R6xkDtqiafiubxMBBA.text: Although all tourists may believe Pamela's is the go to spot (which it totally is), DeLuca's Diner is arguably the best breakfast stop in the city. The potatoes are buttery and delicious, the hot cakes are of perfect consistently and aren't overwhelmingly sweet, and the meat is just amazing / flavorful. The sausage, egg, and potato breakfast might be my favorite selection of theirs because of the simplicity and freshness of each ingredient. My only warning is that, if you try to go to DeLuca's at peak hours, be prepared to wait for a loong time in line as they do not have reservations. Even with the immense popularity, the wait staff remain quick and friendly. I recommend DeLuca's to anyone, and I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

71MmQWxcKgHmKEVizubndA.text: I had the strawberry fields hotcake sundae and oh boy I wasn't disappointed! Yes, they have ICE CREAM for breakfast and it's been featured on Man vs Food. My partner got the huevos rancheros, which were also very tasty! You can choose between home fries or refried beans. Highly recommend this place, especially if you're just stopping by Pitt for a visit. Prices were pretty good given the amount of food you get.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strawberry Fields hotcake sundae
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Huevos rancheros with refried beans

DOBp5n1W_eOzDjdlvJoesw.text: Every item we ate (and that's a lot of items) was the best version of that item I've ever tasted in a diner (and I love a good diner).  We went at lunch time to avoid the morning rush, but of course got breakfast anyway. So good. Fun staff. Fun place. Great food.

nXKGT3wlNXzs3EGRZdsAMg.text: I don't get the hype :/ I think a lot of people that are nuts about it only like it out of nestolgoa. I was served eggs with hair in it once and the waitress never checked back about if we liked it or for drink refills. I was once served sausage so overcooked on the outside and hard that the penguins could have used it in a hockey game yet it was pink inside. I told the waitress I didn't like it and couldn't eat it. She didn't take it off the bill or replace it.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cottage cheese and bbq burger with banana peppers
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So over cooked and Rock hard I couldn&#39;t eat it. Pink in middle though. Told waitress and was still charged for only eating the eggs
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs Benedict with bacon. I ate the potatoes my friend lost her mind over the eggs Benedict.

TkTCdwXIk6aPnxnZYjULhQ.text: After finding JoJo's Restaurant boarded up, we ventured over to Deluca's around 1:30pm. The place had certainly died down from the brunch craziness so we were able to be seated immediately. Huge menu = indecisive me however I ordered simple - eggs, meat (chorizo), homefries and toast along with one hotcake and some coffee. The breakfast was delicious with ample portions and for relatively affordable price about 7 bucks then 2 for the hotcake. Server was nice and checked in periodically - the wait staff that we interacted with were all friendly. While Deluca's is a diner and I expect some grease, I felt their floors were a little much as I had to make sure I wasn't sliding when walking out the door. I would come back to Deluca's though would go elsewhere if the line was long. Good but not an hour wait long good.

3wd4L7fXIWo13YBvyfmUkQ.text: Best breakfast in town. If you're not there at the crack of dawn, expect to wait in line. Worth it.

cvWUBS1bTsPXKMa3rgffsw.text: I had a mixed grill (was feeling particularly carnivorous that day) and it was good.  Loads of meat, served with grilled veggies and potatoes.  I couldn't finish it, and ended up taking some home, and it proceeded to be my breakfast for two days after that.    The breakfast meats are pretty good, and the prices are good too.  Standard diner fare, with a little more of a busy atmosphere.

fxHU0OFbUilINzLf5RE2tg.text: Classic greasy dinner food. Try Cafe on the Strip for better Italian french toast and shorter line.

VcRFLObA49bO9rr21WSJgQ.text: Yum!  Tried the seafood crepe, had banana and peanut butter pancakes, and tried the chocolate and strawberry crepe.  The service was quick and friendly.  If you are in the strip district any time before they close at 2:30, you've got to try it.

PewTRgzLTkPoNequFwRJ3g.text: While my mixed grill was OK, it was nothing I couldn't make at home.  I was expecting bigger flavor.   The 2 stars come from the HORRIBLE service.  I get it - greasy spoon, yinzers, etc.  But c'mon....45 minutes to make some eggs?  the dumb waitress said "they're a little backed up".  Well, yeah, but c'mon.  We were there WAY too long.  It kind of ruined the rest of our day.   This isn't the best breakfast in PGH by any stretch of the imagination.  It was fine for what it was, but the terrible service = not returning.  I have better things to do during my trips to Pittsburgh then wait around for breakfast.

SJKdPeKkMuTNUVYr-b3rGg.text: Great breakfast food! Good coffee. Service is quick and the breakfast/lunch food is SO MUCH BETTER than Pamela's.   The location is perfect so that you can go grocery shopping afterwards (in the Strip District).

kUMCgZDK5Kh_bgley70dtA.text: There is a line at the door on Saturday mornings, but it moves quickly.  If possible, sit at the counter to watch the frenetic activity at the grill.  The portions are huge and the quality very good.  We enjoyed the ranchero omelet and the French toast with blueberries.

ypsAm8emwEYY4ExeXoVSJQ.text: Worst breakfast experience of my life.  we waited 30 minutes for a table while other tables and seats at the bar were empty.  upon asking about the empty tables the hostess gave us attitude and said they aren't ready.  when we finally sat down and ordered it took 30 more minutes to get our food.  halfway through my typical greasy diner omelet i realized our orders had been mixed up and i had been given my friends chorizo omelet in lieu of my veggie fritatta (which was really a veggie omelet).  when informing our server she told us it was our fault that we couldn't tell and its not her job to know which food goes where.  then proceeded to tell us not to come back.  when we asked for the manager we were given more attitude and eventually resulting in a yelling match with the server and manager.  worst customer service i have EVER EVER experienced.  and really the food isn't special at all.

ABIOBMoPyacvR9FgDteJEQ.text: I found this place accidentally one morning while strolling through the Strip District hungrier than anything. Wow, what a lucky day for me! It is the perfect breakfast joint--quirky, crowded, noisy, and the food is fantastic. It's like the breakfast equivalent of Primanti Brothers. A great little local joint with great food that's probably too popular for its own good but hasn't been ruined by success.

e1RI-OC9cX2GCTRlMGNBDA.text: its hard to screw up breakfast they did it.... when ya tote a sign that says Pittsburgh's best breakfast back it up... thats why it got 1 star.  i dont understand the hype the lines the waiting when there are a ton of other places in town that blow this place out of the water.... ritters, pamelas etc etc. the bacon was soggy  euuugh. the coffee was luke warm potatoes/homefries bland.service poor at best.  dont waste your time or money on this place.

9F_KztgEcS6aQdUitnwMVA.text: This place is one of the best whole in the wall breakfast spots i've been to, ever, I put down the chocolate chip ice cream pancakes and the vegetable egg chorizo scramble combo buisness (forget the exact name)...the waitress stopped me half way through ordering and disclaimered how much food that would be, I said i know, and yes i did finish it all :)

COOpp2C36pj3TxYc7FVAZg.text: Omg!! Adam Richman was right!! This place is delicious!! Bring cash (they don't take check or card) and prepare to wait.  But the wait is sooooooo worth it!!  Since I was on a diet, I got the Bodybuilders breakfast--oatmeal(creamiest, tastiest oats I have ever eaten), fruit cup, turkey sausages (6 links), 6 scrambled egg whites, and tomato slices.
