My hubby got the New Yorker omelet which had cheese, salami, capicola (deliciously spicy) and ham.  Father in law got the Seafood omelet (lobster, crab, and shrimp topped with a savory sauce and avocado) His breakfast was the best at the table!!  Hands Down!! We were all jealous.    To round out the meal, we absolutely had to get a pancake sundae!  We opted for the Reece.  It had chocolate chip pancakes, chocolate peanut butter ice cream, chocolate sauce, caramel sauce , whipped cream and a cherry.  Heavenly!!  I will need to return soon!

mNvz6GcGy3kr89zPlWxjpg.text: If you travel to Pittsburgh, you cannot leave without having Breakfast at Deluca's. This is a piece of Pittsburgh history, and the food/environment is truly wonderful! They are still running this place the way they did 50-years ago. Family run diner that is worth your time, and the small penny that it will cost for a large meal. I highly recommend going early on Saturday morning, grabbing breakfast from Deluca's and then exploring the Strip District.

ZUiBixTeENB5D2AOMM8ClQ.text: Went to Pittsburgh on a whim (from Cleveland). I've been there several times before and I actually enjoyed it more this time around. Looked up on my phone for the best eats on the strip and Deluca's came up as a must. Most, if not all reviews on Yelp are positive. There was a line out the door at about 1PM on a Saturday, but we only waited about 30 mins. I ordered the Mixed Grill breakfast (supposedly Bruce Willis' favorite) with steak. I expected it to be greasy, and it was. No problem there. However, the steak was dry, overcooked, and the whole meal was bland. I still finished it, but I was expecting better. Maybe I should've tried something else???  Anyone have a suggestion of the next dish to try the next time I go back?

GBBAPepzgOUm2p9rIvY6wA.text: The best french toast in the city. Small, french bread slices soaked in egg, and hit with just the right amount of butter.  Deluca's inside is filthy. They know it, and they love it. The hours are weird, though they're open into the mid-afternoon. I liked Deluca's UNTIL I discovered JoJo's, which is nearby, but closes at noon. Now, Deluca's feels second rate, because I'm an eggs, meat, and potatoes person more than a griddle dude.  If it was the other way around, Deluca's might be my favorite.

WVZ0qbM8Y7kyF9AWU-Q-ow.text: Nice little greasy spoon with a line of people waiting to be seated. French Toast and Eggs Benedict were good, as were the potatoes. But bring cash since they don't take debit/credit cards.

9-KP7Y0li_Uyqo9YPfxFhQ.text: Worth going to once since it's a Pittsburgh institution.  It's an experience.  I had breakfast there this morning.  I was asked 4 times if I was ready to order while my while my face was planted in the menu, patently pondering the choices.  I had a difficult time getting water. I made eye contact with one employee who then just kept walking; I took it that he will only bus tables.  My coffee was burnt, though after a while a nice lady came around and when I explained this she said that "yeah, the decaf is blacker".  No, burnter.  But she did bring me a fresh cup of regular.  The food was pretty good, though not exactly what I ordered.  The turkey sausage was somehow watery; I marvel how they accomplished that.  Most of the staff was friendly and my dining guest thoroughly enjoyed his meal, so again I'd say it's worth at least one trip.  Maybe you'll enjoy it more.

fX7HWALOTLhJ-Cuu3O0iiA.text: The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is because there is always a line on the weekends. To their credit, the wait is shorter than you would think for a line that long. But ultimately, that just mean's it has good food. The breakfast is great and prices are very reasonable. I highly recommend it for a weekend brunch.

WE3F22Eyc8rE4DZVM8OoQQ.text: The only good thing about DeLuca's is they could accomodate our party of 9.  Our orders were wrong. The omelette I had was overcooked. $3 for a glass of tomato juice? That's ridiculous! Far too expensive for what we received.  I'll never go back.

zc0dVMS7bRmNbge9ZBbODA.text: No trip to the Strip/Pittsburgh is complete without a pit stop at DeLuca's for breakfast!  First things first, you're going to have to wait in line to get seated, there's usually no way around it, but TRUST ME it's well worth the wait! DeLuca's advertises "Best Breakfast in town" and they strongly back up that statement with their food!  For people who live the fitness lifestyle like myself not eating what you want can be torturous! DeLuca's does however offer up some meals to suit fitness conscience people with offering their "BodyBuilders Breakfast". But you better believe that when I'm in DeLuca's it's time for a cheat meal! I usually go with a Hot Sausage, Egg and cheese breakfast sandwich on Manci's Italian Bread. Then I dive into an order on their amazing hot cakes! Usually the Rece's cup or Cinnamon Bun.   Overall take it from a Yinzer and try this place out

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cinnamon Bun hot cakes and a hot sausage, egg and cheese sandwich! Fireeee

R39a1pIgvj29k7saLvw80Q.text: Definitely one of the better diners in the area. I'm a big fan of breakfast food any time of day, so I've never had their lunches, but their breakfast is great!

MAU_nuBPEXo1l4hVMjA-_g.text: Took my third trip to Deluca's Restaurant in the Strip District (been to the new Robinson location several times).  Eating here never gets old!!   Ate at the counter for the first time. It was fun to watch the kitchen work.  Really makes you appreciate the cooks and the food when you see how hard and fast they are working.  I ordered "THE CALIFORNIA" omelette, it is quickly becoming my favorite.  It's an omelette loaded with avocado, tomatoes, spinach, sweet roasted red peppers, pesto chicken, and swiss cheese.  The ingredients are very fresh and not as heavy since it's essentially meatless.  They move their customers in and out at a quick pace.  Don't be intimidated by the line. Service is fast and efficient!

f1Ji58X_9VTfMAixoELzOw.text: Visiting from California to beautiful Pittsburg for the Steelers game.  Was told by all the locals that this is a must go to place for breakfast if we visiting in town.  Got there  and the wait was about 5 minutes (we got lucky) and all I can say is this place is one of the best breakfast places my wife and I have ever eaten at. I had the friend chicken and waffle with a side of potatoes and my wife had a waffle with some ham.  Simply amazing and the service was very good.    If you visiting Pittsburg, this place is a must go to!!!!!!  We honestly liked it better than Pamela's.

GltXR39Nrc3hUoiQLReYKw.text: What can I really say about DeLuca's that hasn't been said before by others (and more eloquently, at that)?    We don't have a place like this in Baltimore, exactly.  Yes, there are great breakfast joints here, but ... I can't say that they serve up food quite like what we experienced at DeLuca's.  A pancake dish that looks suspiciously like a huge apple pie with mountains of whipped cream can't be bad in anyone's book - certainly not in mine.  I can hear my friends in Baltimore going, "But-but-but... what about Blue Moon Cafe?  What about their Captain Crunch French toast?  But-but-but..."  Nope.  Sorry.  DeLuca's blows the Captain away, sails and all.  This place is better.  A thousand times better.    For one thing, DeLuca's has a menu that's about 100 times bigger than what Blue Moon offers.  The only things you come there for is the Sweet Baby Jesus and the Captain Crunch toast - and yeah, they're great for what they are.  But at DeLuca's?  A massive burrito the size of your forearm (aptly named the Mutha of All Burritos, or MOAB), the daily special cheeseburger omelet (which is what I ordered here), a pancake sundae (yes, SUNDAE - buckwheat pancakes with a huge scoop of vanilla ice cream, hot fudge drizzles, cherries, whipped cream in peaks the size of the Appalachians)... how can Blue Moon even begin to compare with this?  Answer?  It can't.  It simply can't.    Massive respect for the staff here.  I can't even begin to describe the way they're flying around in this tiny-assed little kitchen, serving dish after dish after dish after dish of this insane goodness.  This place only seats 90 people at a time, folks - it's damn near as hard to get in here as it is Blue Moon, that's for sure.  There's always a line.  Be prepared to wait, and be prepared not to complain.  You're going to wait - simple as that - and it's going to be freaking worth every minute.  Grab a book, a lawn chair, play some Candy Crush or whatever, pass the time.  Dream of the huge Appalachian whipped cream mountains you're about to eat.  Really.  If you're willing to sit at the counter instead of a table, you're likely to get in here a lot faster.  Everything was on point, from the coffee to the food to the service.    The only downside is that, like most places seem to be in the P'burgh, this joint is cash only.  I don't understand it, but hey, hit up the ATM.  This place is worth the hassle.  If you're going to stop for breakfast in Pittsburgh in only one place... this is it.    We will be back.  That's not a maybe - that's a will.  We WILL be back.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kudos to the hard working staff here!!!!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheeseburger omelet!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Apple cinnamon pancakes?  Syrup?  Ice cream?  My husband calls it heaven at the end of a fork..

jCJ-KfWx-98cJOHkdVmNPw.text: Although I feel the food at Delucas is mediocre, I feel that the diner's atmosphere, coffee, and location make this spot worthy of a four star!

YYfFaIZ7YVXDpIXlvZFwtg.text: Visiting Pittsburg for the weekend, we picked Deluca's solely based on the number of positive Yelp reviews, but I really thought it was just so-so.    The staff was amazing and the whole place runs like a machine.  We got there ~9:15 and there were about six groups ahead of us, but we didn't wait long since they're exceptionally fast at getting tables cleared and ready for the next party.  An empty plate never sat longer than a few seconds and our coffee was always full.   I ordered way too much food, as usual:  Sausage gravy and biscuits with scrambled eggs and potatoes with an extra single "fancy pancake" with lingonberries.  My husband ordered some sort of breakfast burrito which I didn't try.    The sausage gravy and biscuits came out first and they were AMAZING.  The side of eggs and potatoes and the pancake came out about five minutes later; not really a biggie, but I'm not really sure if they just forgot and threw it together when I asked where it was because the eggs almost seemed like somebody started to make fried eggs and then decided at the last second that they should be scrambled.  They were runny and yolky in spots and white and fried-eggy in other spots (pretty much exactly like you would expect a chopped-up fried egg to look).  Maybe this is the way that they always are, but it was really unappetizing.  The pancake was also off somehow.  I looked around at everybody else's pancakes and they were light and fluffy, but mine was deflated with an almost rubbery texture.  It's like they used crepe batter, but it was thicker than I would expect a crepe to be.  The potatoes were good, but nothing remarkable.  Maybe my expectations were just too high...

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The flattest little pancake on earth

Nhp33Lc96CXSNjIS7XMMTg.text: Second time here was excellent! I had another omelet and it completely made up for last time! My omelet last time was dry and not very flavorful. This time my omelet was moist and delicious! I had ham, cheese and tomato inside of it and the home fries were great too! My friend had the cinnamon bun pancakes and loved them! I can't decide if it's better than Pamela's, I think they're both great!

ql0bBfHzAYyY54_wA79Ytg.text: My favorite spot to get breakfast in the city. Line is usually out the door on the weekends resulting in a 15+ minute wait. However, the wait is ALWAYS worth it. Low frill diner food prepared with love. The California Benedict is an Eggs Benedict lover's dream. Really like a lot of the French toast and pancake options as well. Have yet to have something I didn't like.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seafood Benedict on 2 slices of fresh Mancini&#39;s Italian bread. Phenomenal!

WlgjtJSDF_EQ7q1I0kvE4w.text: Amazing breakfast as always! My husband and I split the MOAB burrito.. The chorizo and Spanish sauce are to die for! Our friends both got the bionic omelet, one added chorizo. It was their first time here and they thoroughly enjoyed it. There was a line out the door when we arrived but it went fast and it was more than worth it. They were super busy, but that made the food fast and fresh :) our one friend feels that the home fries could use more spices, a little more flavor. Our home fries were in our burrito so it made them perfect, but I could see what he means when they're just on the side. My husband was drinking coffee and never had to flag someone down for a refill. The staff was attentive and courteous. We love coming here when we come in town!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The bionic omelet! Added cheese and no onions :) with home fries and an English muffin.
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The MOAB burrito! Chorizo, avocado, hot peppers, cheddar cheese, Spanish sauce, sour cream, amazingness!

hyj1etyXFoG5C5EnHNeXFA.text: Authentic American breakfast, portions are big , prices are good. Tastes like at home. Would definitely recommend to friends especially for foreigners to try American food. 4.9 our of 5.

SrSzGp8LpDNki9wkdZXz5A.text: We came here for brunch on New Years Day. The wait was about half hour, but there is no indoor space in which to wait so it was cold standing there. The waiting process was also very awkward. There is no list; you just stand in line. Once inside, rather than coming to you, they just point and wave to go to your table.   Our server was not pleasant in the least. I understand they were busy, but there isn't really an excuse.   They also are cash only. Who does not accept credit cards in 2016????   I was fully prepared to give a 1 star rating given all the issues above.   The food though was so delicious that it brought them back to 3 stars. The pancakes, eggs, bacon, omelets, home fries and sausage were some of the best I've had.

mBh-5hxKKN1F0XFLe9VzqA.text: Food was very good. The portions were HUGE!  It was also a great atmosphere. This will be on my list of to dos for my next trip to Pittsburgh. I had the waffle and sausage gravy. However, next time I am getting a pancake sundae!  Saw a man with one on our way out and it looked amazing. My advice it to go early. We got there about 8a and by the time we left there was a line out the door.

kRVj5kvg1RzyHqezLMWnQw.text: We came to Deluccas after a concert, (hangover was in full force) we heard it was a local spot and had to check it out. I'm not a huge breakfast person but my omelet was DELICIOUS. I tried to eat all of it!! When I'm back in Pittsburgh I will definitely be coming back. Our waitress was great! Speedy and funny!  Only downside was the cash only!

53qAkPpNvFB7-pkv_gi05Q.text: The food is 5 star, the restaurant is super cute, the portions are huge, and the prices are right in the effect spot. The reason why I won't give them 5 stars is for the atmosphere on the day of my visit. For the entirety of my visit the manager was sitting at the counter doing paperwork and loudly arguing with one of the cooks. She berated him over his ex girlfriends calling the store, him requesting a day off in January ect.. This went on for about 40 minutes, they continuously went back and forth loudly yelling at each other. Whether they were kidding or not; my extremely hungover brain couldn't handle the shrill yelling.

a6KwBDj23WPVGNaVaO6_3g.text: This is a busy diner-like restaurant with great food. Expect to wait 20-30 minutes if you go for brunch on a Saturday or Sunday (line queues up out front and you just wait your turn).  If you dig the hustle and bustle of a tight diner atmosphere, then this is your place. Pass on by if you're looking for a quiet place to sip your cup of coffee.  They make great breakfast food and they make it fast; we waited less than 10 minutes for our order despite it being packed.  There's a huge menu like you'd expect at a diner but the food is above what I would call "diner quality." I had the Granny's Apple Cinnamon Bun and my wife had the short stack with scrambled eggs. Both were very good; the cinnamon bun pancakes were especially flavorful. The service was attentive but no-nonsense like you'd expect in a super busy place.  Overall very satisfied.  Only thing is busy, cramped places like this stress me out when I'm just trying to enjoy my meal, but that's just a testament to how good the food is.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Granny&#39;s Apple Cinnamon Bun

DkFFZJbVEKqBQdplqFsNXA.text: People in line waiting are talking about how Delucas is the best breakfast in Pittsburgh. When I got a table, it took awhile for my grumbling waitress to take my order, but I had plenty of time to observe the cooks throwing food and plates around, food covering the floor, overwhelmed servers and the interesting mural on the wall. My pankakes were good. The bacon, sausage, potatoes and breakfast burrito was not good. There are much better diners in Pittsburgh that are much cleaner and have more satisfying food. Don't worry, there are places in town with a better breakfast, hands down.

bEPxTKkrvidFvjg3_FdPgQ.text: great old fashioned diner.  For breakfast I had an egg and cheese sandwich with kielbasa on Italian bread it was great.  service was fast and attentive.  The price was as expected.

5BqGAsBOuTlE0V__e2bdvQ.text: It was completely worth the hour weight to get the Super Bowl omelet.  The waitress we had was amazing and was very attentive to the things we needed and made sure we were comfortable.  It is a must go if you are in Pittsburgh. I mean I would have never thought to put mashed potatoes on an omelet with kielbasa.  I will be back the next time I am in the area.

lgcPxdxQf8HjB9IM_k-XcQ.text: This place is amazing for breakfast! I came here with a party of five, there's a line out the door but it is well worth the wait! We were greeted and seated by a waitress who could not have been friendlier! She was sassy, energetic and fun to engage with.   We ordered an assortment of pancakes, waffles, eggs, and more by let me leave you the highlights; Italian toast, waffle sundae, hash browns, and chocolate milkshake. These items were all to die for.   It's a bit crowded inside, and fairly loud, but you will not regret making his your breakfast destination.

0H0FGcd2bye7vreQ0jH-iA.text: I am sure the reviews speak for themselves and my good review probably isn't need but I thought I would leave one anyways.   We got there before 9 am on a Friday. We beat the rush by about 10 mintes. At 910 there was a line with about 30 people in it. The line seemed to move fast but be aware it gets busy.   The food was very good. I asked for a cup of sausage gravy and I got a bowl for the cup price. Also had a bacon omelet that was very large. You can't go wrong with Deluca's on Penn Ave. In the heart of Pittsburghs strip district with many shopping options after you fill your belly with good food at a reasonable price.

G82khjYZC9gaHvVj0zCyDQ.text: Really good diner food.  We stopped here during a day walking around the strip. There was a line out to the sidewalk, but we were seated about 20 minutes later.  The menu has both breakfast and lunch items. I ordered scrambled egg whites, raisin toast, and fruit. My boyfriend ordered a philly cheese steak omelette.  Overall, service was quick and friendly. However, this restaurant is a bit unsanitary.  I was watching them bus tables and they actually pick the butter and jelly packets that are unused and separate them. Basically, they pick through someone else's food and then put the butter back on your clean plate. I'm not sure if they sanitize the butter and jelly packets, but I would guess they do not.  Overall the food was really good, but I would probably skip this if you're looking for something a bit cleaner.  Oh and Adam Richman did an episode here. You can sit in the seat he sat in which has a little plaque.

9_eZjKbUkdzN-lrQpwAQNg.text: Make sure you have cash. It's a cash only business. We walked to eat here from our hotel and we saw the sign saying cash only and we were so sad. But, I  remembered I had my hundred dollar bill in my purse. Thank the cash heavens I brought my purse with the cash in it. I never carry cash so, I was patting myself on the back for that one.   The service is very friendly and has a very old school diner feel. It's a quick paced dinner with a lot going on. There's a lot of commotion of the cooking and people eating. It's a super fun place to eat breakfast.  As far as the food goes, it's all good. I ordered the pancakes, turkey sausage, bacon, eggs, hash potatoes and a side of toast. It was three plates of food. So good, I finished it all. My husband ordered their corned beef hash and I loved his order as well.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Jwb_ah5ogwkrekupaDcyhQ.text: HOLY SMOKES  I have never been here.....I know I know....what took me so long ...but ...omg. it's worth all the hype. Extremely kid friendly and family wallet affordable. I'd take out of towners here in a heartbeat. My husband got the corned.beef omlette....I took a chance and got the seafood omlette. Worth every dime...worth every bite. Hit this place up. You'll love it.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GflZ4ogCiWEJReJ0KVcGIw.text: We tried Pamela's the day before and seen people lined up outside this place and said why not another place.  This place also only accepts cash. It was a Monday and a quicker turn around of getting into the place. It was also good food. I thought the service was prompt, affordable and good stuff.  Recommend checking this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NmyLBFeqFM-HMK17S_uNIQ.text: Before entering, a few items you should be aware of: this diner is CASH ONLY! It's also on the smaller side,  do you may want to outside for a short wait,  but they move very quickly to accommodate everyone.  The food was outstanding,  as was the service. Great coffee. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the Pittsburgh area.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dolche du chocolate with banana
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steel City Breakfast of Champions
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. South of the Border

w1nfM2ZkN-catRwdfjvILQ.text: There was 4 of us. We sat at booth which was a little tight.  I had the French toast with fresh blueberries.  The French toast was good.  The only complaint I had was the blueberries were not fresh.  You could tell it was frozen and thawed.  The service was friendly and they were missing a waitress that morning and no refill of my coffee.  I went to the counter to ask for a refill.  No big deal. Cash only

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outside

t2Tpy-0uNRk7dEAXhU-MAQ.text: We went there 7:00 am on Saturday. There wasn't any line when we get there and were seated right away. We got to seat at the table where Tom Cruise was seating, which was pretty cool.  We got steel city breakfast and low Cal fruit cups, egg whites and toast.The pancake was very good. I like the texture of the pancake and the taste. It is not too sweet so when I added a little syrup, It came out perfect. I don't like the scrambled egg white, the texture is weird to me.  Recommended to go early

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

wCU6joWkS28csJvIygn0GA.text: I'll admit it, when I travel if there's a place that the show Man vs Food has visited...it goes on my list. Adam Rickman was at DeLuca's in 2008 and this place is another Pittsburgh institution so as two slightly hung over and hungry people, Wifey and I got in the car and made our way over to the Strip to experience this place. Now, we came a little late so there wasn't the normal line and we were seated immediately. Our waitress got us water and coffee quickly and she was AWESOME. Really nice, knew the menu, and dropped off our check before she got sent out on break (wish I remembered her name). So I ordered the Steel City Breakfast (short stack pancakes, two eggs fried hard, bacon, kielbasa, potatoes and toast). Wifey had the Hotcake Special (Short stack of pancakes, crispy bacon Scrambled eggs). Neither of us could finish our meals. It's a LOT of food. The pancakes were excellent and they serve great coffee here too. Every hour I'm here I find something else to love about this city and DeLuca's with our fun, engaging waitress certainly helped! delucastripdistrict.com/...

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ramPWrRRXansgkuAmCJQ-w.text: Old fashioned diner that takes you way back! It was crowded upon walking in, but we were seated right away. It's a tad loud in the restaurant itself and there were some cooks yelling most of the time. The restaurant was also a little warm and smelled a little like gas from the stove top. When the air was on you couldn't really tell though.   I got a waffle with eggs and it was really good! The scrambled eggs were cooked perfectly and the waffle was golden crispy. Others at my table got the Greek omelette with home fries and a chocolate chip waffle with eggs & bacon. The Greek omelette was a great size and the home fries were soooooo good. The chocolate chip waffle was loaded up with chocolate!  Overall, cute little diner. Can be a little loud, but great food for the price!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Greek omelette
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs with bacon
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate chip waffle

rXnUc9L1VP70Xrwo5r9WHg.text: I came to Pittsburgh for a Steelers game with the family! We found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try the morning before the game. This is a True diner. Pretty small on the inside, but lots of tables. The food was great, service was friendly and prices were affordable. You get large portions which is a bonus as well!  We enjoyed ourselves so much that we returned the next day before we left! The food was still great, but we had a server who was unpleasant. If not for her, this would be a five star review!  Would definitely recommend going and get the home fries with the cheese, peppers and onions!

Gg4J7CAQmDQK8dZKbkTJGQ.text: Nice old style diner. Food was good and service was pleasant. We enjoyed the pancakes with a big shout out on the banana pancakes. The home style potatoes and bacon were really good. The scrambled eggs were cooked perfectly. A great place for breakfast and to soak up some local flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana pancakes
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Artwork in restaurant
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pancakes

Bu5yg1cdUQf_dDQe9uq_7A.text: DeLucas is a staple in the strip district. We have now been here on two separate occasions and both times the food was pretty fantastic. Today we arrived around 10:50 on a holiday Monday and had no wait. My family ordered a Nutella banana crepe, the seafood omelette and the seafood Benedict. The crepe comes with a while banana in the middle of the crepe; the crepe is then slathered with Nutella and rolled up similar to a burrito. It's covered in powdered sugar and whipped cream. My son loved it and said it was similar to others he had on Germany. The seafood Benedict came with shrimp, crab, and lobster. The poached egg was just a tad runny but nothing to stress about. The taste was great.   I will continue to come back here on each trip to the Burgh! It's definitely worth it.

iQA-NNW78QjaqoAndKVSBw.text: Was in town for a weekend and every cab driver kept mentioning this place. I did my research and was amazed by all the Yelp reviews and photos so I ended visiting before heading to catch the Pirates play. This was the most unique diner I have ever eaten at. It looked and felt like a scene out've a movie. You literally sit down and see the whole kitchen staff cook non-stop amounts of fresh eggs and pancakes like there was no tomorrow all while yelling and people moving everywhere and a huge line out the door. Just tons and tons of fresh eggs and pancakes coming out to feed everyone. The food here is delicious, authentic, fresh, hot (literally), and everyone's favorite part INSANELY CHEAP! I ate so much food and a nice quality cup of coffee for just $11.00. True story!   This is one of those places that you have to visit and experience for yourself. I cannot say enough good things about this place! If I lived in the city I would be here every weekend. Haha!  Pro Tip: The later in the morning you come the bigger the lines get outside. The lines get huge, like seriously. Come in around 9AM to 10AM and you will be alright!

HF1AxvuwxQSTANsT2MVEBQ.text: Went around 8:30am Sunday during Memorial Day Weekend and only waited 5 minutes to be seated. Tables turn over relatively quickly, so don't be too discouraged by a long line! You can also call ahead for reservations. I'd suggest calling ahead if you're a party of more than four - most of the tables and booths are four-tops and counter seating.  We opted to go here instead of Pamela's since they had a wider variety of breakfast options, along with more flexibility to sub-out sides.  The service was great: coffees were always topped off, servers attentive, and the kitchen was quick to get food out once our order was placed. I had the short stack of 2 pancakes with a generous serving of egg whites (and they weren't bland!) and a cup of sliced bananas - the server was kind enough to let me know that the fresh fruit wasn't ripe enough to be enjoyable, so she sliced up bananas for me instead! Husband had the Steel City Breakfast of Champs - and you should be considered a champion for finishing this meal! French toast were huge slices, eggs generous portion, two pieces of meat (the turkey sausage was very tasty), and potatoes well seasoned. Our breakfasts were so filling, we didn't even have lunch that day!  Tasty breakfast. Affordable meal. Quick service. Mom & pop environment. EAT HERE. (And bring CASH!)

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great authentic diner atmosphere!

DBH6QP3K_dMbHBLLVLLh5A.text: I stopped in here after discovering this place walking in the strip. I rolled in on a Sunday morning around 830am there wasn't much of a line but on walking in we where told it was a five minute wait between seatings cause they where missing a few cooks on the line. Once we did get a seat it was a long wait for our food and it's understandable being how short staffed they where. The menu was very large and seem to offer a lot of good stuff. I got the French toast platter with eggs meats and potatoes. The French toast was very basic and the eggs where cooked good being poached. The potato's weren't to soft and the sausage was juicy but the bacon was to over cooked for me. One major thing to mention that left a super bad taste in my mouth with this place is the the two guys cooking on the flattop kept arguing with another worker who kept going up to them and it was loud swearing and arguing. I just think it was super unprofessional and uncalled for as there was little kids around and other people trying to enjoy breakfast. I'm not sure if this is a all the time thing there but it's not a good thing with having a open kitchen and guest sitting right there. I won't be returning here after this experience.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NtFgAWIXd56BJzflSlafyA.text: 20-25 mins wait outside, food was ok nothing out of the ordinary for me, portions were big. Service was ok. Cash only.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Typical diner food, Steel City Breakfast of Champs

zqyE4pPFpxqwnjjdnyl1Yw.text: DeLuca's is a quintessential diner. They have everything you would expect on their menu from pancakes to eggs Benedict. I had the biscuit and gravy with eggs when I came and enjoyed it, although the sausage gravy wasn't the best I've ever had. Overall, I had a nice experience here and enjoyed my food and the old-school atmosphere in the heart of the strip. It's a must-visit when you're in Pittsburgh.

F1lIBTkAVwxLxxp2J62wvA.text: Very tasty. Can't beat the price and efficiency. While they are not the best cinnamon bun pancakes that I've ever had in my life, they are definitely in the top three and the top in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cinnamon Bun Pancakes

iYQFmOtubJe3kVvuQ-NYXg.text: OMG OMG OMG AWESOME!!! Super delish. We got the Steelers breakfast of champs, one with pancakes and the other with speciality waffles. So good, the edges are cooked with a nice crisp and have good flavor. Our waiter was really nice and cool as well. Go there! Now!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Specialty waffle with blueberries

Gfjdr2xnq75eqMLJOqUjpg.text: deluca's is the best restaurant in pittsburgh other than Quaker steak.

geIOVngVtV6Beq1JyqaAeQ.text: In town for the 3-day weekend, I wanted to try some of the more popular spots in Pittsburgh.  Since Deluca's is popular -- hey, it has been on TV! -- I expected to be disappointed.  Nope.  The menu was gigantic -- as big as the portions.  The cinnamon bun hotcakes with the warm, gooey, sweet apples, glazed pecans, and gratuitous whipped cream and vanilla ice cream?  Surprisingly great -- just a great balance of flavors and textures.  The only misfire was on the cheesesteak omelet -- it was supposed to come with a sauce.  When I mentioned it to the waiter, he thought it needed one, too -- but didn't know that it did.  Not a big deal that he didn't know -- just that it did need something.  Eh, I had the hotcakes to share anyway; there was plenty of food on the table.  I'm glad I don't live in Pittsburgh.  I'd be 50 pounds heavier.  FYI cash only.

dKT12qCW13hH2PDUefIurg.text: Nothing to add that hasn't been mentioned by all the other five-star reviewers. My family and I enjoyed a perfect breakfast this morning. And I will add that the peanut butter-banana milkshake was quite possibly the greatest shake I've ever eaten.

cxGQ3tr0xU52q1vsc_oBfw.text: Well worth the 20 minute wait!  I had the caramel apple crepes and a side of hot sausage (which, yes, is SMOKING HOT)....the service was about what you'd expect for a crazy-busy Saturday morning, but everything was on point.  Can't wait for my next trip!

xiBBF6XvFh7DHz6uanp9Og.text: this place was one of my favorite diners ever. really friendly wait staff was a highlight.  there was a line friday midday, but it moved pretty fast, scared to think how long the line is on sat or sun. I got the Texmex omlette which had just a great balance of spice and flavors and was super filling. pancakes looked real good also. great representation of great Pitt dining.

DUJ7ihIjKwSmh6hlJpstUQ.text: The food was pretty good for a diner, but definitely not worth the wait... the service was terrible (somewhat rude, but more disorganized than anything)  After waiting in line for 40 minutes, we sat down and were told that the cook needed to catch up on orders... 30 minutes later we saw a waitress behind the counter taking orders from people who just sat down. when we asked if we could place our orders, we got a pretty rude/sassy lecture along the lines of  "didnt we already tell you that the cook was catching up on orders"  *(yeah, you told us that THIRTY MINUTES AGO... for real...how longs it take to make eggs?)..  when we pointed out that people that just sat down were having orders taken, our waitress asked the cooks and apparently it was ok.... after 30 additional minutes... average pancakes and eggs came out.  again... 1 hour and 40 minutes for so-so pancakes/eggs with a side rude waiters that had no idea what they were doing.   Save yourself a few hours and go to Ritters

3CtoiyLDJRLWpVUJ4Zfebg.text: Seems like a great place to go for a hangover, but I wasn't very impressed.  We went late morning on a Saturday, so naturally there was a huge line.  The atmosphere was fun, like your typical popular, greasy spoon.  The food was just average...spicy, greasy, make you run for the bathroom, gut-busting, giant menu, heart attack-inducing joint.

WVYb8lbksVBo-kSOBcqmVA.text: Had to visit this diner on my first trip to Pittsburgh. We waited outside in the rain but it wasn't too long. Inside was so cute and cozy and everyone was so friendly. We were seated in the back away from the hustle and bustle and we were able to enjoy a huge greasy breakfast. Ordered: Western omelette, short stack of cinnamon bun pancakes, blackberry blintzes and a side of bacon. Everything was good, especially the blintzes. The blackberries on the blintzes were ginormous. When we commented on them, the server brought us some even bigger ones on the side. Coffee was excellent, not bitter at all. Liked this place a lot!

Hci22cNdqzHDEJxSx0uUaQ.text: I personally think that this place is pretty overrated.  I've gone a several times, and I'm never satisfied.  Maybe I'm just not a fan of super greasy and unoriginal breakfasts?  Not my top pick in the city by any means.  Also, it's ridiculous how busy this place gets for what they offer.  And it feels dirty.  So I'll go elsewhere.

zZ8tBQAtyZ9lp6zBzbUPXQ.text: Good but not the waiting-outside-for-a-table good. Portions are large but very pricey for breakfast. I'm going back to Pamela's.

nApQYKRTJbzqqKSklQ8P0Q.text: This is a must for breakfast in the Pittsburgh Strip District! I have never tried them, but they have many kinds of dessert pancakes. Lots of breakfast options. Can be busy - especially on the weekend. Great experiences there!

6KaDyzoKB4w6TNgcSS0LZg.text: I came one Saturday morning for brunch and I must say it's worth the wait. The line moves surprisingly fast because the waiters and busboys are super efficient. Tried the feta spinach omelet and their chocolate banana hotcake special. I was very satisfied and even more satisfied with the staff. They were attentive, constantly pouring coffee, and always checking up on my friend and I. The atmosphere is warm and the customers all seem to be enjoying themselves.

8yHaOK0rfNo7vQBdFNGChA.text: Another really good breakfast place, but literally pamela's twice + jojo's would take precedence.  the wait is usually a little bit long, but it's probably worth it. again, very generous portions. the buckwheat waffle is delicious. i don't know what i was thinking ordering it "on the side".=p

1nTiOPLatCdwAxTMEGek9w.text: Used to be regulars.  Decided to try again yesterday and the place has gone down hill.  They would not accommodate a special menu request to sub turkey sausage for hot sausage.  Also potatoes came out burned to a crisp.  Not even edible.  Won't be going back there any time soon.  Guess I'll have to find the "best breakfast in the burgh" elsewhere.

D_eS6zNGrZ1ER_YcjaLrZA.text: My girlfriend and I have been here and it seems to be pretty average overall.  The food was ok, but nothing spectacular.  I think it falls a little short of the hype.  Breakfast is a cherished event and we just expected a little more from the food and service.  Both were good, but definitely not anything excellent.  Chorizo was not that good.  Pancakes might be a better bet.

PxpvInyzbDwbzaTtW_Or0A.text: Recently visited a friend in pittsburgh and she decided to bring me here. We got there around 1 on a Sunday afternoon aka Peak brunch time. So we had to wait in line for a little bit but wasnt more than 10 minutes. When you walk in they have a sign  stating "best breakfast in town' and yeaa it prob is.   the food- yumm. I ordered an egg white veggie and cheese omelette. Came with a side of toast and homefries. And a banana choc chip pancake. Soo good. I'm not a fan of homefries but I Finished everything else all by myself haha.  My friends ordered pancakes, scrambled eggs, homefries and loved their food as well! Plus can't complain about the unlimited coffee.   Portions are big, service is good, and food is yumm. If i were in pittsburgh again, I'd def go back!

znk9UaebJ_5jRY3Qwx2ekw.text: Stopped in for a late breakfast--midweek.  There were plenty of seats so the wait was not an issue. Service was prompt and friendly.  Quite frankly the food was average.  I would go to Pamela's before here anytime.

15qbQN1-JZbJ0Mic6BZfHg.text: Well done diner food.  Deluca's is pretty good for a greasy spoon.  The line moves surprisingly fast outside, so don't be daunted by a wait.  And once inside, staff is quick and friendly.  We had breakfast: traditional eggs, biscuits, meats, potatoes - all were very good.   The breakfast burritos are pretty big, too; best to share.  All the breakfast meats (sausages, bacon, and chiorzo) were fresh and flavorful.

LPEOgUrsRpNGsy4zuNDNrA.text: Tasks place is awesome. Though to be honest I don't think it's the best in Pittsburgh as it prides itself on; Pamela's diner, which is right around the corner to De Luca's, holds that title in my opinion. Still, I highly recommend this to anyone looking for an awesome breakfast place, right after Pamela's that is.

-VG0jFHCk0Asg059xQ7fYg.text: Both my mate and myself had a breakfast burrito on Game Day one Sunday.  We had to walk off the breakfast so we walked back to the centre of town. Even after that we walked some more and I can tell you we still felt full come game time. Definitely going back there again.

TxhHc5Eplv3uZumK_FtQrg.text: My favorite breakfast location in Pittsburgh. Very friendly staff. The breakfast special which is served until 9 am is a great deal.

qwknFgbvGxMUq3t3LaoVyQ.text: We have been going to strip for grocery shopping and notice that there was a line in front of it. We finally tried it today. Yeah, it is a greasy spoon. I don't know if it's very cheap but it's definitely a huge portion. I had a strawberry crepe and my husband had a huevos rancheros. We just moved from Phx to here and we had a better huevos rancheros that is not made out of the can. mine is better but it is very much a diner food.

N9tYw9vBNX9U4knJ5sY0GQ.text: We were walking to another restaurant for breakfast on Saturday morning when we happened upon this place and the large line out front.  It's located in the heart of the Strip District, so there was a ton going on the day we ate here. The food is very good and the portions are huge. I'd recommend going early to avoid the long waits. And note that they only accept cash, no credit cards.

yFxIx2csqXq58vcA6ahxlA.text: Pancakes topped with ice cream, fruit and whipped cream for breakfast?? Hell yes!!! Sounds more like dessert, but every bit delicious on an empty stomach on a Saturday morning. My fiance brought me here one day during the summer when I went with him to PGH to visit his family. We heard about the rave reviews on Man vs. Food so we decided we had to hit up all of Adam Richman's picks in PGH during our trip. We waited in line in the warm sun for about 20-30 minutes to be seated, but it was well worth it! My fiance had the mixed grill - loaded with grilled veggies, potatoes, and spicy sausage. We kept switching plates back and forth because we just couldnt decide who got the best meal. Both the pancakes and the mixed grill were HUGE! We could barely finish both. Inexpensive and good service. We'll defintely be back when we visit PGH again!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best pancakes I&#39;ve ever had!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Mixed Grill with a side of bacon - could barely finish this!

6MmyG_GbEfYGuMzV1EX8lQ.text: So overrated and pretty lousy food. Greasy spoon at its best. Better choices very close.

m_z52FxH-XvB-juqUvUGPw.text: Been here every Sunday for years. Taken every one of my friends and family here and I've never had a complaint. Service and food are unbeatable! Every aspect of their menu is just what you want it too be. The lighter fare is very petite and refreshing. The heavy stick to your bones meals are amazing on a cold rainy day. Lastly, the breakfast pancakes and omelets are without a doubt the most amazing things I've ever eaten!

wk9-e7cUhVws-t4J4gQwMA.text: To best explain this joint, it is one of the best places to grub out in Pittsburgh.  How can you not expect to eat to your heart's content when someone tells you that their pancakes come with ice cream and whipped cream, and look more like something out of Willy Wonka's factory then a griddle.  Everything on the menu reads simply: pancakes, burritos, waffles, shakes, etc.  Not too much flash, but the ensemble of food layered on top of food that is finally delivered to your table will knock out whatever hunger you brought in.  Depending on when you come, you are going to have to wait, but it is definitely worth it.  Try not to fumble around with menu once you get seated, best is the look at it in line, decide, and prepare.  Prepare mentally and physically for this meal.  Everything on the menu is good.  Trust me you will not leave without feeling like that was the best breakfast ever.  And please do try to tackle something interesting on the menu.

XUMJSJKxL3DJgnCfHgGyWA.text: Don't really get the hype about this place.  PROS: huge portions  CONS: bad service (the waitress didn't get my order right, and ignored us for almost the entire meal), hard and uncomfortable benches, small (we were seated right next to the door, and cold air was blowing in the entire time we were eating), food just wasn't that good. Breakfast burrito was OK. Mixed grilled was bland.

VhVW8olUKn1GVkXL8s8eqg.text: The crepes and the omelette are simply delicious. I tried the newyorker omelette and pecan banana crepe and they both are awesome. Large portion size and extremely satisfying. The service is very prompt and the place is buzzing!!!!!!. Coffee is a little below par, but the bread from local bakery is very fresh. The reason I docked one point was for the wait time and they only accept cash.

iUQVlXoUSg4O7JEsZeTpkA.text: Awesome food.   I mean....awesome.   I would totally give this place five stars, but ... a.) I had to wait in line outside in the freezing cold for an hour to even get a table.  b.) the service was pretty terrible  I would normally take off two stars for that, but the food was THAT good.   I ordered the Huevos Rancheros and Lobster Bisque Soup. mmmm.

f7wc5q26SleqIWAuBgzQpw.text: I give 5 stars sparingly and Deluca's is completely deserving. We waited outside in the sweltering heat, during prime brunch time, for almost 30 minutes but knew it was worth the wait. There is nothing fancy or classy about this place which is actually quite endearing. The menu? Basically anything you can imagine for brunch. Really happy we got to visit this Pittsburgh staple after almost a year of living here. Portions are insanely big but we love leftovers so it wasn't an issue.

uF8FkiKxrLahUFSTFGBXgg.text: Contrary to Kenneth h.'s review, I would say there is great coffee. There is no expresso machine but its a cheaper dive place. I will say I've had cheaper breakfast in Bloomfield. But this place is worth the wait in line.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

FYsXtjoC1BL43ULPcMT7XA.text: Great local Pittsburghesque Diner.  I had delicious pumpkin pancakes with eggs and "kielbasy".  Very good, the kielbasy was not like any I had before, I suppose all kielbasa has it's own local flavor.  Interesting people watching, from the locals, tourists, tattooed staff and Pittsburgh's finest.   Everything is cooked behind a low counter - you can see all the activity - looks crazy back there.  The booths are not very comfortable, straight backed and Formica topped (adds to the charm?)  There is a strange mural on the wall, Greek mythology themed with Pan and others, labeled as a prop from the movie "Passed Away".  Really enjoyed it, would go back and recommend to others.  Fun and funky area to shop too.

18AElM5J8q-d9D7VQbJQpg.text: Always worth the wait! Be warned though--the line gets out the door easily and can get quite long! Food is amazing and breakfast options are phenomenal. I've never had a bad meal here and could always justify traveling down from Shadyside/Oakland to eat here. Just remember that Strip location is cash only!

EgEn2gSAaABhQm6eDvcDTw.text: Huge line and not worth the wait. If you want a greasy breakfast than this is your place... I wasn't impressed.

-pk-8rVfQQK70nKZk8BIkA.text: When I think of Big Manly Breakfasts ... the kind that John Wayne, Jimmy Hoffa, and Batman would all eat I think of the King of all Pittsburgh Greasy Spoons, Deluca's.  Don't trick yourself into thinking you are getting anything beyond the best greasy spoon breakfast you've ever had.  Your waitress may be rude and there may be odd sticky substances on your table.  Don't like it?  Fuck you, that is ambiance here!  The place is, almost always, packed to the rafters (especially at breakfast time).  You will wait for a table.  The wait staff is typically old and cantankerous.  You will hear the query "whatta ya want, honey".  But the food is plentiful and out of this world.  Where else can you score a pepperoni omelette at any time of the day?  Pour some ketchup on that bad boy, order up a coke and I'm in heaven!

8RcWoujadV0Q2TFoJxuwow.text: The pancakes were amazing! I had a blueberry pancake and bacon and my husband had the French toast combo. Everything was amazing!

OCMhhfQer61-moAQ8swSWQ.text: Saw the delicious looking food at Deluca's on Man vs. Food and stopped by when I was in Pittsburgh.  Although I had to wait about 20 minutes to get a seat, it was well worth the wait. Everything on the menu and other people's plates looked absolutely amazing, so it was hard to choose what to order.   I ended up selecting the Reese's Cup, which is one of their many Hot Cake Sundaes. The Reese's Cup was two very large hotcakes with peanut butter chocolate chips cooked inside. It also had chocolate ice cream, chocolate syrup, caramel topping, honey roasted pecans, and whipped cream on top.   Although I didn't really feel like I was eating breakfast, I didn't really care because it was so good.   Deluca's is delicious, unique, and has a ton of variety on the menu.  Can't wait to go back!

5oj5N0bybbH-Z27h4gzGjg.text: Nothing fancy here. Looks like a tiny, run-down kitchen, but the long line of people waiting outside in the cold weather sort of makes you curious.  This breakfast joint serves delicious pancakes & the incredibly attentive waitstaff (despite the chaotic morning hours) kept re-filling my coffee mug without even having to be asked. They serve big portions and it is definitely not the place to go if you are diet-conscious. Otherwise, go here if you want a hearty yet inexpensive breakfast. This is not your regular IHOP.

9l3RZAmWwe8gK_Ya498ZCg.text: Been there several times and I keep going back. They have a great selection of breakfast entrees and they are all good. Wait in the line that extends outside it is well worth it.

SuQr6dc9k08ldKPJ6OEjbw.text: I really don't get the hype. Jojo's is way better, as is Pamela's.

x87lqdRpWai1JiYTkIVCiQ.text: A Pittsburgh institution.  I recently went on Steeler Sunday around 10am -- the wait was less than 5 minutes and the service still adequate (constant coffee refills).  The sausage is delicious.  Try it on a fried egg sandwich but be prepared to take some to go.  It's dirty, greasy, and packed full of Pittsburgh nostalgia just like a greasy spoon should be!  (FYI - cash only)

Ty9tnyWcsB3qVq8z-eQDpg.text: Best Breakfast in the 'burgh! Quick service even with a wait.

HRac3jKzI7SNrmHFNPz5zA.text: I always enjoy my visits to pittsburgh. I was especially excited to visit after finding out there was a great place for breakfast that was on the travel network (man vs. food). I am a True food lover and Food Network and Travel Channel must really love pittsburgh. They are always on man vs food and diners, drive ins and dives.  I found out the hard way that just because you are showcased on a dandy show doesn't mean your food is up to par.  Just to make it very clear I am a southerner. I did however go to delucas with my girlfriend who was born and raised in pittsburgh and surrounding suburbs. So I was able to look past the brash attitude of the person at the register yelling at my girlfriend instead of seating us. She however was pretty turned off by it.  There wasn't a wait. We got seated pretty quickly after my girlfriend had to let the lady know we were there well before the ambush of people that poured in after we arrived. (that's when my girlfriend got yelled at)  After being seated I was really excited about the food. The place was hoppin and the coffee was really good. The menu had a huge list of things to choose from. I thought it was going to be a great place. I had really high hopes. The server we had was ok. Not very friendly but efficient. She was the shorter of the two I saw. We kind of wished we had the tall girl. She seemed a lot more friendly.  We didn't wait too long to get our food but when we got it you would have thought it would have taken a couple hours. I got the biscuits and gravy (one of my favorite breakfast foods) and potatoes. They were both stone cold. The gravy on the biscuits was more like a soup and the potatoes were well cold. I really couldn't get passed the fact that my food was cold.  My girlfriend got the california omelette with potatos and fruit with the Italian toast. She like the fruit and toast but that was it. I almost choked on my sausage gravy when I saw her omelette. It was practically black. I know sometimes people over cook eggs. It's not cool but it happens. How do you even send eggs out that are practically black. I guess at least it was hot. Her potatoes needless to say were also cold. I was really looking forward to eating at a delicious breakfast place in pittsburgh. I was disappointed.

aIrMIiLZmY5iWVexRX10mA.text: Clog your arteries here! Line outside was to the business next door, but it only took us 20 minutes to get seated. Don't let that scare you away.  If it's a weekend, plenty of good people watching as they make their way around the vendors on the strip.  Place seems like it is always crammed (and that probably is in part due to all the tv coverage in recent year's). Omelets can't be beat, and the mixed grills are good as well (and totally customizable to your likes). Still cash only!   Huge menu full of choices, so if breakfast isn't your thing, you have options...and if unhealthy breakfast isn't your thing, they even have cereal and oatmeal.  Closes early (3PM).

vE3z_CJ5gx2ADB6gidoxlw.text: Greasy spoon is defined by a trip to Deluca's After several visits i realized I needed to be hungover to enjoy it. Sorry, but the P&G diner around the corner puts it to shame.

uiomsGbZaqSsTheCuncd_g.text: Pamela's gets way too much credit in this town.  Deluca's, located in the heart of the strip district, is a daytime only diner with no frills, just the freshest, most delicious breakfast you can get in the city.  It's on my list of places I miss in Pittsburgh.

0Rur2SLN8pK6QQ7ubSAd_g.text: Totally over-hyped diner food. I like greasy breakfasts, but this stuff wasn't even flavorful. Their eggs benny with cheese was salty and soggy, their pancakes and french toast meh. That people wait in line for this stuff amazes me.

KrmFPFDQKnLoju3sc4SiwA.text: Highly over-rated.  The service wasn't great.  Saw a waitress drop a knife on the floor and she picked it up and wiped it on her apron.  A waiter wiped the milkshake mixer (the part that goes into the stuff you drink) with a dirty rag.  Food was also a disappointment.  The lobster bisque (which was their special) tasted like flour.  And our funky monkey pancakes had grilled onions in them.  Giving them 2 stars, only because the hostess and our waitress was friendly.

yIT8J0tFRsTZSh3cEeZEuA.text: The breakfast burrito and Belgian waffle sundae were great.  The service was quick and the coffee was tasty and plentiful.  My only regret is that I didn't eat more.  If you get a chance it's worth a shot, the menu is very diverse.

zmXW_J670MVHesb7PN-DGQ.text: De Luca's is The Strip District breakfast place. I refuse to go anywhere else. Half the time, you'll be lined up outside the door, but it's heavenly.

QS4hsAX7ju-R33dOTuYsVA.text: OK maybe I was overly optimistic about the hype of this place, but it wasn't that great.  There was a block long line outside on a Sunday morning to get a table for breakfast.  They were definitely efficient and had great service.  A lot of the breakfast menu items looked like they belonged on a dessert or ice cream parlor menu, rather than a diner. I had huevos rancheros.  The crumbled chorizo was salty enough to choke a horse and there was a lot of it, I wouldn't recommend it.  Another person with us had the breakfast burrito, which he said was overly filled with mismatched odds and ends.  He took the half he couldn't eat there and finished it later.  Our other companion had something else in a burrito and took half of that home also. In my opinion Deluca's needs to focus more on quality and less on quantity.  Maybe the pancakes and waffles are better, but we didn't have them.

Y-HBbM5bJHqJTlGpoMqNHA.text: I always made fun of all the people standing in line on the weekend mornings waiting to have breakfast at DeLuca's that was until I found myself waiting in that same line. I happened to be in Pittsburgh for the weekend visiting friends when it was suggested to try the place out. There had to be 30 or so people in line waiting to get into the place on a Saturday morning. It probably took 30 to 45 minutes to get to the front but the plus side is there is a coffee shop a few doors down to get something warm to drink. When we finally got it we were seated at the counter which was a fine place to sit considering you can watch all the cooks running around like crazy turning out food by the minute. There are lots of things that look good but I settled on an omelet with a bunch of vegetables and covered in three kinds of cheese that was downright awesome. My friend also had some combination of eggs and veggies which he proceeded to polish off something I could not do. We were also witness to a few people tackling the pancakes with the sundae on top. Good luck with that on early morning. I am not sure it is the best breakfast in town but it is certainly worth the wait especially if it's not too cold outside. I will be back.

LDdFIZBYa6Keo9NJVc_bMA.text: For breakfast, I had a cheese omellete with toast here, and it tasted delicious.

OKQS5DRolqlUO1dDHmUiGQ.text: I am committed to my all or nothing reviews so unfortunately Deluca's gets the short end of the stick because if they were in a different neighborhood they may have gotten 5 stars, but not in the strip.  I liked Deluca's food and selection, but their booths are the most uncomfortable seating I have had in years.  Deluca's is one block away from Pamela's in the strip.  Comparing the two: Pamela's food is better, their prices are lower and the seating is much more comfortable, Deluca's menu is larger, both have long waits on weekends.  If you are in the strip, there is no reason to go to Deluca's, go to Pamela's.

DC_0983xGtDF9GUWIdcqVA.text: A great breakfast place!  The place can use a make over, but I thought it was charming and you went back in time with the red and white checkered floors, and what looked liked original counter and green worn leather stools.  The staff was nice and friendly too.  I stayed at the Westin Hotel and it was about a 10 block walk (1 mile).  My husband and I shared the Steeler breakfast plate and it was one of the best breakfests we had.  It was a good thing we shared bc it came with 2 toasts, 2 (8") pancakes, 1 (5") sweet sausage, 2 slices bacon, home fries, 2 eggs.  Every item was cooked perfect and the pancakes were the best I had at a restaurant, a bit crispy and fluffy inside.   Too bad we were so full and couldn't finish the pancakes and toast.  Everything else we finished with a smile.  The portions are large.  We had 2 cups of very good coffee and the Steeler special and our bill was $12.  A bargain for all we had.    If I ever come back to Pittsburgh, I would go there again and try more of the resturants on the Strip District.

-85fOBhhMBXFZyw9ktWSew.text: No Stiller's tickets this past Sunday so waited till near game time to visit.  Shortest line I have ever seen.  Food and atmosphere are pure Pittsburgh.   Our group had Steel City breakfast, waffles, pancakes, and french toast.  Huge portions and delicious on top of that.  The "Baltimore Blows" shirts worn by many wait staff were perfect.

dy8TVHBO7b5YvrNaGAF9IA.text: classic pittsburgh, i think. amazing crepes and fresh squeezed oj. crazy busy, so that's a good sign!

AbhUVIb4diLHvB78Wt8dNA.text: came here after seeing Man v Food, and it was definitely a great place.  good hometown atmosphere with quality food. the 30 minute wait in the cold was worth it.

uI_5gd1zuKZSe9IpMMfwCg.text: Stopped here on a Saturday for breakfast while spending a weekend in Pittsburgh based on the Yelp reviews. A great place to get a classic American breakfast. I got bacon and eggs, my wife got a veggie omelet, and the kids got chocolate chip pancakes, everyone enjoyed their food. Service was bit slow but I expected that given how packed the place was. I would certainly go their again and recommend it. Take note that it is a cash only restaurant.

zi9yVswwN4OKsZmAtv4zvQ.text: How have I  never been here before, considering that I am a black and gold city yinzer?  Well, this oversight was revised this morning.  I got here about 10 am this morning and totally expected a long line.  We only had to wait about 5 minutes and got a great booth in the back.  If you're in a rush sit at the counter.  Service was friendly, quick and professional.  Place was packed with all types, classes and colors.  Everyone from family's after church to folks like me with disheveled hair wearing the same clothes from  the long night prior.  This offers a True snapshot of the folks of my fine city.  I ordered the corned beef hash and poached eggs with a side of sweet sausage and toast.  The corned beef hash was great charred perfectly and tons of flavor.  The eggs were about average and the sweet sausage was amazing.  They offer a ton of breakfast meat options, everything from chorizo to amish ham and sweet sausage.  My breakfast was a little above average, however my friend made a much better choice.  She ordered the breakfast sandwich, which was great.  It was served on fresh italian bread with mounds of cheese and crispy bacon.  I like Pamelas for pancakes, but for just True good diner breakfast food this is my new favorite.

l3xGgbLEBISNKPdTVepV1Q.text: My favorite breakfast dish would be anything with poached eggs and some kind of sauce on it. I continue to visit Delucas because they have been able to perfectly poach every single egg I've ever had there. EVERY. SINGLE. EGG. They are seriously never overdone and are perfect. PERFECT.   I've only had eggs Benedict type breakfast plates and shakes there, but I've been with others who have tried different options. Everything else was described as "good, typical breakfast food."  Sometimes there is a wait (especially on weekends), but service is usually pretty quick and generally pretty good. They aren't the nicest or friendliest servers. They're not rude, and they are good at their jobs. They typically won't sit at your table and chat, but they are quick and usually don't mess anything up.   If you like a lot of different options for breakfast food, Delucas is the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seafood Benedict and California Benedict with a Oreos and Cream shake :) so good
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Perfectly cooked poached eggs in the seafood Benedict

6Kt2nYdPhqKJMREfNDBL8w.text: We went during brunch hours on a Saturday so there was a bit of a line but the street was vibrant and we got to people watch. Once we got in, the service was prompt and friendly, and sooooooo good!  This was my first trip to Pittsburgh and this restaurant is a must!! I had the Nutella French Toast w/ bacon and eggs. Delish!! The others in my party loved their food too! I even had the lid of the ketchup bottle fly off and get everywhere (whoops!) and the nice dude brought me a wet towel to wipe off with (THANK YOU!). This place is awesome and I really want everyone to know!! SUPER IMPORTANT: CASH ONLY!! (ATM is right outside if you need one )

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Don&#39;t forget about Feral Cats! Waiting on our delicious food!

y_MmGIu5R55YBL2GGa1IdA.text: This place is one of the Pittsburgh classic breakfast spots, located in the strip district area, there are often lines out the door on the weekends, much of the hype on this place inevitably leads to this, so unless your up early and out and about, expect to wait if you have a group of people. Also, it should be noted, it's kinda touristsy , by that I mean actual tourists, and weekend tourists in from the suburban cultural wastelands for a authentic Pittsburgh breakfast, like their parents ate, or some such nonsense, so that also means it's pricey for the straight off the Sysco truck food that it is.  I'm giving this place 5 stars based solely on the absolute ticket slayers that are on open display on the short order line set up they have there, these men are a joy to watch, and the speed at which they got the orders out was honestly pretty impressive, hats off to these cooks!   Total bad asses!!!! That, and the waitress was really nice too!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Biscuits and gravy !!!!!

C3MvvtDTps_K5ISIhnTbpQ.text: Great dinner and excellent food quality.  Went at 12 and had zero wait.  Staff was friendly and moved quickly.  Quick, delicious and large.  Value for the dollar was great. Remember to bring cash, no credit cards.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken and waffle.  Chicken tasted juicy and not over cooked.  Waffle could have cook a tad longer for crispness.
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheesesteak with Cajun fries.  Excellent Mancini bread

NfjOp6rT6N5_2sbfl9cVTg.text: Came here and there was a line out the door. No biggie, we figured we'd have to wait. We weren't sure how it worked though - if you had to go in and or your name down or whatever - but the people in line ahead of us said you just wait in line until you get to the counter to be seated.  It turns out that there were only groups of 4 ahead of us (I was a party of 2) so the people said we could probably go in and grab the 2 empty seats at the counter..score! So we went In and asked a waitress if we could just sit at the counter and she said we had to wait our turn in line. We explained that there was no one waiting to sit at he counter but apparently it didn't matter.  So we waited another 15 mins to sit at a booth and then soon after we sat, a group that was literally right behind us sat at the counter. So that was annoying. Not sure why they wouldn't have a system to write your name down. The workers seemed annoyed that customers coming in kept asking if they need to just wait or put their name in.  The food was a generous portion, enough for a second breakfast! But after I left, I smelled SOOOO greasy all day. I couldn't get home to shower. So be prepared to smell like grease as soon as you walk in.

Vmiei5LGqGTjYQw39hhTgQ.text: You can overlook a lot of things when the food is good however the food was terrible. Our waiter was under the influence of something  and high. The place is kind of dirty. They have a box fan hanging from the ceiling as a "ceiling fan". We are from our of town and travel often (on average 12days a month) and use Yelp as a guide to great food. Unfortunately this is not it. Oh and there was a 30-45 min line outside that we waited in just to have terrible service and mediocre at best food.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kraft singles as cheese???

XEFVWj2ehIFAmNpi8k6R4A.text: Deluca's is as good as it gets when it comes to diners.  The menu is classic diner-style, but what you get is far above average.    Tuesday morning is a great time to head over.  There was a short wait but we were in and out in an hour.  The service is super fast and it seems like the food comes out even faster.  So delicious!  I got the seafood lover's omelette.  It's a really light option with lobster, shrimp, crab, red peppers and cheese.  I really liked the number of eggs that were used and they were truly cooked perfectly.  These cooks know what they're doing.  My boyfriend got a bacon egg and cheese sandwich.  It's served on Mancini's bread...also notably delicious!  With Deluca's there's everything to love.

GWw3bOb-narRzET6EO0sHw.text: It's True what everyone says. The breakfast here is first rate and fun. Our server treated us like old friends and regulars (it was our first visit) and the biscuits and gravy was about as good as it gets.

NJ90-mjE6lD7-v6DGJNBjw.text: Went here based on recommendations from coworkers.  This area was pretty cool (strip district).  Alot of tourists though I have to say, granted we were there on a weekend.  The line was out the door for this place and smelled so good!  We decided to wait, and glad we did.  I ordered the mixed grill with sausage and my husband ordered some omelette (the one with chicken and spinach and some kind of cheese).  Both dishes were great!  I wish I had tried a pancake but I was trying to be healthy.  Oh well.  For healthy food, our dishes sure were satisfying and didn't taste all that healthy :)

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mixed grill with sausage
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Omelette

A5sLjqAlXiFyXwqtx5RlBQ.text: This is a classic diner: a little dingy, the service was kind of rushed, and the food is alright. The prices are decent for what you get. I'm not sure we'd come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. hash sandwich was alright. The banana slip crepe batter was WAY too too thick to be a crepe. It was more of a pancake. It wasn&#39;t good.

XelHA2qu9YiDF0lBnqqslQ.text: There's always a line for this place, no matter what day of the week. I came here on a Friday morning for brunch, and there was a good 15-minute wait before we were seated. I must say they did a great job with getting people in and out pretty quickly. The menu was a bit messy though. They tried to make it look more fun, but I thought it was just confusing.   After orienting myself to the menu, I decided to settle for the Californian omelet with chipotle pesto chicken, asiago cheese, spinach and avocado. The omelet came with two slices of toast. The omelet was just ok. I didn't think it was anything special. They were pretty stingy on the avocado. There wasn't enough sauce and the chicken was dried. Honestly, I didn't think the omelet was worth $12. The side of homemade fries was super plain. The Lyonnais potato at Pamela's is so much more flavorful. My dinning companion ordered the apple cinnamon bun pancake sundae. It looked delicious when it came out with a huge scoop of ice cream on top. The ice cream melted fast and left a giant puddle on the pancakes. The pancakes were delicious, but the sogginess from the melted ice cream really ruined it. It was good the first few bites, but not something I can finish.   Overall, I had a good dinning experience at Deluca's, but I did not think this place is worth all the hype. Though, I'm willing to come back and try something else on the menu, hoping maybe I ordered all the wrong stuff the first time.

vq0z3qP-bpIHaBx4bPJ0tw.text: I was in town for a wedding and did not get a chance to check out the food scene too much.  I did take the time to check out 2 restaurants that were on the Travel Channel.  This place was one of the 2 that I saw.  Food was great and so was the service.  I guess my only complaint would be the tight quarters.  I will definitely be back for their amazing breakfast!

R_FJvERWxjtUKzVhhHMiKQ.text: Always a fav standby - esp when I want breakfast for lunch. Pittsburgh and Strip institution; the food is always good and the service among the friendliest in town. Send your visitors here for a real Pittsburgh experience.

tMgkUkCKcXSJj6xKWDkNvw.text: DeLuca's is an excessive diner breakfast at its best.  Gigantic omelettes with homemade bulk hot Italian sausage in the perfect wrapping of Yinzer kitsch (seriously, go here on the morning before a Steelers game.  Or at any point during football season.)  I lived here for 5 years, haven't been back for 5, and this is the place I've been craving.  Do yourself a favor, eat here, and don't worry about planning lunch afterwards.

bTrrB1eSUfslal9IlbubMw.text: Visiting Pittsburgh and came across this gem. Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day and I am hard to plead. But this was the best breakfast that I have ever had. Whenever I come in town for a game, I will enjoy breakfast here.

Zz2FT4S_Xh7naVkLjeGPgA.text: Wow!  I was impressed.  It was so much fun to have breakfast in this place.  Everything here is home made.  Staffs were friendly, excellent coffee, big pancakes, papas were good too.  We were just excited to find this place in Pittsburg.  Very busy on Monday morning.  I could imagine this place must be crazy during weekends!  It was recommended by a very nice gentleman who manages a parking lot right by the restaurant.  Check out the photos I am posting!  Yes definitely will come back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kitchen staffs were very friendly!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outside
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Big portion!

63KSTSKHgR3XKXKyPUi5BQ.text: Been here twice in the last two months. Their california eggs benedict with chicken is amazing and comes with a large helping of home fries on the side. My friend got the regular french toast once and liked that. Their freshly squeezed OJ is also on point.  The ambience is stereotypically diner but it is endearing. The food came out quickly and the servers are attentive. Definitely a better alternative to Pamela's without being more expensive.

Oob_C1TrHaK7IdBZGDy38w.text: DON'T BELIEVE THE OTHER REVIEWS OR HYPE!!! Came here while on a trip, and waited in line for about an hour. Finally, got seated in a dirty little booth near the back, where I had a constant view of a ridiculous ceiling fan (a box fan hanging from the ceiling). I'll tolerate a hole in the wall for good food, but this didn't even come close to delivering. The food was simply not good. I ordered a breakfast burrito that was looked as bad as it tasted, including the kraft singles artistically placed on top.   Our service was nothing short of bizarre, I suspect drugs and I'm not kidding. The order came out wrong and the interaction was manic.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

z1TDuLmnYrhKKkHXTRq3Pw.text: First time here and I loved it! I left planning my next visit. The wait seemed long, but it only took about 20 minutes. Don't come here to dine and catch up with friends because the food comes out very quickly and they are constantly having people in and out. I expected that and that was exactly what I wanted. I think I was there for 20 to 30 minutes.  I expect that everything there is amazing and can't wait to try french toast.   Definitely go here if you are looking for GOOD, cheap food and quick service!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs benedict and warm apple pancake sundae!

2CYK2QBX8OP6T8aD09ChSQ.text: Great place for local flavor! This is a wonderful place if you are looking for a great taste of Pittsburgh. You will stand in line to get a table but it is well worth the wait.   Don't miss the chicken and waffles!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mhluL2aDxYkI7HljWzZWRw.text: Huge portions. That's the first thing that comes to my mind. They have a huge variety of food as well which is great for someone who's not that big into standard breakfast fare. The quality and taste of the food is not as good as it should be for the amount of time you will spend standing in line waiting for a table on a Saturday or Sunday at breakfast/brunch time. It's cool to watch the line cooks make your food, but it's almost stressful to watch the servers and cooks running around, yelling orders, and wiping sweat off their brows. Don't sit at the bar during a breakfast rush if you expect to have a relaxing meal.

yOW0P--TdrCn_VdV-9fQxA.text: Yes, Deluca's is very good .  Yes, they make a great breakfast.  However, is it worth waiting in line forever on Sunday morning? No.  Deluca's is an iconic place that people seem to swarm to and I appreciate that but I go early in the AM and enjoy their food without the really crazy waits others seem to love to endure.  Weightlifter breakfast is really tastey.

WyLoq1nDX7gn5IlvvfM6xA.text: Older diner in the Strip District. Pretty busy on Sunday (game day), prepare to wait a while. Food was good, service was good. I had Steel City Breakfast of Champs, plenty of food for most. Bacon had a great smokey flavor to it! Try the fried chicken with the breakfast.

phw4te9wpvLXYcyeG-Titg.text: We had 15 people in our party as we ended our stay in Pittsburgh for our family wedding. It took us two hours to get everyone together in the hotel lobby just to get ready to leave for this family style restaurant...and it was going on lunchtime, but this place served breakfast all day long. And WHAT a breakfast it was. Some  In our group had lunch, but most, breakfast. Huge menu selection. My western style omelet was hot, full of veggies and ham, side of real home fries grilled and crispy!  The 12 inch plate was filled!  Cheese dripping off the side!
