The waitress was not flustered at our large group and accommodated our party with a professional flair. All the food was hot and served us almost all at the same time!  Couldn't finish.  Wanted to. Delish!!! Recommend highly. Great food,flavor, service!  Small but adequate booths on the side... Tables down the middle, of which we commandeered three for our party.

IIVD9HzgzXI6sS5X4kvG5A.text: My last meal in Pittsburgh was at this place. It had a lot of reviews and some locals had told me just how great it was. I had actually gone on Sunday but saw the line was out the door so ended up going somewhere else. On a Monday at 11 am I didn't think it be so bad. My friends and I were seated quickly. There was a lot of options, I couldn't decide between the pancakes or the breakfast of champions. Went with the breakfast of champions and couldn't believe how much food it was. I imagined a short stack of pancakes would be small. It was two huge pancakes that I barely finished it. As I write this it is still my only meal of the day, still full haha. My friends loved the place and I'm so glad I saved the best for last. Please come to this place if you visit Pittsburgh or if you live in Pitt and have never visited. Oh and I think its cash only but not too sure. If you are a fan of pancakes as much as I am then this won't matter at all :)

wkCxheJVB8fPfUBSwt3pgA.text: This place is beyond incredible. The environment, the coffee, the service, the pancakes, the amazing breakfast potatoes with bits of semi-burnt crispiness.  Go. Now.

0-pmdVOjHcHhzNFyIs1J4Q.text: Our breakfast choices sounded better than they actually tasted and our drinks had a weird odor. All in all, when it comes to breakfast in Pittsburgh, I'm still on the Pamela's side of the fence.

S0mnbQBLwiWpT1KFlUTefg.text: I had brunch there, I went for the ham steak! It was okay, nothing special. I guess the characteristic of the place is huge plates, which is not really my type, but if some one wants to pay 13$ and eat like 3 people's breakfast, this place is a good one!   One thing I don't like was I asked for substitute for my home fries to fruit cup, but they brought me both and charge me for both! The lady was so nice, so I did not say anything! We were +5 so we were able to reserve the place, otherwise there is a long long long line for it!

aGVeHKmZWYLYKe31B07dZg.text: Came here with a group of 6, plus a toddler, midmorning on a Thursday. No wait! The service was EXCELLENT. Quick, friendly, efficient. They anticipated our every need. The inside was larger than you would think as mentioned in several reviews here. Overall I had a great experience. We had probably every breakfast item you could think of at our table (crepes, french toast, pancakes, danish pancakes, eggs, mixed grill, sides of meat) as we went a little crazy with our order, but in particular, I ordered the nutella banana crepe and it was DELICIOUS. It had a whole banana inside! While that was definitely a decadent dish, my fiance ordered the mixed grill which was very healthy and fresh tasting. I would go back!

udiYHcv5ZBEoACBxe5EkGQ.text: Best advice for de'lucas is to get there early if you want a weekend breakfast.  We got there at 8am on a Saturday and waited for about 5 minutes.  We did some shopping on the strip and we we passed again at 10 there was a huge line waiting to get in.  Our food was fresh and delicious.   All the toast and French toast is made from fresh Mancini bread.  Pancakes were awesome too.  Service is fast and friendly for how busy they are.  Get here early and make a nice little morning out of it like we did.

lO4iZl1MwR5NAXQgo_8GWw.text: Get here early or wait in line, especially on early Steeler's game days.  9 am and the line was already out the door on a Sunday, but the line moved fast.  This isn't the first time I've been here, and will definitely not be the last.    Today I had cinnamon bun pancakes and a side of sweet sausage.  Both were absolutely perfect.  My husband got his usual - the breakfast buritto.  Delicious as always!    I've never been disappointed by DeLuca's - the service is always friendly and very fast.  It amazes me how efficient they are to crank out breakfast and turnover tables as fast as they do.  They are a machine.  They are amazing.     Cash only, but there are ATMs all over Penn Ave.    They say they are the best breakfast in town, and I can't say I disagree.

WvQrQBADwGh4gU6mhduAPQ.text: Great gem of Pittsburgh.  Half the reason we went was from reading other Yelp reviews so Kudos to all of you! Went for breakfast and got the breakfast burrito.  Let's just say that was the breakfast AND lunch burrito.  The portions were huge but great flavor combinations.  Would love to go back and try some more traditional options because everything that was walking by me looked delish!! Go hungry

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. MOAB burritos!!

9GNUIb2i8x7WugYg8G94sg.text: It's ok. I went on a week day at the end of breakfast, so it wasn't too busy. Still, service was scattered and the kitchen slow.   I had a veggie breakfast burrito, the man had a more traditional breakfast. The burrito was .  . . edible. It was enormous, big enough to feed me for a day and still have leftovers. Inside a soggy tortilla I had mounds of scrambled eggs and about 2 pounds of vegetables - onions, peppers, avocado, tomato, hashbrowns, and then some. Most of the vegetables tasted very, very steamed, and then doused in grease. There wasn't much taste to them at all, and I love my vegetables. It makes me sad someone discovered a way to make them taste so uninteresting. On top of the whole affair was their spanish sauce (tomato paste?) and an unmelted square of orange cheese-like product. All in all, it didn't taste bad, but that's not high praise for restaurant food.  His breakfast was easily as big, and looked much better than mine tasted. The waitress got the order close, but not quite right, and he didn't have the interest to send it back. It was good, but too greasy for him to eat very much of it.  If it were cheaper I would say it was a good value. As it stands, I would go if someone really wanted to go there, but if its left to me there are many other places I'd go for breakfast first.

CQi6HI6vZGcygBhOScJIzA.text: Love the waffle sundae and anything with the seafood filling. Hands down my fav brunch spot in the burgh!

pxPghWuS1kE6KDLTb6OEbw.text: As other reviews state, there is a long wait. We waited for about 40 min.  The hubby got the famous breakfast burrito. He said it was good, but it was definitely missing something. Also, the flavor profile was only "chorizo." we have had better.  I got the huevos rancheros. Good, but also lacking something.  We split a pumpkin pancake, and a cinnamon bun pancake. The pumpkin was great, but the cinnamon bun was still completely raw in the middle, like, oozing batter, which was gross.  Good overall, not great. We have had better.  Gonna try pamelas next...

GnJnbuPHCfm-SHgAS9-rcw.text: Even though the wait is outrageous, the food is delicious and definitely worth it! We sat at the counter to have a shorter wait which we didn't mind. We had the mixed grill, strawberry sundae pancakes and the breakfast burrito. The portions were all huge and very unique. We highly recommend it!

OruKFpwAzasot2BUqjjsJA.text: This is an easy five stars for an Pittsburgh institution that's kept itself relevant.  Service is great. Servers are super friendly and come by at the perfect frequency for coffee refills, etc.  Food is excellent. The menu is very prolific, pretty much every diner breakfast option you can imagine plus burritos, etc. There's a lot of veg on this menu and a lot of avocado which makes me very happy, indeed.  Prices are reasonable. Expect to pay $5 for a regular 2 eggs and toast type breakfast and $7-11 for anything else. Coffee is $2.  OH! The most important little secret about this place: They take reservations. I had a group of 10 friends come into town and we made reservations for saturday morning. It was a blast waltzing in with that many people and skipping past the line that was out the door.

TD7udRuvTbIcOk1yPfLKXw.text: Super breakfast in a real institution.   Great cheese steak omelet, wife loved eggs Benedict,  kids loved the French toast.   Cash only.   Walking around the strip district is interesting as well.   Parked for $5 down the road in a gravel lot ( car full of luggage).

fJCDdjWjbrnPCsQDz2BKXw.text: The food here was delicious. I got a mushroom, spinach and cheese omelet with breakfast potatoes my fiance got frenchtoast with bacon. The bacon was crisped to perfection. The service here was not impressive and satisfactory at best. The line was out the door and down the street for over an hour. When we finally got into the building I noticed many empty seats at clean tables and no one sitting people. if the line is that long, there should be someone dedicated to sitting people. The coffee here was okay, I can say I get better coffee from my keurig. We would go here again for the food, but expect poor service.

hqLAde1LVy62WGsBy2LXWQ.text: Having grown up in a typical Philly neighborhood I felt right at home at Deluca's. The street and the restaurant transported me back to my childhood. The food line, the counter stools, the friendly wait staff all made the experience special. My wife and I stuck with the usual breakfast fare.  French toast, eggs and bacon, hash browns, toast and coffee. Everything fresh and familiar. Living close to Baltimore it is a pity they could not save some of the old close-in shopping areas to create a draw such as the Strip.

blHvWtXqD6pi-X9WnWUOaw.text: Went for breakfast and wasn't impressed at all.  The people who work at DeLucas are not friendly and have a you should be happy I am serving you attitude.  If you are not a morning person then you shouldn't serve breakfast.  A smile and a good morning goes a long way.  The food was mediocre, greasy and lacking flavor. I ordered the California Omelette and it was something I could make at home with better flavor.  The chicken in the omelette had no taste and it was overlooked.  Overall, I don't get the hype.  This is similar to a greasy diner.  Pamela's is the place for breakfast.

fyCGGZS0kGhWqtp7XMLMvQ.text: You'd have a better breakfast at Pamela's or Kelly O's. It is definitely not worth the wait in line. The employees are very miserable, except for the young boy at the register. Food is decent, if you don't mind employees poking their fingers in your food without gloves. They just can't seem to get the orders right. Walk the extra block or two, for a better breakfast all around.

XxVzRiBWEjz5S3ozhCwDfg.text: We usually love this place, been to Deluca's four times.  But the service today was terrible.  Our waitress took forever to take our order, and then in the middle of taking it, she left to go deliver other customers food.  Took her 10 minutes to get back to us to finish taking our order.  In the meantime, all of our drinks were empty and she didn't even notice.  We had to ask for refills.   All in all, even though the food is good, we may never be coming back.  The service is just unacceptable.

sj5VN0fVWOJTEXuDe5xfpA.text: I took my husband and kids here.  The food was ok.  My husband was disappointed and said the potatoes were gross and didn't eat them! But honestly if you go here you are going to get a good diner meal! The menu is big.  I suggest getting your standard breakfast!

x4mZ2g0jCqKLreyifsA8iA.text: It's hard to believe that I would get up early on a Saturday morning to stand in line for 45 minutes for the opportunity to have breakfast at a dive.  I mean in the Strip District.  Deluca's is a mighty Pittsburgh tradition.  I get that.  I can see that this place is definitely a Yinzer kind of place.  Service was really great.  I mean it.  I mean, here you are trying to shovel food to starving patrons with achy feet after their long wait.  Think about that, it can't be pleasant.  The menu covers a lot of territory.  But I already knew I was going to be having a Western Omelet.  BJ followed a coworker friends bad advice and got the corned beef hash.  We were expecting the real thing, but I am sure this stuff came straight from a can.  Although it was grilled up really nice.  The home fries were really good.  The wheat toast was the best.  The ham in my omelet was very good.  All in all an interesting experience.  Another surprise, I had to take another shower that day in an attempt to remove the smell of grease from my body.  It's something I will not soon forget.  Did I say that I am a fan?  You can't mess with tradition.

QJ-3CKiHBuGxAx1sTmfDhg.text: Hometown favorite! Line out the door but table turnover was quick! In-season right now are pumpkin pancakes! Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pumpkin Pancakes

rMXQJNviZvEdqtKnaA8qgg.text: This place is crazy good. We had to wait around 20 minutes to get in (the line goes out the door and down the street when it's busy), but the move people through pretty quickly. Their pancakes are so good. I had the Apple Pie pancakes that came with whip cream and ice cream. Oh my gosh sooooooo amazing! Really rich and super filling, but somehow I managed. I loved that place!

JuEIqdzcTxRDFj418b4L6A.text: I just love this place ! I like the old styles of restaurants a ton  ! The french toast just melts in my mouth  ! I go here every Saturday and the workers are so friendly also ! Great atmosphere  ! Great breakfast  !

cf5sBKQOi6Ong1Hksek-PQ.text: it is very difficult to get my 7 year old nephew to eat ANYTHING.  We go to dinner and he will eat a bite and say he is full.  Well, that is until we went to Delucas.  He got a full adult order of french toast and ate it!  Then asked if we could come there again when we come to Pittsburgh!  His approval alone is enough for a 4 star review but it didn't hurt that 6 more adults and 1 child also enjoyed their meals!  the fried fish sandwich was great and the homemade sausage they serve is a must if you are going with a breakfast entree!    Thanks Deluca for getting my nephew to eat a whole meal!

tlwfMU76G3PJHJ7XIEzb2Q.text: It was a fun experience. The food was good, hot, and fresh. The staff were somewhat friendly. We got in and out with no wait and our food came in a reasonable amount time. To sum it up, I would try it again.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

FEsaaQQNRpV18Xv0de2YcQ.text: My boyfriend and I had been looking forward to eating at DeLuca's for months, but every time we passed on a Saturday morning, we figured it was not worth the wait. We were right!  Luckily, we both had a Thursday off, and we're able to visit during a slow day. This might have actually been the biggest mistake we could've made.   DeLuca's obviously does not staff their Allstar waitresses on weekdays, and because of that, we paid the price. Upon walking in, we were promptly seated, but it then took over 5 minutes for our waitress to take our orders. My boyfriend ordered the mixed grill with bacon and sourdough toast, and I ordered the huevos rancheros.  It took an exorbitantly long time for our food to reach our table, and when it did, we were brought the wrong meal (as were two other groups sitting in our area).   When we finally got our meals, they were... Not good. The salsa on the huevos was so sweet that it tasted like barbecue sauce, and the refried beans on the side were like glue in my mouth. My boyfriend said the mixed grill was okay, but our waitress brought him white toast instead of sourdough, even though he asked her TWICE for sourdough (when we got the check, we saw that she wrote "white toast" on it).  If the food were decent, it might have made up for the poor service, but alas, that wasn't the case. Only a masochist would wait in line for DeLuca's. Go to Pamela's instead.

CNR8_dcC9iv311O6G6zNmQ.text: I like Deluca's.  I think the place has a good Pittsburgh atmosphere and the service is always great.  I really do enjoy coming here every once in a while when I'm down in the strip.  That said, the food doesn't generally blow me out of the water.  It's definitely good, but I have to say that I prefer the Dor-Stop in Dormont for breakfast.  We went over the weekend.  Our service was great, as usual, everyone is very friendly.  I got corned beef hash (something the Dor-Stop is lacking), and it was alright.  It's hard to find really amazing corned beef hash - if you're ever in the Cleveland area and that's your thing, check out Big Al's.  Best I've ever had.  My boyfriend got a breakfast burrito, which is his go-to most places.  He said it was good, but definitely preferred it elsewhere.  Overall, I think we would probably be a lot more excited about this place if we didn't have a place we liked better right near us.

fBQB0sKWgLBuuusO5gZ--w.text: I really did not get what all the hype was about.  The food is ok.  I had eggs, sausage home fries it was fair nothing spectacular.    The inside looks like it has been cared for since the place opened.

BgpY951hIZNOmdMGJjSYpQ.text: I think this place is just hyped up way too much. The food was average, or even below average greasy diner food. We were seated under the air conditioner so were freezing the entire time we were there. I don't mind a kind of grungy diner, but this place seems sticky and gross.  Our server was very pleasant, and the woman she was training was helpful and kept up with coffee re-fills.  In all honesty, I don't know why people line-up to get breakfast from this joint. Nothing spectacular on the menu in m y opinion....   Second story (from my husband so I know its True).... he went there door-busting Sunday morning, after a long night out. Although they were the first people waiting at the door, and were there about 20 minutes before they opened, another group of people strolled up in front of them right at opening and were seated first. These people were then served first, and it took almost 45 minutes for my husband and his group of friends to get their food. They are guessing the group that cavalierly cut in front of them was a group of regulars. One of the people in my husbands group complained to management and they were given a gift certificate, but it almost made one of the group members late miss their flight out of town....   So glad we went during the week when it wasn't that crowded.

1eXKSz4-8AFHmrY90Prqtg.text: Great omelets. Huge serving sizes. A real classic. But bring cash! No cards accepted.

HajL_S_OgJ2D1NAqFoYfjQ.text: Both times I've eaten breakfast here, I was extremely, extremely pleased. However, I think the food was better my first visit compared to the second, and I'm not one to branch out at breakfast places, so this is a fair comparison of the exact same sandwich, service, and company.   Each visit we waited in line outside of Deluca's for a table. It was raining, but the line moved quickly and we were under cover anyways. The service is prompt and friendly.   It's definitely a great place to recommend to out of towners for a good local breakfast stop. The bread is all Mancini's...delicious. Local flavor, great location. Will return.

MpOSvsXVzy2fTgjjdA0NdQ.text: Absolutely delicious! Super crowded but that's understandable because of how great the food is. I got the pumpkin pancakes and they were incredible. This is a must eat at in Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pumpkin pancakes with a side of hash browns

OU8tcAaiZ8_Ja_vx0Q-RkA.text: This place is really quantity over quality. Sure, you can order a ridiculously large amount of food and snap an Instagram picture, but the quality ain't that much better than any other decent diner. I'm not saying it's bad. It's pretty good, but people standing in line for over an hour is really unnecessary. If you want to come here, get up the extra hour early and get here before 8.

V05qRmtDITZ9wC_FVN_QNg.text: Man versus food. Food won on my visit!  Had the Breakfast of Champions. My eyes nearly popped out of my head when it came out on Not 1 or 2, but 3 PLATES!  Food: Lot of carbs that fill you up quickly - toast, pancake, hash, eggs. Bacon was crispy but flavorful and definitely enjoyed that. Love the chocolate chip pancake where they add them into the pancake instead of just pouring some chips on top after the pancake is done. Toast was bland - if deciding what to skip in carbs, this would be it. Hash and eggs were basic cooked items without much flavor so add your own condiments to make it work.  Service: Ok, don't come here for service cuz you'll hate yourself. Similar to other popular breakfast places I've visited, you only see servers for beverage order, food order, food delivery, check.  FYI: Cash Only! Get here before 10am on weekends to limit wait times cuz there will definitely be a line. I got here at 9am and there was about 5 min wait.

GTTGmvnaWdrVkIpb8HpsWA.text: We didn't really wait that long in line, maybe 10-15 minutes. While we were seated pretty quickly, we didn't get served until after the couple next to us had been seated and waited on.  NOT COOL! Food was good, I had Texas Cinnamon French Toast and Turkey Sausage.  Toast had a hint of onions and peppers which was off putting but overall good. Very good turkey sausage.  Husband had Eggs Benedict hash with chicken and avocado.  He said he didn't think there was any avocado on the plate.   Overall good food, underwhelmed by the wait staff, maybe that's why there's always a line out the door.

AH3RwTMu5FNLH7PlTKZnVQ.text: Very good: gravy (possibly the best gravy you can find in Pittsburgh), fried chicken  Good: burrito (massive in size), Egg Benedict  Tip:  Cash only.  The store closes at 3.  (I came around 2pm with a group of 5, but it was quick to get the seats. )

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

8TyZlHFR4iZv_0spoKiC-A.text: We have eaten here several times over the past two years and have never been dissatisfied. Omelets are huge and each has a recipe and taste of its own. Additionally, the diner has a personality of its own; fun!

agSoo0sH_R3gfiUE-sE4Eg.text: Holy sheet!  That was a phenomenal breakfast!  I had the Funky Monkey - chocolate chip banana hotcakes (i.e. for those less sophisticated people like me that means pancake), vanilla ice cream, and banana, all drizzled in hot fudge and caramel.  The inner fat kid in me will be smiling for months!  The steaming hot pancakes perfectly complimented the cold, creamy vanilla ice cream!  My girlfriend had the Seafood Benedict - lobster and lump crab meat over a thick toasted piece of bread, bathed in hollandaise sauce.  Oh.  My. God!  The second best breakfast dish I have ever had!  We shared a side of bacon - no description necessary other than to say that it was crispy delicious porky perfection!  The wait of 24 minutes from the time we got into line until we sat down at our table flew by.  Service was real good, but they did take a while to bring our bacon.  Seriously, please don't ever  make me wait for bacon... but I was so focused on the rest of the meal that I barely noticed.  Best breakfast in Pittsburgh, indeed!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Funky Monkey!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seafood Benedict!!

hLQeTas-3GGtpFGdnZVK2A.text: If you're looking for diner food, this is a good bet! I'm wavering between three and four stars, but rounding up for charm.  We were deciding between Pamela's and Deluca's. Deluca's advertised a shorter wait time, so we jumped in line anxious for some breakfast! It was Saturday morning and took about 45 minutes until we got seated. I don't mind waiting for food, but I'm not sure I would wait that long next time.   The menu is extensive and covers your diner staples from omelettes and eggs benedict, to pancakes and crepes. Everyone at my table ordered something different. I went with the corned beef hash which was served with toast, eggs and home fries. We also got an order of the special pumpkin pancakes to share. The portions were HUGE. We all ate about half of what we got and were stuffed to the brim. The pancakes were better than I imagined they would be and I'd definitely recommend going the sweet and savory route.   Service was pretty good and efficient. Our waitress spilt a full cup of coffee on the table, but they were quick to react and clean it up. While waiting for our food, we enjoyed looking at all the photos and memorabilia on the wall from local athletes to celebs (and Man vs. Food)!   Like I said, it was some solid food and we were full for hours. Worth the wait? I'll let you decide that for yourself.

3yCxYew1-suatXRgWXWLVQ.text: Best breakfast of our trip.  Nothing fancy, but the place is clean,  Apple Cinnamon crepes, peanut butter and banana sandwich, eggs, chicken fried chicken, biscuits and gravy, homefries, milkshake and coffee.  Again, some of it was excellent and all of it was very good.  Wish we had a place this solid near our house.   Will be back.

HTOv0aCni-rZPkn2oBWLVQ.text: Came here probably too late on a Saturday morning, and had to stand in the line out the door for maybe 30-40 minutes? (I have no concept of time, but it was a while). The man inside had said the wait would be about 15 minutes which was pretty much BS but I am glad to say it was worth it! Service was quick but not personal (those servers had zero time to chitchat, all running around like chickens with their heads cut off). The coffee was great and refilled regularly, and my boyfriend and I split the Californian omelette and chocolate chip pancakes. We ate it all and loved it! It was all perfectly portioned and we left feeling full but not disgusting. The pancakes were really special, and for those who love to over-indulge, their menu has a ton of ridiculous pancake options. Loved the vintage diner vibe but did not get the movie reference throughout.  WOAAAH I almost forgot to mention the best part! The omelette came with probably the most AMAZING sauce in the world. My boyfriend really proved his worth when he asked if we could have more on the side, and were given an entire freaking bowl of this dream sauce. Amazing stuff, it really was all in the sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Californian omelette and chocolate chip pancakes with delicious coffee

L3UewBxiCRAQapLmoE1Vrw.text: I love Deluca's, they are proud of their traditional breakfast and the do it well. The ingredients are always fresh, the service is excellent and the menu gives you lots of options.  Here are some things you should know:  The Strip District location is cash only, but there is a newer Robinson location that takes credit cards. There are several ATM's close by ion the Strip in case you forget.  You can make reservations 24 hours in advance for parties of 6 or more. It's a great idea, especially given the lines that often go outside the door.  Deluca's is not for everybody, it's classic diner with a great reputation and they are reluctant to change. But the food is good and it's a perennial favorite and a source of pride for many Pittsburghers.  There is a hustle and bustle to Deluca's.  It's people on their way to a game, or on their way to shop in the Strip. There's a kind of excitement here which you may not find relaxing, but it's part of Pittsburgh tradition and worth experiencing.  There some unusual ethnic dishes which are quite good, for example, a Greek omelet with Feta cheese and Spinach. Pierogies.   I like their traditional breakfast, especially because their potatoes are always served perfect. The buckwheat pancakes are something unique as well.  Deluca's is a must for anyone who wants to fully experience Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. California Benedict: Avocado, tomatoes, spinach, Chipotle pesto, Asiago cheese.

nLL1Z8S9Sv70GpmsUQKbsQ.text: Definitely lives up to the Diner name. All sorts of breakfast standards and the pancake plate was great. Giving you a little taste of everything. Our waitress was wonderful and helped us narrow down that big diner menu. I would recommend the pancakes over the waffle and the breakfast potatoes are pretty much just a mushed up baked potato, so you might want to pass on those for some of the other delicious items. They had 3 types of sausage to choose from and waffle, pancakes or French toast were an option for every combo. Don't let the line outside deter you, it moves really fast.

Jccf_LZzmCHprpxY7sjQWQ.text: Loved Deluca's!  We came here for breakfast after spending the night in PGH for a Pirates game.  I've given up on finding a diner in Youngstown so it was nice to visit one here!  Our waitress greeted us as we came in the door and we had coffee in front of us within second of our butts hitting our seats!  Omelettes were made with freshly cracked eggs and were huge!  I had the Western and the hubby had a Greek with chicken.  Both were very good as were the home fries.  They have several different egg benedict choices that all looked great as did a huge pancake special that the person sitting next to us had.  Makes me want to drive down from Youngstown on Saturday for breakfast!  The hour drive each way would be well worth it!

4Tpq2fbcGl7VAejb2xtcow.text: Two words: The Food!! This place is busy, often with a line out the door, so try to arrive before you're starving. The decor is cute-old-diner chic and the service is matter-of-fact.  I've been here several times, so I've only tried a few things, but the food has always been excellent! For example, the undeniable flavor of the seafood in my seafood eggs Benedict mixed flawlessly with the hollandaise, avocado, perfectly poached egg and Mancini's bread...I even failed when I tried not to eat all of the delicious potatoes (so good!!) - the Best seafood breakfast I've ever had!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The BEST seafood Benedict I have ever had!! Memorable, to say the least!!

ak2JFXmI3pWVpK8yji4dSw.text: DeLuca's is a real Pittsburgh gem. Expect a line if you come here on the weekends, unless you are a very early riser! Last time I came was on a Friday around 9:00 am. By 10:00 am, there was a line out the door and that is pretty typical for this place.  DeLuca's walls are covered in Pittsburgh history, making wait for your breakfast not so bad! The diner is also a lot bigger than expected, it goes back pretty far. Do not expect servers that want to chat with you- this is a BUSY breakfast spot! Never the less, the service has always been great when I have visited.   My boyfriend and I love this place and have been here so many times, but my parents have never been until I brought them here last month! They were SO impressed by the huge portions they received and loved everything. My dad had the Steel City Breakfast Of Champs, which consisted of a Short stack of pancakes, 2 eggs, 2 pcs of bacon, sausage, homefries & toast (mancini's toast to be exact). He loved everything and was really impressed with the pancakes! They were perfectly fluffy and just delicious. I had the hotcake special and loved every minute of it. They made my egg whites perfectly and the bacon was super good! My mom had an omelette and loved it as well! I've also had their specialty pumpkin pancakes and they are insanely good as well!  If you have never been to DeLuca's, you need to right now. Genuine Pittsburgh breakfast and you will leave full and VERY happy!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Egg whites and bacon- both perfect!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Perfect fluffy pancakes!

qwRZdMSV24DNowk0d5DBcQ.text: Our first visit won't be our last! Great seat at the bar to watch the action. The bacon was to die for and being from Iowa, we know bacon. Thick cut and fried to perfection! I highly recommend the French toast!Made with inch think cut of Mancini bread, the local favorite. Crisp outside. Chewy inside. Amazing!  A tip: tried to come over a Steelers game weekend and the line was out the door. Came back on Monday morning, still a line but much shorter. CASH ONLY.   So many choices we could eat here again and again. Until next time Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Always a line. And worth it!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French toast of Mancini bread. OMG!!

k0vPO9v7fMbQ39GbcygrSQ.text: Breakfast on a Monday morning after a Steelers Sunday late afternoon home game. Maybe a 10 minute wait. I liked it better than Kelly O's , thought the food was again good not great. Traditional breakfast, eggs, bacon and potatoes, pricing was fair. Would go again

ddh7LtdlXFF2kx-UA-58oQ.text: Call me crazy, but Deluca's doesn't really do it for me.  Based on the continuous long lines in front of the restaurant, I am clearly in the minority.  Don't get me wrong, the breakfast is tasty, the menu is extensive and the prices are reasonable but it just doesn't knock it out of the ballpark for me.  I always opt for the two eggs, meat, potatoes and toast breakfast, and I'm always ecstatic when a restaurant has a turkey sausage or turkey bacon option which they do.    Where I think they fall short is their breakfast potatoes.   They aren't crispy or flavorful enough.  Since this two egg meal choice is my breakfast staple, I can't help but compare it to the Kelly O's and Pamela's equivalent and it just doesn't compare.   My husband likes that they have more options on the menu here (country fried chicken and biscuits, biscuits and gravy, etc.). They also have a ton of breakfasts that seem more like desserts (think waffle sundae).   It's certainly a local Strip destination that should be investigated, it's just not my spot of choice.  Also, if you are looking for a trendy or upscale place, you should walk on by because this is a classic, greasy spoon diner.

WQlheUl7ChOdz7hBRuoxBA.text: Such a good breakfast, the wait on the weekend can feel crazy when you look at the line but ultimately they move quickly. I would say though if you are looking for more of a leisurely brunch place to try somewhere else but if you want good food, no fuss and the pittsburgh strip district experience, I would say it is worth the wait. Cash only so check on that. I think you can judge a diner by how good their cornbeef hash is, and this one is really delicious. The danish pancakes or swedish blintzes are also really good, the lingonberry preserves served with those is my favorite.

AVZ7SYc0oiFMjZ0TS7iDIg.text: Came here on 4th of July morning and was treating by a breakfast that fueled me all day for my freedom celebrating activities. The aesthetic is a classic old timey diner, and the atmosphere is warm and friendly. In particular, our waiter was Rhonda, and she was an absolute delight. Definitely a great place to grab for a breakfast bite.

CecgUjg8BF7hkYIfTcnl7Q.text: Pittsburgh institution in the strip district. Always a line out the door. Really good breakfast, huge portions, service was excellent. The busboys work real hard at this place, it's spotless. We ordered the eggs benedict with ham on toast and swiss cheese with a hollandaise on the side, not a fan of the hollandaise. The winner here is the spicy hot sausage patty excellent. The Man vs Food meat lovers breakfast lived up to its reputation tons of food split between three people!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Man vs Food!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4A-MsPxRZNHsFlm4WBvBRA.text: The hype is real. Yes the line is worth it. Get the chicken and waffles. It's a big, thin boneless breast of chicken perfectly cooked with plenty of delicious coating. Then it sits on top of a perfectly crisp waffle with a delicate sweet inside. The only chicken and waffles to surpass it is at Screen Door in Portland, Oregon.

Brqe4PJ-Z1qq2DAxkcw_Bw.text: This place is always busy! But that shows that it is soooo good! The last time I went there, I had the fish sandwich and it was so yummy! They bread the fish there and you can definitely tell. It tasted very fresh. It also came with coleslaw and fries. The fries were, ehhhhh ok. Nothing really special about them. The coleslaw was pretty good though! Next time I go, I definitely think I will try something from their breakfast menu. The other people I was with got breakfast items and really enjoyed them!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. DeLuca&#39;s menu
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sitting at the counter in DeLuca&#39;s
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish sandwich

EszyfAA4rSijquxKALTcxg.text: While waiting for a table I said "This better be the best breakfast ever." The man in front of me said it was a very delicious breakfast. It definitely was! I had the calfornia eggs benedict, hubby had the original benedict, and THEN we ordered the strawberry fields. I know what you are thinking...  It was a LOT of food but we didn't finish it all. The eggs benedict were some of the best I've had. Spinach, tomatoes, cheese...yum. Potatoes were also great. Hubby really liked these.  The strawberry fields was OMG good. It was a lot of flavors for me but hubby loved it. I would have just been fine with a chocolate chip pancake and called it a day. lol. It had fudge, strawberry ice cream, chocolate chip pancake, and strawberries..oh and whipped cream. After that meal, we didn't eat for hours...  It was featured on man vs food for a reason!

_0yVKPbrc7hMZHPmmgCAgA.text: Deluca's Diner has emerged as one of Pittsburgh's best diners and breakfast locations. With lines stretching out of the doors on most weekend mornings, is the food really worth all the commotion? Yes, no question. The menu is itself is something else. Some of the most unique, yet intriguing breakfast options can be found here. Ever seen a banana split crepe before? Neither have I until I ordered one here. The omelets? These things are barely omelets but are plain delicious. Pancakes? They don't get much better than what Deluca's is serving.  OKAY we get it. The food is outstanding. I even might call it the best breakfast in burgh. Is it worth standing outside, waiting a half hour to get in? Yes. Would I do it in freezing rain? Probably, you can always order a hot chocolate, which is strangely very good. Deluca's for sure delivers on their reputation. You can't go wrong here. Nuff said.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OtvKAYhJvtrUL0LP014jew.text: Came here because our Lyft driver recommended it.  Good food and lots of it.  This is a True old school diner, not fancy at all.  Expedient service, probably because of lots of people wanting to eat there. Large menu and abundant portions.  It's not exactly cheap but a good value for what you get.  My husband loved his Eggsceptional egg sandwich.  It was served on thick cut Italian toast and very delicious.  My spinach, tomato and feta omelet was good but a little overcooked.  Get there early to avoid a wait, but don't get discouraged if there is one.  The place is a lot bigger than it looks and they move people in and out quickly.  And remember -- Cash only.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The hard working people on the cook line.
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Eggsceptional egg sandwich!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spinach feta and tomato omelet. Huge portion but maybe a little well done.

gWvmzA8rkWAIpBfjpfE5Tw.text: My wife had been here before, but it was my first visit. We visited the Robinson location before and wanted to try the original. Surprisingly enough, we only had to wait about 10 minutes on a late Sunday morning around 11:30. They were still busy inside though, but that didn't affect our service. The waitress was attentive and nice to answer all our menu questions (we like to make substitutions).   We are big coffee drinkers, and once she noticed she couldn't keep up, she brought over a carafe.   As for the food, the menu is huge. My wife got poached eggs (surprise), and they were cooked perfectly. She also got her raisin toast well done. She had to send it back to have it run through again. When it came back out, it was perfect. The waitress didn't mind, and she even warned her it might come out too dark and didn't want her to be upset.   I ordered the Greek omelet with grilled chicken. It was pretty big, and had a lot of cheese in it. It tasted really good, my only minor change would be less grease. Something about a greasy omelet usually doesn't sit well with my stomach. But again, it was really good.   We both got fruit cups instead of potatoes. The fruit wasn't that ripe, and our waitress warned us about that too, but it still wasn't bad. And a better option than the home fries would have been, because I didn't have an hour to go to the bathroom.   DeLuca's is a Pittsburgh staple everyone has to try at least once.  It really is a perfect greasy diner experience if that's what you are looking for.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Greek omelet with chicken. Slightly greasy, but good nonetheless.
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A carafe of coffee... just for us. Oh my!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Poached eggs and perfectly double-toasted raisin bread.

X1PRE_Xd49PhWtgUkYaXdw.text: If your turned off by shabby furnishings and the whole dive vibe this place is not for you. If you could care less about your surroundings as long as the food is fantastic and plentiful the come to Delucas. My wife and 3 boys (11, 13 and 15) are breakfast junkies, seriously, we could ready breakfast 3 times a day 7 days a week. So we had to try Delucas while in Pittsburgh for a holiday. We saw it on Man Vs Food and DDD. It is a dive no doubt about it. But the food is awesome. We ate breakfast at around 930a and didn't eat again until 10p.....the portions are huge. Staff was friendly and prices where reasonable. What else could you ask for.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3bKksDz0ajDdVMhH0_KrqQ.text: Very busy and crowded. About 20 or 30 minute wait. Not the friendliest staff! Food was average.

m8aV9w_me0DXPsP7PkPwXg.text: There is a always a long line out the door (literally) for a reason. That reason is amazing diner food. The fact that it's cash only doesn't deter anyone from coming here. I've only been here once but I'm already sold.   My husband and I ordered a few random things on the rather large menu and everything was pretty darn good. He tried the Reuben Melt with Lobster Bisque soup and I got the Country Fried Chicken, Eggs and Biscuits. The Lobster Bisque was surprisingly creamy and full of flavor for a diner soup. I'll admit, the Country Fried Chicken was a bit heavy for brunch but it was so amazing; every bite was worth the gazillion calories that I consumed. The chicken was well seasoned and moist, the batter was crispy and the creamy gravy made it all the more comforting. I could tell the biscuits were homemade or made very well bc they were so moist and great alongside everything else.   If I could, I would come here every weekend but the line and wait can be discouraging (and I would gain so much weight). Awesome location, delicious diner food, but always crowded. Come prepared to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Country Fried Chicken, Eggs &amp; Biscuits (biscuits not pictured)

J8ETfSBAwPA3tgC9lFRxuQ.text: My husband and I stopped in while we were in Pittsburgh for the Steelers/Browns game over NYE weekend. OMG is all I have to say. Probably the best breakfast I've ever eaten. It was rather busy, but we only waited a couple of minutes to be seated. Our waitress was practically at our table waiting to take our drink order when we were seated. She took our order and had our fiod back out to us within 10-15 minutes tops. We ended up ordering way too much food, but goodness was it amazing!  Our order: -Philly Cheesesteak Omelet: Perfect. The eggs, meat, and veggies were perfectly cooked and seasoned. -Sausage gravy and homemade biscuit: Probably the best I've ever eaten. I can't even begin to describe the buttery biscuit and thick, creamy gravy. -Home fries, Corned beef hash, and eggs overeasy: The eggs were thoroughly cooked, the home fries were soft on the inside and crispy on the outside, and the corned beef hash was perfect. It was fried perfectly, not soggy or too crunchy, just right. -Dolce da Choccolato: Words cannot describe or do it justice. It's a crepe filled with Nutella and strawberries topped with whipped cream and dusted with powdered sugar. I love crepes and ordered it thinking it would be like any other crepe. I was WRONG! This sucker was at least 12" long, yes seriously a foot long. I have never seen strawberries that big before. It took both of us to eat it and we barely we able to finish it.  The term "Best breakfast in town" is a lie. It needs to be changed to "Best breakfast on the planet!"

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Our entire order
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Biscuits and gravy, home fries and eggs overeasy, and Dolce de Choccolato
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Corned beef hash and Dolce de Choccolato

AIuJLUJ4jDgnFSJhVJoU0w.text: Although not from the Burgh, my cousins brought me to my inaugural visit at DeLuca's  years  ago  (before Man vs Food showed up).  Sleezy diners with delicious breakfast & lunch have a special place in my heart.  DeLucas nailed it for me.  From omelettes to sandwiches & salads, the food was always consistently good.    After a 7 year hiatus, I visited P'burgh last weekend and had to hit up DeLuca's.  Seemed like something had slipped during that time period.  It took 15 minutes for the servers to decide which one of them was going to be assigned to us.  Not a good beginning.  No one even  offered coffee or a beverage to start.    My omelette was dry and overcooked.  Veggie and meat filling wasn't warm, cheese not melted.  Soggy hash browns and barely toasted bread only added insult to injury.  Bear in mind, I'm not expecting an uber-brunch here.....its a diner, OK?   Maybe an off day, maybe not. I were  Adam Richman, Anthony Bourdain or Guy Fieri , my sorry excuse for an omelette with cold filling would have never hit the table!   (Just sayin')  Next time I'm in town, I might brave the lines at  P&G's Pamela's Diner.

FNn8yCBxMTDaZHFtnmRUrQ.text: I think this place is over-rated.  I believe this place has a long line only because of its location and its history.  Maybe it was the best breakfast in 1950, not too sure about it in 2017.  There are certainly strong competitors nearby.  You cannot beat its location.  It's the middle of Strip District, and everyone comes to Strip District on the weekend.    Coffee and breakfast were ok.  Nothing really stand-out.  I tried it once, and not going to wait another hour for it.  If you are here on a weekday / no line somehow, give it a try.  I bet 90% of that line is visitors from out-of-town.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

yiLnekIK8D6PSJWtNhBxBg.text: 8 am Friday morning and no wait. Staying at the Westin and this place was recommended for breakfast. The buckwheat pancakes we're almost as good as homemade. Overeasy eggs cooked perfectly and paired well with hot sausage which I expected to be hotter based on other reviewers. My partner had blueberry french toast (canned or possibly frozen berries). Her sunny-side-up eggs had uncooked whites but she didn't complain! The atmosphere and vibe is old-school and wonderful. The menu has plenty of choices... I'd eat here again anytime!

Sb3jex4QBcBo_7XgGNCvyQ.text: I don't quite understand the hype. I came here twice while living in Pittsburgh and the first time The breakfast was okay. We came a second time and I asked for waffle. The waffle came out too crispy so they made it again...which didn't change much. I finally gave up and asked for a pancake. I wish I took a picture but when I cut into the pancake batter just came pouring out. The waitress was so embarrassed. We finally just got up (the waitress was kind enough to refund us some of our money.. at least for my dish) and called it a morning. Management needs to talk to their cooks bc if you can't make a pancake or waffle at a breakfast place... you will have disappointed customers.

XJ6JcPEH4wTR6b_9Qsns-A.text: Forget the food quality and long line, how about coming out of the dark ages and accept credit cards like every other business, you might actually make more money. Nothing like standing in a long line with a group of people ready to spend a considerable amount of money on mideocre at best food only to discover you have to find a ATM somewhere in the Pgh. strip district. If you don't have one already why don't you add your own ATM like Mineo's in Squirrel Hill and screw customers out of more money. Plenty of places around Pgh. to eat breakfast and not be this inconvenienced.

gLYkz5-4O-aVNwdtkZYtHw.text: I thought it was good food for sure but it was slightly over priced. I think you can get the same quality food for a cheaper price and half the wait time. I think its over hyped but still worth a visit once in your life.

nTEzaXI0ZXcslFHl8XULFQ.text: Deluca's is a classic; it's truly an authentic Pittsburgh diner. The service is prompt and everyone who works there is kind, but not afraid to joke around with you! Honestly they make you feel like you've known them for years! Aside from the warm atmosphere, the food is great! It's about as diner-y as a diner can get and I love it! This time I ordered the "superbowl," which is an omelette stuffed with mashed potatoes, onions, kielbasa, and cheese, with a side of sauerkraut. It sounds hideous but was absolutely amazing, certainly one of my new favorites. The quantity of food they serve you gives you a bang for your buck. Honestly if I don't leave with a box in hand I've probably engorged myself! With that in mind, I couldn't help but order the freshly baked Mancini's toast anyway because.. why not!  Honestly I will continue to come here as long as it stays open, and I hope it never closes. Pittsburgh wouldn't be Pittsburgh without Delucas.

jhamx2g0wj0OppdPhVxs_Q.text: This place is definitely worth the hype. It was poppin when I came in, hungover and ravenous. I was ready to eat my body weight in carbs and just chill for a bit before my boyfriend and I hit the road back home to Ohio.   Service was very, very fast. Like, you sneezed and your food was placed before you. Typical diner food, but it packed a flavorful punch.   Our waitress so funny and kind, and I really wish I remembered her name so I could rave about her. Lol

VlxKEjWJ6iuWjCYG47SjKw.text: The spot for your morning fuel in the Strip! It ain't fancy and they don't care if you are! The food is always fresh and hot, coffee the same, and everything is yummy! Terrific and HUGE omelette - try the Spanish with salsa! Great stuff - there's a reason the place is usually packed, and a reason all the folks are smiling. Great chow! Get it here! (Oh...and take cash only!)

l4XGupnHAPz0_m3MIQ3Ihg.text: I really enjoyed my breakfast at Deluca's!  I was visiting a good friend in Pittsburgh about two weeks ago, and she insisted that we go to Deluca's before hitting an arts festival and Pride.  First of all, our waitress was fantastic.  She was patient with me being overwhelmed by the extensive menu, and she was on top of everything when it came to keeping us good and caffeinated.  I ordered the Huevos Rancheros, while my friend got the Breakfast of Champs with chocolate chip pancakes.  The Huevos Rancheros were great, the Spanish sauce was kinda sweet and very unique.  It was fantastic!  My friend's breakfast was HUGE, and those pancakes were perfect.  Loved the spot, the diner was super charming, and the service was wonderful.  I'd definitely go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steel City Breakfast of Champs and some Huevos Rancheros!

-L5tdvzWUStlxF7STtEUBw.text: This place was ok at best, didn't really like it all that much. When I first got here, it took over 30 minutes until we were served our food. One of the three entree's we ordered, was wrong. So we had to send it back. I also feel the place was dirty, I had some markings on my cup which I don't think is cool. Maybe this place is for you, but wasn't for me. Doubt ill come back

9dFHTIXZjPikIjznXVETDA.text: just look for the big chicken on top ...this is a real honest to goodness diner located in the strip district  *cash only*  there is a counter and booths the Tv is on with the local news in the mornings SO they do open really early as any legit diner should  so depending if its a weekday you can head on in grab a table with vintage boomerang formica or sit at the counter everyone there is very friendly and welcoming  if you decide to go on a weekend be prepared for the line out the door but as their sign says the line will move so if you can only do a weekend its worth the wait for me I like to go on a week day early they have your usual breakfasts eggs bacon toast  they also have Benedicts I have had their avocado veggie version and its so good! then there are their pancakes season featured my favorite pumpkin which comes in a few varieties even one with ice cream its all so good and their fish sammie a big piece of perfecty fried cod...that thing is huge on a nice fresh roll even their tartar sauce is good nice n creamy  lots other sammie choices and burgers they have shakes and sodas their ice tea is surprisingly good I always have it  a meal is about 10 bucks plus a drink or shake  this is a great place  ok so parking can be a hassle on a weekend just take a deep breath and remain calm a metered spot will open up or take the bus

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Now that&#39;s a fish sammie
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pumpkin crepe
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

f_OLSk64N292ac3vxi_K-w.text: Unique vibe. Nice food with reasonable price. A lot of food options for brunch including toasts, omelettes, pancakes, waffles, burgers, and many more. If you are in the Strip District and want to try out a decent brunch place with Pittsburgh's unique vibe, this is the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

vKMAe0R2cAAiUsigflwxYA.text: Came here for Sunday brunch with a large group if friends. Our wait was somewhere between 30-45 min and we were hungry!! Only made me that more excited to try this place as we were from out of town. My boyfriend ordered the country fried steak and I ordered the French toast. We both really enjoyed our meals and this concluded our weekend trip to Pittsburgh beautifully. I would definitely return next time I'm in the Pittsburgh area.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. View while waiting!

dSIIoO5TOILZXkrtc5PRUw.text: I love DeLuca's. You know whatever you get will be big, filling, fresh, and delicious. The service is quick and very friendly. The prices are cheap!

as-76LGwQMLMqI-qKonEfw.text: I heard rave reviews about this place and was so excited to eat here. We finally got in and the food was greasy and mediocre. I ended up getting me food poisoning and got very sick for the rest of the day afterwards. I will never go back here

p7L_QXh0SUgpNngEefktVw.text: Super good. Worth the wait and excellent speedy service. Breakfast burritos were amazing and coffee stayed full. Bring cash! They are cash only.

_X5Owl86zCtPEAlIpGVY8w.text: This is the real deal. Long lines outside but be patient. Super busy, friendly service, and a great diner breakfast. The hot sausage is particularly good.

oGtinkfwRaufGn5VPi7Hnw.text: Awful service... food is just ok. Not worth standing in line... Plus they only take cash...

8rp2LESrO8IBmydVDzLCNw.text: Love Delucas! I got the Nutella french toast, which was basically just slabs of Nutella spread on regular french toast....meets the requirements but for all the hype surrounding Delucas I was expecting a bit more on that end. It was pretty tasty, though I prefer the french toast at Micro Diner in Mt Washington. The waiter was very friendly, and the place is adorable. I'll definitely be coming back!

yUsh17YjnaWyEKvX-ZTv0g.text: Well, I finally caved.  After years of resisting that persistent, daunting line that has become a rite of Pittsburgh passage, I finally braved the wait and went to Deluca's.  Perhaps it was due to good company (or the first signs of sun this spring), but the 30+ minute wait that we endured seemed to go relatively quick.  After finally making it to the doorway, we were asked to come in by the hostess, only to be left inside the doorway with no real inclination of whether we should proceed to one of the several open tables or wait.  When we finally tracked down the hostess again, she said we needed us to wait to sit down as to, "not upset the chef."  Fast forward, and we've finally sat down (in the seat Tom Cruise filmed Jack Reacher nonetheless).  After attempting the scan the entirely too complex menu (do you really need multiple versions of what is essentially the same dish?), we settled on the breakfast burrito, the seafood benedict, the seafood omelette (same as the seafood benedict, just with the bread on the side instead of under) and the apple pancake sundae (figured go big or go home).  Within about fifteen minutes, the burrito, benedict and omelette were brought out.   By this point, out entire party was starving and I told everyone to go ahead and get started (the server said my pancakes would be another minute).  Overall, each were about the most stereo-typically bland diner food you could ever get.  But, fast forward twenty minutes...  still no pancakes (and everyone else has finished).  Once the server finally made it back around, she mentioned something in passing about the apples on the pancake and left again (we had no idea what she said).  After another five minutes or so, my pancakes finally came out, and by this point, ready to leave, I succumbed to hunger and dove in.  Bland... bland... bland... and an associated stomach ache from the pure sugar rush.  After chewing through about half the plate, I gave up on it (I almost never leave food on the plate).  Ready to go, we asked for the check, with the one saving grace that redeemed Deluca's from one star being the server proactively taking the pancakes off of our tab.  Check this off the list as a one and done.

y7opJVN1oBdUtciIUoRtXQ.text: There's always a line that's how you know it's good. It's definitely worth the wait! I had the country fried chicken and chicken and waffles and both were phenomenal! Every time friends come to visit from out of town we always take them here for a great breakfast

IZRXRdGQ68E4JyM6iGFZ3w.text: This was some seriously good breakfast food. The place is crowded don't get me wrong (granted we only waited like 15 minutes or so to get seated). Those home fries with onions, peppers and cheese were absolutely killer. I got the Californian benedict (not sure if I'll order it again though - might have to go the traditional route next time). We were seated in the back booth, in front of people cooking and everything so it was fun to see all that (albeit a little hard to talk to the 3 people seated next to me). We also had waffles and the nutella crepes (delicious)!  I'll try to get back here soon and try some other stuff and update again.

Xs_YO63dCekYbLdbLnD4Rg.text: I had a breakfast burrito here.   It hit my stomach like a bomb.  Avoid the breakfast burrito.  Regardless, I really loved the ambiance here. It's greasy, it feels like it's 1972 and the servers are awesome.

GGBqYMDm5pqSiZ0Iq3eH-g.text: A very long line for lunch. Waited about 30 mins for a table. The food was good as other diners I been at. The pancakes were a bit flat then what I'm use to. The south of the border omelette was more of a egg scramble than omelette. The service was fast and the prices were good, but the line is long.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The pancakes from the breakfast of champs. A little flat than fluffy.
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. South of the border omelette. More of a scramble.
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast of Champs. Pancakes not pictured.

_Xt3OLP9KsBf1rC6DCLCVw.text: Dirty diner that has one of the best breakfasts in Pittsburgh. I love to eat here, but I do not like how the toast is always given to me 5 minutes after my eggs. Other than that this place is 5 stars!

T9uUd-rVEjDuMG5f-JJ8kg.text: Amazing homemade food, good service, great breakfast spot in the Strip District!

pm-eUam4si15l2kCHE81og.text: The pancakes, oh sweet calorie-laden goodness! Probably the best I've had in my life - and this is not an overstatement. We had a lunch plate (turkey triple decker) and a breakfast plate (short stack special). Both were excellent. This place is cash only and can have a line, but walked up at 1:45 and there was no line (there had been a good line at noon). The other reviews said the wait was worth it and though I didn't wait, I completely agree. If you're in the strip, eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

UZ0B-0gVXAMt6rOGCjsw5A.text: It is what it is. The original Pittsburgh greasy spoon. No frills here just good old fashioned GRUB. you cannot go wrong with anything. Coffee quickly served. Staff always friendly. Always a crowd. Be patient, take it all in, every walk of Pittsburgh life eats here.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

SieoGIHAhaIzA_N6CeZ5HA.text: Had the Italian Veggie, Border of South omelette, and Mediterranean Wrap.   Sorry, in conclusion, I won't be back.  Food was OK, the South omelette was pretty good, but not  something to wait for over 30 min after ordering and pay $10 each. I was so embarrassed taking my parents who were visiting me from a country over 6500 miles away.  Place was packed but didn't have a long waiting line outside on a Sunday 8AM right before Memorial Day. The couple seated after us were half done with their meal when we asked what happened to our order, and not even a "thanks for waiting" or "sorry to keep you waiting" look? And no bag to put the box in for left overs when another table gets one? Not a kind of service I would go back for.  Giving two stars simply for the one good omelette. If not, one star for this business.

FjvwYbwkY4Ip4Ydtu8iXTQ.text: I came here for a Saturday brunch. The line wasn't too long, but we still waited for about 20 minutes.   The menu is huge, so it was hard for me decide what to get. I ordered South Of The Border while my friend had french toast with scrambled eggs and bacon. The black tea and lemon he had was good, though it was probably because I never had tried them together before. His toast was good, but he wasn't so happy with the food overall.  Not because they're bad, but you expect getting better food than what you can cook at home. I was happy with my omelette and their home fries. The chorizo really spiced it up. I don't like the salsa or ketchup on it though.   The service was quick once we were seated. It took a while to get our food. Would I come back again? Yes if I don't need to wait.

hPj7hfE7bLvLuTVWwwvplA.text: My dad and I went to deluca's for breakfast while we were in Pittsburgh. We had heard that deluca's was very good, we also heard that it was always hard to get a seat. When we got there the line was just coming outside the door a little so we didn't expect much of a wait, but when we got there their was no wait. We were seated almost immediately at the front counter. I got the banana split hot cakes while my dad had the Pittsburg slam. My food was delicious, my dad also enjoyed his meal. The only thing that I could see as a problem is that a party of 3 or more would have to wait a while for seating.

cf1pJK_gnq7SDMetwKH_zw.text: Quick, no frills, but very tasty establishment. Get your hash browns extra crispy!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Where is she taking me....? Lol

5MWDOHZT9ibyn9WTjw5zNg.text: Came here for lunch today. Good breakfast food and didn't have to wait. Fast and great service.

J6WJDqIWjEG7uofqg4qm7g.text: I love good breakfast, authentic eateries, and a wild environment; and, Deluca's has it all. It's no surprise that one can wait up to an hour in a line snaking down the block for a table on Saturday or Sunday morning.  While my friend Chris and Callen were waiting in line for Pens tickets, I decided to hit up the Strip District and check out this breakfast institution. It's been featured on the Travel and Food networks, and I knew I was in store for something special. There was a huge line of people waiting in freezing weather. Since I was alone, I decided to try and skip the huge line and nab a seat at the bar, which was a stellar idea.  The service here was great. Although everyone working here was buzzing around at incredible speeds, they still regularly checked in on me. After I ordered my food, it came out quickly and I had my refills of coffee. The atmosphere here is my favorite part. A long, counter bar runs the length of the establishment. Behind it are cooks hard at work on equipment that must be at least fifty years old. It it's not broken, don't fix it! I was also in the back, in full veiw of a wipeboard that helps employees keep track of everything. They needed to order five box of coffee and also didn't want employees to forget the holiday bowling party.  Simply put: this place is fun.  The coffee is whatever, not bad, not great. For the food, I knew as soon as my eyes set on it: MOAB, or mother of all burritos. This was a huge soft tortilla filled with chorizo, scrambled eggs, hot banana peppers, tomatoes, onions, avocado and homefries. It's topped with salsa, cheddar and sour cream. Overall, delicious. There's a lot of flavors going on, but I really enjoyed this, and it was certainly filling enough to keep me going until dinner. Deluca's doesn't use the best ingredients, and it wasn't the most delicious breakfast, but I really enjoyed my visit. I'd go again.  Bottom Line: Enjoy the show by sitting at the bar. Marvel at the staff, and soak up the atmosphere. The food's not bad either. Cash only.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. MOAB
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

q8GP5tJHvqsLOUDxnHqmtw.text: The waitresses were more interested in talking to each other than waiting on tables. Once they took our order the food came fast and was good.

yuV4USCSZo9d1mXyXFqKcQ.text: This is the quintessential breakfast experience in Pittsburgh! I've been all over the world and eaten at some spectacular place and I can say that Deluca's ranks right up there with then. The service is a 10/10 with the staff that is fast, nice and very thorough. The food is fantastic diner food. I asked the waitress which omelette is the most ordered and the best tasting and without hesitation, she said the 'Deluca Omelette' which is a 4-egg omelette with all the fixin's inside it. WOW!! It was simply unbelievable. The coffee is awesome too!  From now on, this will be a staple for a family visit when we are in Pittsburgh next. Can not wait!

wcFeQWTE0FhVsEEH110FoA.text: If this is the best breakfast Pittsburgh has to offer, y'all need to get some better breakfast joints. I've been here twice and it was fine both times but nothing special. Coffee is average. Really don't understand what the fuss is about.

cbccsSMOtw_v3oUQM-Hhqg.text: Nothing special at all!!!  When my husband and I walked in, the waitress was serving coffee to a customer. .she shouted, " be with you guys in a minute"  she then gave us 2 menus and pointed and said, " sit at that table"     What hell?!!! Crazy rude and loud! I also saw a server at the register handling money and then go prep toast without washing her hands!  Yuk

c1lavRw7K0YROc0z6S-V1g.text: We have been here on our last two stops in Pittsburgh and it is awesome.  The first time I was here was Easter morning and the line was out the door.  The staff was super friendly and fast.  My son had a breakfast burritto with Chicken and it was HUGE and a growing 14 year olds dream breakfast.  This past week end I visited with my daughter as part of our visit to Univeristy of Pitt.  She loved it too.  She had the apple crepe's and gave it a big thumbs up.  I ordered the Pumpkin Pancakes (seasonal offering)  with eggs and sausage and was so very happy.    The service is amazing.  They are fast!  It's great to sit at the counter and watch the cooks.  Cracked eggs litter the floor.  The atmosphere is fun and has a great local flair.  Worth your time to walk the neighborhood and shop for meats, pasta, seasonings etc.  I will be back next time I am in Pittsburgh.

E4PeGHRzSVS7MATRP8DwxA.text: No two ways about it, this is a classic old style diner.  It has been in existance since 1951.  I went on a Fri morning and they were crowded but I was able to get a seat at the counter.  I was told that it would have been much busier on a sat or sun.  There was some disagreement between two waitresses as who would take my order.  A few sharp words were spoken between them.  First thing, the menu is a novel.  It takes too long to read it.  Places that concentrate on making a few items generally do a better job at it.    I didn't have to wait too long for my breakfast.  I ordered eggs benedict with a side of corned beef hash browns.  The eggs were cooked perfectly but the sauce was not a hollandaise and had no lemon flavor at all.  That detracted from the flavor.    One thing to know ahead of time is that they only take cash.  No credit cards.  Apparently this is somewhat common in the Strip from what I was told.

QkUYJ8Z0hr0_qmB5sXDFUg.text: The signature breakfast burrito was a dud. A tortilla wrapped around some greasy bacon and home fries with some dry scrambled eggs served with a glop of canned refried beans.  The waffled sundae was good but too pricey.  This place is typical of what was once a quaint hole in the wall diner that served good food, but became popular and now just cranks out mediocre food.  Is crowded because of its rep not for the quality of its food.

1M13CpYSYZD-0XgWxTZ6Tw.text: Giant portions. Fast and furious service. Good value.  A really fun diner experience.

wBJMsTNKfdl8kye7huYEHg.text: The highlights: Good servers that keep checking in on you as necessary. Everyone we talked to was very nice. Very good pancakes, whether they're plain or with syrup. Great home fries. Very crispy and oily, just as i would hope for. Good eggs Good crispy bacon  The lowlights: They don't offer pure maple syrup, even for an extra charge. I know it's expensive to give out, but I'd gladly pay for it. Weak coffee / iced coffee. It's pretty terrible, actually. Also, their only sugar sub. is knockoff sweet n low. Our waitress was great and offered me acouple of Splenda from her own stash. It's a small thing.  Notes: Milkshake was thin but tasty and service was fast. I'd come back here if i were in the city!

OkYlMkcoqnlgwXENgW8giw.text: The portions are big; the food is good; the kitchen is quick; and the prices are reasonable.  What more could you want in a greasy spoon?  I finally got around to trying this Pittsburgh landmark in the Strip District, and I was pleasantly surprised by what I found.  The pancakes were delicious (thick and rich), and everything else was acceptable or better--not to mention plentiful (with my meal I received a mountain of home fries, eggs, bacon, sausage and toast...not bad, especially given the prices).  The one strike against this place (aside from the waits if you come at peak times) was that the waiter acknowledged but then ignored all requests for drink refills, leaving me thirsty for more water and my companion rationing the smallest $2 cup of diner coffee anyone ever received.  If I find this issue persistent over multiple visits (and I'll certainly be back), that will probably cost them a star, but for now I'll overlook one server having one bad day and give this place a reasonably enthusiastic endorsement.  Deluca's is too good a value to not try again.

0_rRooXwThUpNEt1sYIa7A.text: As with any place in the Strip there is a wait on the weekends. However, whether coming here for breakfast or lunch it is worth the wait. Delicious Diner food and fast service.

4l6809xoUss9WnE71E20zQ.text: My first visit to Pittsburgh. I love little greasy diners, and Deluca's was great. I ate the "Pigs in a Blanket" crepe and ordered a chocolate milkshake as well. Both were very delicious, and I would love to try some of the other items on their menu. I love breakfast, greasy diners and paying in cash (the last one is a lie).   I would definitely go back.

QM54TOZ2vUK7x6NoABYviA.text: Nice food but really oversold.  It has everything you can try but really not up to the par everyone raves about.  I'm vegetarian so options might be limited but not that impressed.  Home fries are good but really unhygienic when you see these guys making it.  No reservations so have to stand outside.

t85TxhB3PyUK7M0T8b01Mw.text: I'm not really sure what all the hype is about this place. We read all the raving reviews, watched the appearance of this place on Man vs. Food, and were pumped to go. Maybe our expectations were too high. We waited in line for 45 minutes and our waitress was less than welcoming. She finally came to get our drink order after almost 10 minutes of us being there. We were chatting and the menu is huge, so we didn't know what we wanted to order yet...if looks could kill!!! Our waitress was obviously not happy about that. Once we finally ordered, it took a good 30 minutes for our food and this is how it went: Waitress comes to table, drops off my fiance's food and doesn't say a single word. I sit there with no food, wondering where mine is with no waitress in sight. After 5 minutes, I tell my fiance I appreciate his kindness, but his food is getting cold, so he digs in. 5 more minutes, the waitress finally comes and drops my food off along with the check, never asking if we had everything or needed anything else. We eat our typical diner food (huge portions, though), pay our bill, and never looked back.   My theory is that the line is so long because it really does take forever just to get any sort of basic service here.  I was also horrified to read the food inspection report, especially seeing that they failed like 3 times before they actually passed. The sad part is, after being there, I wasn't really surprised at all. So if anyone has any good recommendations for Pittsburgh's actual best breakfast at a place with better service that is clean, I would really appreciate that! This just wasn't it for me, but to each their own.

8zPDA-GmdNFGhZhyzyjYvw.text: I am not a fan of diners, but this place was great.  They don't win people over with high quality ingredients, but who cares when it tastes this good!  Service was great, seated right away.  Cash only.  Great breakfast burritos and sweet breakfast options.

jQnB2pdW9WVwfWLsmuCytw.text: Yinzers really get fired up for breakfast. Tasted like.... breakfast. The breakfast burrito was solid but the wait was absurd. Unless there's no line will not be back

KxmuwtQDqLRTJw94Yn0LMg.text: Delucas,  the iconic Pittsburgh breakfast spot in the strip. People rave about this place and Pamelas, and to both i wonder why?   I see lines of people waiting outside of Deluca's and I wonder how many of these are returning customers or people just inspired by the novelty.  This is not to say its bad, but it IS overrated.  My better half and I both arrived with starving appetites, and the portions were very generous. I give them kudos for prompt service in the malestrom of customers. The menu options are diverse and unique. Perhaps if I try more I could revamp my opinion.  I ordered a concoction of fried chicken, gravy, home fries and scrambled eggs. It was greasy and tasty, but maybe my expectations were too high? Perhaps I have also been spoiled by similar food elsewhere in Pittsburgh that remains off the beaten path and for half the price. Thanks Delucas, it was fun, but its me...not you. We can still be friends right?

6BJhOE-2Aqedx08rzq19lA.text: Deluca's you little famous gem you, so coveted that your loyal patrons and out of towners wind around the door and and down street for breakfast. What is to say that cannot already be said....  I've eaten here a couple of times, I loved the bacon it was thicker cut, plenty of it they definitely do not do wimpy portions here. This is an arggh meat and potatoes and off to work the railroad or steel mill type joint.   I do not love their home fries or has browns, whichever they are kind of flavorless, I also did not love their huevos rancheros idea ~ why put it on the menu if it doesn't have the right beans or any beans? There are other menu options which are ok but not much diversity on the menu. Seating is tight and tiny it gets very sweaty in the summer.   Cash only.... so be ready with a fistful of green (naw you won't really need a fistful prices are actually pretty moderate here.
